Manx: As cha row fys echyssyn v’er ny lheihys, quoi v’eh : son va Yeesey er gholl dy liattee veih’n chaglym mooar dy leih ayns y voayl shen.

English: 14 Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole : sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.
Manx: Ny lurg shen hooar Yeesey Eh ayns y chiamble, as dooyrt Eh rish, Cur-my-ner, t’ow er dy [sic: dty] laanaghey : ny jean peccah ny smoo, er aggle dy jig red smessey ort.

English: 15 The man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.
Manx: Jimmee yn dooinney roish, as dinsh Eh da ny Hewnyn dy nee Yeesey v’er ny laanaghey eh.

English: 16 And therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.
Manx: As er-yn-oyr shen ren ny Hewnyn tranlaase er Yeesey, as v’ad shirrey Eh y chur gy baase, er-y-fa dy row Eh er n’yannoo ny reddyn shoh er laa’n doonaght.

English: 17 ¶But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, and I work.
Manx: Agh dreggyr Yeesey ad, Ta my Ayr gobbraghey derrey nish, as ta mish gobbraghey.

English: 18 Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.
Manx: Shen-y-fa va ny Hewnyn shirrey ny smoo Eh y varroo ; er-yn[-]oyr dy row Eh cha nee ynrycan er vrishey yn doonaght, agh er ghra myrgeddin dy nee Jee va’n Ayr echey, jannoo Eh hene corrym rish Jee.

English: 19 Then answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do : for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise.
Manx: Eisht dreggyr Yeesey, as dooyrt Eh roo, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Cha vod y Mac nhee erbee y yannoo jeh hene, agh ny t’eh fakin yn Ayr dy yannoo : son cre-erbee ny reddyn t’eh dy yannoo, ad shen myrgeddin ta’n Mac er yn un aght dy yannoo.

English: 20 For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth : and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.
Manx: Son ta’n Ayr graihagh er y Mac, as t’eh soilshaghey da dy chooilley nhee t’eh hene dy yannoo : as soilshee Eh da obbraghyn smoo na ad shoh, dy vod shiu yindyss y ghoaill.

English: 21 For as the Father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth them ; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will.
Manx: Son myr ta’n Ayr troggal seose as bioghey ny merriu : myr shen ta’n Mac bioghey yn vooinjer saïllish.

English: 22 For the Father judgeth no man, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son :
Manx: Son cha vel yn Ayr briwnys dooinney erbee ; agh t’eh er livrey dy chooilley vriwnys gys y Mac :

English: 23 That all men should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him.
Manx: Dy voddagh dy chooilley ghooinney ooashley choyrt da’n Mac, ’naght myr t’ad cur ooashley da’n Ayr. Eshyn nagh vel cur ooashley da’n Mac, cha vel Eh cur ooashley da’n Ayr ren y choyrt Eh.

English: 24 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and shall not come into condemnation ; but is passed from death unto life.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Eshyn ta clashtyn my ghoo’s, as credjal aynsyn t’er my choyrt, ta’n vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey, as cha jig Eh gys coal-anmey ; agh t’eh er gholl veih baase gys bea.

English: 25 Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God : and they that hear shall live.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Ta’n oor cheet, as nish ayn, tra chlinnys ny merriu coraa Mac Yee : as bee adsyn chlinnys bio.

English: 26 For as the Father hath life in himself ; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself ;
Manx: Son ’naght myr t’ec yn Ayr bioys ayn hene ; myr shen t’eh er choyrt da’n Mac bioys y ve echey ayn hene ;

English: 27 And hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man.
Manx: As t’eh er choyrt da pooar dy choyrt briwnys myrgeddin, er-y-fa dy nee yn Mac dooinney Eh.

English: 28 Marvel not at this : for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,
Manx: Ny gow-jee yindyss jeh shoh : son ta’n oor cheet, tra chlinnys ooilley ny t’ayns ny oaiaghyn e choraa,

English: 29 And shall come forth ; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life ; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation.
Manx: As hig ad magh ; adsyn t’er n’yannoo dy mie, gys irree-seose-reesht y vea ; as adsyn t’er n’yannoo dy olk, gys irree-seose-reesht y choal-anmey.

English: 30 I can of mine own self do nothing : as I hear, I judge : and my judgment is just ; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me.
Manx: Cha voddym jee’m pene nhee erbee y yannoo : myr ta mee clashtyn, ta mee briwnys : as ta my vriwnys cairagh, er-yn-oyr nagh vel mee shirrey my aigney hene, agh aigney yn Ayr t’er my choyrt.

English: 31 If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.
Manx: My ta mee gymmyrkey feanish jee’m pene, cha vel my eanish firrinagh.

English: 32 ¶There is another that beareth witness of me ; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
Manx: Ta fer elley ta gymmyrkey feanish jee’m, as ta fys aym dy vel yn eanish t’eh dy ymmyrkey jee’m firrinagh.

English: 33 Ye sent unto John, and he bare witness unto the truth.
Manx: Hug shiuish fys gys Ean, as dymmyrk Eh feanish gys yn irriney.

English: 34 But I receive not testimony from man : but these things I say, that ye might be saved.
Manx: Agh cha vel mish goaill feanish veih dooinney : agh ny reddyn shoh ta mee dy ghra, dy vod shiu v’er nyn sauail.

English: 35 He was a burning and a shining light : and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light.
Manx: Ve eshyn ny chainle va lossey dy sollys : as va shiu booiagh son earish boggey ghoaill ayns y soilshey echey.

English: 36 ¶But I have greater witness than that of John : for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.
Manx: Agh ta feanish smoo ayms na ren Ean y choyrt : son ny obbraghyn hug my Ayr dou dy chooilleeney, ny obbraghyn cheddin ta mee dy yannoo, t’ad gymmyrkey feanish jee’m, dy vel yn Ayr er my choyrt.

English: 37 And the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape.
Manx: As ta’n Ayr hene t’er my choyrt, er n’ymmyrkey feanish jee’m. Cha vel shiuish er chlashtyn e choraa ec traa erbee, ny er vakin e chaslys.

English: 38 And ye have not his word abiding in you : for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not.
Manx: As cha vel yn goo echyssyn eu tannaghtyn ayndiu : son eshyn t’eh er ny choyrt, aynsyn cha vel shiu credjal.

English: 39 ¶Search the scriptures ; for in them ye think ye have eternal life : and they are they which testify of me.
Manx: Shir-jee magh ny scriptyryn, son ayndoosyn ta shiu smooinaghtyn dy vel y vea veayn eu, as she ad shen ta gymmyrkey feanish jeem’s.

English: 40 And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.
Manx: As cha vel shiu booiagh cheet hym, dy vod bea y ve eu.

English: 41 I receive not honour from men.
Manx: Cha vel mish soiaghey jeh gloyr deiney.

English: 42 But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you.
Manx: Agh ta toiggal aym jiuish, nagh vel graih Yee ayndiu.

English: 43 I am come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not : if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.
Manx: Ta mish er jeet ayns ennym my Ayrey, as cha vel shiu goaill rhym : my hig fer elley ayns e ennym hene, rishyn nee shiu goaill.

English: 44 How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, and seek not the honour that cometh from God only?
Manx: Kys oddys shiu credjal ta geddyn gloyr yn derrey yeh veih’n jeh elley, as nagh vel shirrey yn ghloyr ta veih Jee ny lomarcan?

English: 45 Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father : there is one that accuseth you, even Moses, in whom ye trust.
Manx: Ny smooinee-jee dy loayryms nyn oi eu rish yn Ayr : ta ayn ta loayrt nyn oi eu, ta shen, Moses, ayn ta shiu treishteil.

English: 46 For had ye believed Moses, ye would have believed me ; for he wrote of me.
Manx: Son dy beagh shiu er chredjal Moses, veagh shiu er my chredjal’s ; son scrieu Eh jee’m.

English: 47 But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?
Manx: Agh mannagh gred shiu ny ren eshyn y scrieu, kys nee shiu my ghoan’s y chredjal?
CAB. VI.

English: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.
Manx: Ny lurg shoh hie Yeesey harrish faarkey Ghalilee ny Tiberias.

English: 2 And a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.
Manx: As deiyr earroo mooar dy leih er, er-y-fa dy vaik ad ny mirrilyn dobbree Eh orroosyn va doghanit.

English: 3 And Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.
Manx: As hie Yeesey seose er slieau, as hoie Eh ayns shen marish yn vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er.

English: 4 And the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.
Manx: As va’n Chaisht, feailley ny Hewnyn er-gerrey.

English: 5 ¶When Jesus then lifted up his eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence shall we buy bread, that these may eat?
Manx: Tra va Yeesey eisht er hroggal seose e hooyllyn, as er chur tastey da sheshaght vooar cheet huggey, dooyrt Eh rish Philip, Cre-woish oddys mad arran y chionnaghey dy vod ad shoh gee?

English: 6 And this he said to prove him : for he himself knew what he would do.
Manx: (As shoh dooyrt Eh dy phrowal Eh : son va fys echey hene cre yinnagh Eh)

English: 7 Philip answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.
Manx: Dreggyr Phillip Eh, Cha vel feagh daa cheead ping dy arran dy liooar er nyn son oc, dy vod dy chooilley annane oc red beg y ghoaill.

English: 8 One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, saith unto him,
Manx: Dooyrt annane jeh ny ostyllyn echey, Andreays, braar Simon Peddyr, rish,

English: 9 There is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes : but what are they among so many?
Manx: Ta guylley beg ayns shoh ta queig bwilleenyn oarn echey, as daa eeast veggey ; agh cre t’ad shen mastey whilleen?

English: 10 And Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
Manx: As dooyrt Yeesey, Cur-jee er ny deiney soie sheese. Nish va lane faiyr ayns yn ynnyd. Myr shen hoie ny deiney sheese ayns earroo mysh queig thousaneyn.

English: 11 And Jesus took the loaves ; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down ; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.
Manx: As ghow Yeesey ny bwilleenyn, as tra v’eh er chur booise, reynn Eh ad er y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er, as reynn adsyn ad orroosyn va erreish soie sheese ; as myrgeddin jeh ny eeastyn wheesh as bailloo.

English: 12 When they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather up the fragments that remain, that nothing be lost.
Manx: Tra v’ad jeant magh, dooyrt Eh rish y vooinjer va sheer marish, Jean-jee yn vrooilliagh ta er-mayrn y haglym cooidjagh nagh bee veg caillit.

English: 13 Therefore they gathered them together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.
Manx: Shen-y-fa ren ad eh y haglym, as lhieen ad daa vasket jeig lesh brooilliagh ny queig bwilleenyn oarn, va er-mayrn erreish daue v’er n’ee.

English: 14 Then those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny deiney shen, tra v’ad er vakin yn mirril ren Yeesey. She shoh ayns firrinys yn phadeyr shen va dy heet gys y theihll.

English: 15 ¶When Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.
Manx: Tra dennee Yeesey er-y-fa shen dy darragh ad, as dy goghe ad Eh er niart, dy yannoo Eh ny ree, hie Eh seose reesht er slieau Eh hene ny lomarcan.

English: 16 And when even was now come, his disciples went down unto the sea,
Manx: As tra va’n fastyr ayn, hie yn vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er sheese gys y cheayn.

English: 17 And entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.
Manx: As hie ad ayns lhong, as haink ad harrish y cheayn gys Capernaum : as ve nish dorraghey, as cha row Yeesey er jeet huc.

English: 18 And the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
Manx: As dirree yn keayn, kyndagh rish geay vooar va sheidey.

English: 19 So when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship : and they were afraid.
Manx: Myr shen tra v’ad er n’ymmyrt mysh kiare veeilley, honnick ad Yeesey walkal er y cheayn, as tayrn er-gerrey da’n lhong : as ghow ad aggle.

English: 20 But he saith unto them, It is I ; be not afraid.
Manx: Agh dooyrt eshyn roo, She mish t’ayn, ny bee-jee agglagh.

English: 21 Then they willingly received him into the ship : and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.
Manx: Eisht ghow ad Eh dy harryltagh stiagh ayns y lhong : as chelleeragh va’n lhong ec y thalloo raad v’ad goll.

English: 22 ¶The day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but that his disciples were gone away alone ;
Manx: Yn laa er-giyn, tra honnick yn pobble va nyn shassoo er y cheu elley jeh’n cheayn nagh row baatey erbee elley ayns shen, cheu-mooie jeh’n un vaatey shen, ayn va’n vooinjer va sheer marish er gholl, as nagh jagh Yeesey maroosyn ayns y vaatey, agh dy row yn vooinjer va sheer marish er gholl ersooyl nyn lomarcan :

English: 23 (Howbeit there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks :)
Manx: (Ny-yeih va baatyn elley er jeet veih Tiberias, er-gerrey da’n boayl ren ad arran y ee ayn, erreish da’n Chiarn v’er chur booise)

English: 24 When the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
Manx: Tra honnick y pobble er-y-fa shen nagh row Yeesey ayns shen, ny’n vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er, ghow adsyn myrgeddin luingys, as haink ad gys Capernaum, briaght son Yeesey.

English: 25 And when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?
Manx: As tra hooar ad Eh er y cheu elley jeh’n cheayn, dooyrt ad rish, Rabbi, Cooin haink oo ayns shoh?

English: 26 Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because ye saw the miracles, but because ye did eat of the loaves, and were filled.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, as dooyrt Eh, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Ta shiu dy my hirrey’s, cha nee er-yn-oyr dy vaik shiu ny mirrillyn, agh son dy ren shiu gee jeh ny bwilleenyn, as dy row shiu jeant magh.

English: 27 Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you : for him hath God the Father sealed.
Manx: Ny labree-jee son y beaghey ta cherraghtyn, agh son y beaghey shen ta tannaghtyn gys y vea veayn, nee yn Mac dooinney y choyrt diu : son eshyn ta Jee yn Ayr er sealal.

English: 28 Then said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Cre nee mainyn, dy vod mayd obbraghyn Yee y obbraghey?

English: 29 Jesus answered and said unto them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom he hath sent.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt Eh roo, Shoh obbyr Yee, shiu dy chredjal aynsyn t’eh er ny choyrt.

English: 30 They said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?
Manx: Dooyrt ad er-y-fa shen rish, Cre’n cowrey t’ow dy yeeaghyn eisht, dy vod mad fakin, as credjal aynyd? cre t’ow dy obbraghey?

English: 31 Our fathers did eat manna in the desert ; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.
Manx: Diee ny ayraghyn ain manna ayns yn aasagh ; myr te scruit, Hug Eh daue arran veih niau dy ee.

English: 32 Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Moses gave you not that bread from heaven ; but my Father giveth you the true bread from heaven.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Cha dug Moses diu yn arran shen veih niau, agh my Ayr ta coyrt diu yn arran firrinagh veih niau.

English: 33 For the bread of God is he which cometh down from heaven, and giveth life unto the world.
Manx: Son arran Yee eshyn ta cheet neose veih niau, as ta cur e vioys son y seihll.

English: 34 Then said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Dy bragh cur dooinyn arran shoh.

English: 35 And Jesus said unto them, I am the bread of life : he that cometh to me shall never hunger ; and he that believeth on me shall never thirst.
Manx: As dooyrt Yeesey roo, Mish arran y vea : eshyn ta cheet hym’s, cha bee Eh dy bragh accryssagh ; as eshyn ta credjal aynym, cha bee Eh dy bragh paagh.

English: 36 But I said unto you, That ye also have seen me, and believe not.
Manx: Agh ta mish er ghra riu, dy vel shiu myrgeddin er my akin’s, as nagh vel shiu credjal.

English: 37 All that the Father giveth me shall come to me ; and him that cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.
Manx: Nee ooilley ny ta’n Ayr dy chur dou, cheet hym ; as eshyn ta cheet hym, cha jeanym er aght erbee y hilgey magh.

English: 38 For I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.
Manx: Son haink mish neose veih niau, cha nee dy yannoo my aigney hene, agh yn aigney echyssyn ren my choyrt.

English: 39 And this is the Father’s will which hath sent me, that of all which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up again at the last day.
Manx: As shoh aigney yn Ayr ta er my choyrt, jeh ooilley ny hug Eh dou nagh gaillin veg, agh dy droggin eh seose reesht ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 40 And this is the will of him that sent me, that every one which seeth the Son, and believeth on him, may have everlasting life : and I will raise him up at the last day.
Manx: As shoh yn aigney echyssyn ta er my choyrt, dy chooilley annane ta fakin yn Mac as credjal ayn, yn vea dy dragh [sic: bragh] farraghtyn dy ve echey : as troggyms Eh seose ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 41 The Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I am the bread which came down from heaven.
Manx: Eisht va ny Hewnyn jymmoosagh rish, er-y-fa dy dooyrt Eh, Mish arran y vea haink neose veih niau.

English: 42 And they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from heaven?
Manx: As dooyrt ad, Nagh nee shoh Yeesey mac Yoseph, yn ayr as y voir echey shione dooin? kys eisht dy vel Eh gra, Haink mee neose veih niau.

English: 43 Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur not among yourselves.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey er-y-fa shen as dooyrt Eh roo, Ny lig da jymmoose ve nyn mast’ eu.

English: 44 No man can come to me, except the Father which hath sent me draw him : and I will raise him up at the last day.
Manx: Cha vod dooinney erbee cheet hym’s, mannagh jean yn Ayr t’er my choyrt y hayrn Eh : as troggyms Eh seose ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 45 It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every man therefore that hath heard, and hath learned of the Father, cometh unto me.
Manx: Te scruit ayns ny phadeyryn, As bee ad ooilley ynsit liorish Jee. Dy chooilley ghooinney er-y-fa shen t’er chlashtyn, as er nynsaghey veih yn Ayr, t’eh cheet hym’s.

English: 46 Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.
Manx: Cha nee dy vel dooinney erbee er vakin yn Ayr, cheu-mooie jehsyn ta veih Jee, t’eh shen er vakin yn Ayr.

English: 47 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath everlasting life.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Eshyn ta credjal aynyms ta’n vea ta dy bragh farraghtyn echey.

English: 48 I am that bread of life.
Manx: Mish arran y vea.

English: 49 Your fathers did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.
Manx: Diee ny ayraghyn eu manna ayns yn aasagh, as t’ad marroo.

English: 50 This is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may eat thereof, and not die.
Manx: Shoh yn arran ta cheet neose veih niau, dy vod dooinney gee jeh, as gyn baase y gheddyn.

English: 51 I am the living bread which came down from heaven : if any man eat of this bread, he shall live for ever : and the bread that I will give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.
Manx: Mish yn arran bio, haink neose veih niau : my ee-ys dooinney erbee jeh’n arran shoh, bee Eh bio son dy bragh : as yn arran neem’s y choyrt, she my eill eh, verrym son bioys y seihll.

English: 52 The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?
Manx: Ren ny Hewnyn er-y-fa shen streeu nyn mast’ oc hene, gra, Kys oddys y dooinney shoh e eill y chur dooin dy ee?

English: 53 Then Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except ye eat the flesh of the Son of man, and drink his blood, ye have no life in you.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Mannagh jean shiu feill yn Mac dooinney y ee, as e uill y iu, cha vel y vea eu ayndiu.

English: 54 Whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath eternal life ; and I will raise him up at the last day.
Manx: Eshyn ta gee my eill, as giu my uill, ta’n vea veayn echey, as troggyms Eh seose ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 55 For my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.
Manx: Son dy firrinagh she bee my eill, as dy firrinagh she jough my uill.

English: 56 He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.
Manx: Eshyn ta gee my eill as giu my uill, t’eh vaghey aynyms, as mish aynsyn.

English: 57 As the living Father hath sent me, and I live by the Father : so he that eateth me, even he shall live by me.
Manx: Myr ta’n Ayr bio er my choyrt’s, as ta mee bio liorish yn Ayr : myr shen neesht vees eshyn ta dy my ee’s, bio liorym.

English: 58 This is that bread which came down from heaven : not as your fathers did eat manna, and are dead : he that eateth of this bread shall live for ever.
Manx: Shoh yn arran haink neose veih niau ; cha nee myr ren ny ayraghyn eu manna y ee, as t’ad marroo : bee eshyn ta gee jeh’n arran shoh, bio son dy bragh.

English: 59 These things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.
Manx: Ny goan shoh loayr Eh ayns y cheeill, myr v’eh gynsaghey ayns Capernaum.

English: 60 Many therefore of his disciples, when they had heard this, said, This is an hard saying ; who can hear it?
Manx: Dooyrt ymmodee er-y-fa shen jeh’n vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er, tra cheayll ad shoh, Shoh raa creoi, quoi oddys y chlashtyn eh?

English: 61 When Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth this offend you?
Manx: Tra va fys ec Yeesey ayn hene dy row yn vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er jymmo[o]sagh son shoh, dooyrt Eh roo, Vel shoh cheet ayns raad y chredjue eu?

English: 62 What and if ye shall see the Son of man ascend up where he was before?
Manx: Cre my hee shiu Mac yn dooinney goll seose raad v’eh roie?

English: 63 It is the spirit that quickeneth ; the flesh profiteth nothing : the words that I speak unto you, they are spirit, and they are life.
Manx: She yn spyrryd ta bioghey, cha vel yn eill jannoo veg y vie : ny goan ta mish dy loayrt riu, t’ad spyrryd as t’ad bea.

English: 64 But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.
Manx: Agh ta paart jiuish nagh vel credjal. Son va fys ec Yeesey er dyn toshiaght, quoi v’ad nagh row credjal, as quoi yinnagh Eh y vrah.

English: 65 And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no man can come unto me, except it were given unto him of my Father.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh, Shen-y-fa dooyrt mish riu, nagh vod dooinney erbee cheet hym’s, mannagh bee eh er ny choyrt da liorish my Ayr.

English: 66 ¶From that time many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.
Manx: Veih yn traa shen hie ymmodee jeh’n vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er back, as cha huïll ad arragh marish.

English: 67 Then said Jesus unto the twelve, Will ye also go away?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish y daa ostyl yeig, Jed shiuish myrgeddin reue?

English: 68 Then Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
Manx: Eisht dreggyr Simon Peddyr Eh, Hiarn, quoi gys hemmad? ayds ta goan y vea veayn.

English: 69 And we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.
Manx: As ta shin credjal, as shickyr jeh dy nee uss yn Creest, Mac y Jee bio.

English: 70 Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you is a devil?
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Nagh vel mish er reih shiuish yn ghaa yeig, as ta annane eu ny youyll?

English: 71 He spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon : for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.
Manx: Loayr Eh jeh Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon : son eshyn Eh va dy vrah Eh, as v’eh fer jeh’n daa ostyl yeig.
CAB. VII.

English: After these things Jesus walked in Galilee : for he would not walk in Jewry, because the Jews sought to kill him.
Manx: Ny lurg shoh huïll Yeesey ayns Galilee : son cha row Eh booiagh shooyll ayns Judea, er-yn-oyr dy row ny Hewnyn shirrey Eh y varroo.

English: 2 Now the Jew’s feast of tabernacles was at hand.
Manx: Nish va feailley cabbane-agglish ny Hewnyn er-gerrey.

English: 3 His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest.
Manx: Dooyrt Eh [sic: e] vraaraghyn er-y-fa shen rish, Gow royd as shoh, as immee gys Judea, dy vod y vooinjer ta sheer geiyrt ort myrgeddin fakin ny obbraghyn t’ow dy yannoo.

English: 4 For there is no man that doeth any thing in secret, and he himself seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to the world.
Manx: Son cha vel dooinney erbee ta jannoo nhee erbee dy follit, as Eh hene shirrey enney v’er ny chur er dy foshlit : My t’ow jannoo ny reddyn shoh, soilshee oo hene da’n seihll.

English: 5 For neither did his brethren believe in him.
Manx: Son chamoo row e vraaraghyn hene credjal ayn.

English: 6 Then Jesus said unto them, My time is not yet come : but your time is alway ready.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Cha vel my hraa’s foast er jeet : agh ta’n traa eauish kinjagh aarloo.

English: 7 The world cannot hate you ; but me it hateth, because I testify of it, that the works thereof are evil.
Manx: Cha vod y seihll feoh chur diuish, agh dooys te cur feoh ; er-y-fa dy vel mee gymmyrkey feanish jeh, dy vel ny obbraghyn echey olk.

English: 8 Go ye up unto this feast : I go not up yet unto this feast : for my time is not yet full come.
Manx: Gow-jee shiuish seose gys yn eailley shoh : cha vel mish goll seose foast gys yn eailley shoh, er-yn-oyr nagh vel my hraa foast er jeet.

English: 9 When he had said these words unto them, he abode still in Galilee.
Manx: Tra v’eh er ghra ny goan shoh roo, duirree Eh myr v’eh ayns Galilee.

English: 10 ¶But when his brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.
Manx: Agh tra va e vraaraghyn er gholl seose, eisht hie eshyn myrgeddin seose gys yn eailley, cha nee dy foshlit, agh myr dy beagh eh dy follit.

English: 11 Then the Jews sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?
Manx: Eisht va ny Hewnyn briaght er e hon ec yn eailley, as dooyrt ad, Cre vel Eh?

English: 12 And there was much murmuring among the people concerning him : for some said, He is a good man : others said, Nay ; but he deceiveth the people.
Manx: As va lane jymmoose mastey yn pobble mychione echey : son va paart gra, She dooinney mie Eh : as feallagh elley gra, Cha nee ; agh t’eh molley yn pobble.

English: 13 Howbeit no man spake openly of him for fear of the Jews.
Manx: Ny-yeih, cha loayr dooinney erbee dy foshlit jeh, goaill aggle roish ny Hewnyn.

English: 14 ¶Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.
Manx: Nish er y chiarroo[2] laa jeh’n eailley, hie Yeesey seose gys y chiamble, as dynsee Eh.

English: 15 And the Jews marvelled, saying, How knoweth this man letters, having never learned?
Manx: As ghow ny Hewnyn yindyss, gra, Kys ta toiggal ec y dooinney shoh jeh ynsagh, as nagh jagh Eh er cur roish?

English: 16 Jesus answered them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, as dooyrt Eh, Cha vel my ynsagh lhiam’s, agh leshyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 17 If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of God, or whether I speak of myself.
Manx: My vees dooinney erbee booiagh e aigney y yannoo, yiow Eh toiggal jeh’n ynsagh, nee veih Jee te, ny vel mee loayrt jee’m pene.

English: 18 He that speaketh of himself seeketh his own glory : but he that seeketh his glory that sent him, the same is true, and no unrighteousness is in him.
Manx: Eshyn ta loayrt jeh hene, t’eh shirrey e ghloyr hene : agh eshyn ta shirrey yn ghloyr echyssyn t’er ny choyrt Eh, t’eh shen firrinagh, as cha vel neu-chairys erbee ayn.

English: 19 Did not Moses give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the law? Why go ye about to kill me?
Manx: Nagh dug Moses yn leigh diu, as cha vel annane eu freayll yn leigh? Cre’n-fa ta shiu shirrey my vioys y ghoaill?

English: 20 The people answered and said, Thou hast a devil : who goeth about to kill thee?
Manx: Dreggyr y pobble Eh, as dooyrt ad, Ta drogh-spyrryd ayd : Quoi ta shirrey dty vioys y ghoaill?

English: 21 Jesus answered and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt Eh roo, Ta mish er n’yannoo un obbyr, as ta shiu ooilley goaill yindyss.

English: 22 Moses therefore gave unto you circumcision ; (not because it is of Moses, but of the fathers ;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcise a man.
Manx: Hug Moses er-y-fa shen yn giarey-chymmylt diu, (cha nee son dy vel Eh jeh Moses, agh jeh ny ayraghyn) as ta shiu er laa yn doonaght giarey chymmylt dooinney.

English: 23 If a man on the sabbath day receive circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken ; are ye angry at me, because I have made a man every whit whole on the sabbath day?
Manx: My ta dooinney er y doonaght goaill giarey-chymmylt, son nagh bee leigh Voses er ny vrishey ; vel shiuish jymmoosagh rhyms, er-y-fa dy vel mee er n’yannoo dooinney ooilley magh slaane er y doonaght?

English: 24 Judge not according to the appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
Manx: Ny briwnys-jee myr ta reddyn jeeaghyn dy ve cheu mooie, agh jean-jee briwnys cairagh y vriwnys.

English: 25 Then said some of them of Jerusalem, Is not this he, whom they seek to kill?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt paart jeusyn va veih Jerusalem, Nagh nee shoh Eh t’ad shirrey y varroo?

English: 26 But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?
Manx: Agh cur-my-ner, t’eh loayrt dy foshlit, as cha vel ad loayrt veg noi : vel dy jarroo fys ec ny fir-reïl dy nee shoh yn Creest firrinagh?

English: 27 Howbeit we know this man whence he is : but when Christ cometh, no man knoweth whence he is.
Manx: Ny-yeih ta enney ain er y dooinney shoh cre-woish t’eh : agh tra hig Creest, cha bee fys ec dooinney erbee cre-woish t’eh.

English: 28 Then cried Jesus in the temple as he taught, saying, Ye both know me, and ye know whence I am : and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye know not.
Manx: Eisht deïe Yeesey ayns y chiamble myr v’eh gynsaghey, gra, Ta chammah enney eu orryms, as ta fys eu cre-woish ta mee : as cha vel mish er jeet jee’m pene, agh te eshyn t’er my choyrt firrinagh, eshyn cha nione diu.

English: 29 But I know him : for I am from him, and he hath sent me.
Manx: Agh shione dooys Eh, son ta mee veih, as t’eh er my choyrt.

English: 30 Then they sought to take him : but no man laid hands on him, because his hour was not yet come.
Manx: Eisht v’ad shirrey y ghoaill Eh : agh cha dug dooinney erbee laue er, son nagh row yn oor echey foast er jeet.

English: 31 And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this man hath done?
Manx: As ren ymmodee jeh’n pobble credjal ayn, as gra, Tra hig Creest, jean Eh ny sliee mirril na ad shoh ta’n dooinney shoh er n’yannoo?

English: 32 ¶The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him ; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.
Manx: Cheayll ny Phariseeyn dy row taggloo yn pobble er yn aght shoh mychione echey : as hug ny Phariseeyn as ny ard-saggyrtyn magh fir-oik dy ghoaill Eh.

English: 33 Then said Jesus unto them, Yet a little while am I with you, and then I go unto him that sent me.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Foast tammylt beg ta mish mêriu, as eisht ta mee goll huggeysyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 34 Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me : and where I am, thither ye cannot come.
Manx: Shirree shiu, as cha vow shiu mee : as y raad ta mee, cha vod shiu cheet.

English: 35 Then said the Jews among themselves, Whither will he go, that we shall not find him? will he go unto the dispersed among the Gentiles, and teach the Gentiles?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn nyn mast’ oc hene, C’raad hed Eh, nagh vow mad Eh? jed Eh dy ynsaghey ny Greekyn t’er nyn skeayley mastey ny Ashoonyn-quaagh?

English: 36 What manner of saying is this that he said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me : and where I am, thither ye cannot come?
Manx: Cre ta’n ghlare shoh t’eh er ny loayrt, Shirree shiu, as cha vow shiu mee : as y raad ta mish cha vod shiuish cheet?

English: 37 In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried, saying, If any man thirst, let him come unto me, and drink.
Manx: Er y laa s’jerree, laa mooar yn eailley, hass Yeesey, as deïe Eh, gra, My ta dooinney erbee paagh, lig Eh cheet hym’s as giu.

English: 38 He that believeth on me, as the scripture hath said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water.
Manx: Eshyn ta credjal aynyms, myr ta’n scriptyr er ghra, ass y volg echey roihys strooanyn dy ushtey bio.

English: 39 (But this spake he of the Spirit, which they that believe on him should receive : for the Holy Ghost was not yet given ; because that Jesus was not yet glorified.)
Manx: (Agh shoh loayr Eh jeh’n Spyrryd, v’adsyn va credjal ayn dy gheddyn : son cha row yn Spyrryd Noo foast er ny choyrt, er-yn-oyr nagh row Yeesey foast er ny ghloyraghey)

English: 40 ¶Many of the people therefore, when they heard this saying, said, Of a truth this is the Prophet.
Manx: Dooyrt ymmodee jeh’n pobble er-y-fa shen, tra cheayll ad y raa shoh, Ayns firrinys shoh yn phadeyr.

English: 41 Others said, This is the Christ. But some said, Shall Christ come out of Galilee?
Manx: Dooyrt feallagh elley, She shoh yn Creest. Agh dooyrt paart, Jig Creest ass Galilee?

English: 42 Hath not the scripture said, That Christ cometh of the seed of David, and out of the town of Bethlehem, where David was?
Manx: Nagh vel y scriptyr er ghra, Dy nee jeh sluight Ghavid, as ass y balley Bethlehem, raad va David, ta Creest dy heet?

English: 43 So there was a division among the people because of him.
Manx: Myr shen va streeu mastey yn pobble mychione echey.

English: 44 And some of them would have taken him ; but no man laid hands on him.
Manx: As va paart jeu booiagh v’er ghoaill Eh ; agh cha dug dooinney erbee laue er.

English: 45 ¶Then came the officers to the chief priests and Pharisees ; and they said unto them, Why have ye not brought him?
Manx: Eisht haink ny fir-oik gys ny ard-saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn ; as dooyrt ad roo, Cre’n-fa nagh dug shiu lhieu Eh?

English: 46 The officers answered, Never man spake like this man.
Manx: Dreggyr ny fir-oik, Cha ren rieau dooinney loayrt myr y dooinney shoh.

English: 47 Then answered them the Pharisees, Are ye also deceived?
Manx: Eisht dreggyr ny Phariseeyn ad, Vel shiuish myrgeddin er nyn molley?

English: 48 Have any of the rulers or of the Pharisees believed on him?
Manx: Vel veg jeh ny fir-reil, as jeh ny Phariseeyn er chredjal ayn?

English: 49 But this people who knoweth not the law are cursed.
Manx: Agh ta’n pobble shoh, nagh vel toiggal y leigh, fo mollaght.

English: 50 Nicodemus saith unto them, (he that came to Jesus by night, being one of them,)
Manx: Dooyrt Nicodemus roo (eshyn haink gys Yeesey ayns yn oie, v’eh fer jeusyn)

English: 51 Doth our law judge any man, before it hear him, and know what he doeth?
Manx: Vel y leigh ainyn briwnys dooinney erbee roish my vel eh cur clashtyn da, as geddyn fys cre t’eh er n’yannoo?

English: 52 They answered and said unto him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search, and look : for out of Galilee ariseth no prophet.
Manx: Dreggyr adsyn, as dooyrt ad rish, Nee ass Galilee tow uss myrgeddin? Shir-jee magh as jeeagh-jee : son cha vel phadeyr erbee er n’irree seose ayns Galilee.

English: 53 And every man went unto his own house.
Manx: As hie dy chooilley ghooinney roish gys e hie hene.
CAB. VIII.

English: Jesus went unto the mount of Olives.
Manx: Hie Yeesey gys cronck ny Oliveyn.

English: 2 And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came unto him ; and he sat down, and taught them.
Manx: As dy moghey laa-ny-vairagh haink Eh reesht gys y chiamble, as haink ooilley yn phobble huggey ; as hoie Eh sheese, as dynsee Eh ad.

English: 3 And the scribes and Pharisees brought unto him a woman taken in adultery ; and when they had set her in the midst,
Manx: As hug ny Scruderyn as ny Phariseeyn lhieu huggey ben va goit ayns brishey-poosey ; as tra v’ad er hoiaghey ee kiongoyrt rish,

English: 4 They say unto him, Master, this woman was taken in adultery, in the very act.
Manx: Dooyrt ad rish, Vainshtyr, va’n ven shoh goit ayns brishey-poosey, ayns yn eer peccah.

English: 5 Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned : but what sayest thou?
Manx: Nish ta Moses ayns y leigh er chur saarey dooin, e leid dy ve er ny claghey, agh cre jir uss?

English: 6 This they said, tempting him, that they might have to accuse him. But Jesus stooped down, and with his finger wrote on the ground, as though he heard them not.
Manx: Shoh dooyrt ad dy violaghey Eh, dy voddagh oyr y ve dy loayrt noi. Agh chroym Yeesey sheese, as lesh e vair scrieu Eh er y laare, myr nagh beagh Eh dy nyn glashtyn.

English: 7 So when they continued asking him, he lifted up himself, and said unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a stone at her.
Manx: Myr shen tra v’ad sheer fênaght jeh, hrog Eh Eh hene seose, as dooyrt Eh roo, Eshyn ta fegooish peccah nyn mast’ eu, lig da ve yn chied er hilgys clagh urree.

English: 8 And again he stooped down, and wrote on the ground.
Manx: As chroym Eh sheese reesht, as scrieu Eh er y laare.

English: 9 And they which heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one, beginning at the eldest, even unto the last : and Jesus was left alone, and the woman standing in the midst.
Manx: As v’adsyn cheayll Eh, er nyn gheyrey liorish nyn gooinsheanse hene, as hie ad magh annane lurg annane, goaill toshiaght ocsyn dy hinney, gys yn eer vooinjer s’jerree : as va Yeesey faagit ny lomarcan, as y ven ny shassoo kiongoyrt rish.

English: 10 When Jesus had lifted up himself, and saw none but the woman, he said unto her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man condemned thee?
Manx: Tra hrog Yeesey Eh hene seose, as nagh vaik Eh annane erbee agh y ven, dooyrt Eh ree, Ven, cre vel y vooinjer va plaaint ort? vel dooinney erbee er dty gheyrey?

English: 11 She said, No man, Lord. And Jesus said unto her, Neither do I condemn thee : go, and sin no more.
Manx: Dooyrt ish, Cha vel dooinney erbee, Hiarn. As dooyrt Yeesey ree, Cha-moo ta mish dy dty gheyrey : gow royd, as ny jean peccah ny smoo.

English: 12 ¶Then spake Jesus again unto them, saying, I am the light of the world : he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life.
Manx: Eisht loayr Yeesey roo reesht, gra, Mish soilshey yn theihll : eshyn ta geiyrt orryms, cha shooyll Eh ayns y dorraghys, agh bee soilshey yn vea echey.

English: 13 The Pharisees therefore said unto him, Thou bearest record of thyself ; thy record is not true.
Manx: Dooyrt ny Phariseeyn er-y-fa shen rish, T’ow gymmyrkey feanish jeed hene ; cha vel dt’eanish firrinagh.

English: 14 Jesus answered and said unto them, Though I bear record of myself, yet my record is true : for I know whence I came, and whither I go ; but ye cannot tell whence I come, and whither I go.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt Eh roo, Ga dy vel mee gymmyrkey feanish jee’m pene, foast ta’n eanish aym firrinagh : son ta fys aym cre-woish haink mee, as c’raad ta mee goll ; agh cha s’eauish cre-woish haink mee, as c’raad ta mee goll.

English: 15 Ye judge after the flesh ; I judge no man.
Manx: Ta shiuish briwnys lurg briwnys ny foalley ; Cha vel mish briwnys dooinney erbee.

English: 16 And yet if I judge, my judgment is true : for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.
Manx: As foast my ta mee briwnys, ta my vriwnys firrinagh : son cha vel mish my lomarcan, agh mish as yn Ayr t’er my choyrt.

English: 17 It is also written in your law, that the testimony of two men is true.
Manx: Te myrgeddin scruit ayns y leigh eu, dy vel feanish daa ghooinney firrinagh.

English: 18 I am one that bear witness of myself, and the Father that sent me beareth witness of me.
Manx: Ta mish un er ta gymmyrkey feanish jee’m pene, as ta’n Ayr t’er my choyrt, gymmyrkey feanish jee’m.

English: 19 Then said they unto him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye neither know me, nor my Father : if ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Cre vel dt’ Ayr? Dreggyr Yeesey, Cha vel enney eu orryms, ny er my Ayr : dy beagh enney er ve eu orryms, veagh enney er ve eu er my Ayr myrgeddin.

English: 20 These words spake Jesus in the treasury, as he taught in the temple : and no man laid hands on him ; for his hour was not yet come.
Manx: Ny goan shoh loayr Yeesey ayns room y stoyr, myr v’eh gynsaghey ayns y chiamble : as cha dug dooinney erbee laue er, son cha row yn oor echey foast er jeet.

English: 21 Then said Jesus again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sins : whither I go, ye cannot come.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht, Ta mee goll roym, as nee shiu my hirrey, as yiow shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn : raad ta mish goll, cha vod shiuish cheet.

English: 22 Then said the Jews, Will he kill himself? because he saith, Whither I go, ye cannot come.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn, Jean Eh Eh hene y varroo? er-yn-oyr dy vel Eh gra, Raad ta mish goll, cha vod shiuish cheet.

English: 23 And he said unto them, Ye are from beneath ; I am from above : ye are of this world ; I am not of this world.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh roo, Ta shiuish veih heese, Ta mish veih heose : ta shiuish jeh’n theihll shoh, cha vel mish jeh’n theihll shoh.

English: 24 I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins : for if ye believe not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.
Manx: Dooyrt mee er-y-fa shen riu, dy voghe shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn : son mannagh vel shiu credjal dy nee mish Eh, yiow shiu baase ayns nyn beccaghyn.

English: 25 Then said they unto him, Who art thou? And Jesus saith unto them, Even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Quoi oo? As dooyrt Yeesey roo, Yn un er dooyrt mee riu er dyn toshiaght.

English: 26 I have many things to say and to judge of you : but he that sent me is true ; and I speak to the world those things which I have heard of him.
Manx: Ta ymmodee reddyn aym’s dy ghra as dy vriwnys jiuish : agh ta eshyn t’er my choyrt firrinagh ; as ta mee loayrt rish y theihll ny reddyn shen ta mee er chlashtyn veih.

English: 27 They understood not that he spake to them of the Father.
Manx: Cha hoig ad dy row Eh loayrt roo mychione yn Ayr.

English: 28 Then said Jesus unto them, When ye have lifted up the Son of man, then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do nothing of myself ; but as my Father hath taught me, I speak these things.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Tra vees shiu erreish yn Mac dooinney y hroggal seose, eisht bee fys eu dy nee mish Eh, as nagh vel mee jannoo nhee erbee jee’m pene ; agh dy vel mee loayrt ny reddyn shen ta my Ayr er chur roym.

English: 29 And he that sent me is with me : the Father hath not left me alone ; for I do always those things that please him.
Manx: As ta eshyn t’er my choyrt mârym : cha vel yn Ayr er m’aagail my lomarcan : son ta mee kinjagh jannoo ny reddyn shen ta dy wooiys Eh.

English: 30 As he spake these words, many believed on him.
Manx: Choud as v’eh loayrt ny goan shoh, ren ymmodee credjal ayn.

English: 31 Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on him, If ye continue in my word, then are ye my disciples indeed ;
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish ny Hewnyn shen va credjal ayn, My nee shiu tannaghtyn ayns my ghoo, eisht bee shiu adsyn ta gynsaghey voym dy jarroo ;

English: 32 And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
Manx: As bee toiggal eu jeh’n irriney, as nee yn irriney vondiaght eu y eaysley.

English: 33 ¶They answered him, We be Abraham’s seed, and were never in bondage to any man : how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?
Manx: Dreggyr adsyn Eh, She sluight Abraham shin, as cha hirveish shin rieau dooinney erbee : kys dy vel uss gra, Bee yn vondiaght eu er ny eaysley?

English: 34 Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whosoever committeth sin is the servant of sin.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Quoi-erbee ta jannoo peccah, t’eh ayns shirveish peccah.

English: 35 And the servant abideth not in the house for ever : but the Son abideth ever.
Manx: As cha vel y charvaant tannaghtyn ayns y thie son dy bragh : agh ta’n Mac tannaghtyn dy bragh.

English: 36 If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
Manx: My nee yn Mac er-y-fa shen yn vondiaght eu y eaysley, bee feaysley eu dy jarroo.

English: 37 I know that ye are Abraham’s seed ; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.
Manx: Ta fys aym dy nee sluight Abraham shiu ; agh ta shiu shirrey mish y varroo, er-y-fa nagh vel my ghoo er ghoaill greme erriu.

English: 38 I speak that which I have seen with my Father : and ye do that which ye have seen with your father.
Manx: Ta mish loayrt shen ny ta mee er ny akin ec my Ayr’s : as ta shiuish jannoo shen ny ta shiu er vakin ec yn ayr eauish.

English: 39 They answered and said unto him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith unto them, If ye were Abraham’s children, ye would do the works of Abraham.
Manx: Dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad rish, Abraham yn ayr ainyn. Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy beagh shiu nyn gloan dy Abraham, veagh shiu jannoo obbraghyn Abraham.

English: 40 But now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth, which I have heard of God : this did not Abraham.
Manx: Agh nish ta shiu shirrey mish y varroo, dooinney t’er n’insh diu yn irriney, ta mee er chlashtyn veih Jee : shoh cha ren Abraham.

English: 41 Ye do the deeds of your father. Then said they to him, We be not born of fornication ; we have one Father, even God.
Manx: Ta shiuish jannoo obbraghyn yn ayr eu. Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Cha ruggyr shinyn ayns maarderys ; ta un Ayr ain, ta shen, Jee.

English: 42 Jesus said unto them, If God were your Father, ye would love me : for I proceeded forth and came from God ; neither came I of myself, but he sent me.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy beagh Jee son Ayr diu, veagh shiu graihagh orryms ; son dy ren mee cheet magh, as dy daink mee veih Jee ; as cha daink mee jee’m pene, agh eshyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 43 Why do ye not understand my speech? even because ye cannot hear my word.
Manx: Cre’n-fa nagh vel shiu toiggal my ghlare? te son nagh vel shiu clashtyn my ghoo.

English: 44 Ye are of your father the devil, and the lusts of your father ye will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaketh a lie, he speaketh of his own : for he is a liar, and the father of it.
Manx: Ta shiuish jeh’n ayr eu yn drogh-spyrryd, as saynt yn ayr eu nee shiu y yannoo : ve eshyn ny ghunver er dyn toshiaght, as cha hass Eh gys yn irriney, er-y-fa nagh vel firrinys ayn. Tra t’eh loayrt breg, t’eh loayrt jeh e chooid hene : son t’eh ny vreagerey, as yn ayr echey.

English: 45 And because I tell you the truth, ye believe me not.
Manx: As er-y-fa dy vel mee ginsh yn irriney, cha vel shiu dy my chredjal.

English: 46 Which of you convinceth me of sin? And if I say the truth, why do ye not believe me?
Manx: Quoi eauish ta cur peccah my lieh? As my ta mee gra yn irriney, cre’n-fa nagh vel shiu dy my chredjal?

English: 47 He that is of God heareth God’s words : ye therefore hear them not, because ye are not of God.
Manx: Eshyn ta veih Jee, t’eh clashtyn goan Yee : cha vel shiuish er-y-fa shen clashtyn ad, er-y-fa nagh vel shiu veih Jee.

English: 48 Then answered the Jews, and said unto him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?
Manx: Eisht dreggyr ny Hewnyn, as dooyrt ad rish, Nagh vel shin gra yn irriney, dy nee Samaritan oo, as dy vel drogh-spyrryd aynyd.

English: 49 Jesus answered, I have not a devil ; but I honour my Father, and ye do dishonour me.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Cha vel drogh-spyrryd aynym ; agh ta mee cur ooashley da my Ayr, as ta shiuish cur mee-ooashley dooys.

English: 50 And I seek not mine own glory : there is one that seeketh and judgeth.
Manx: As cha vel mee shirrey my ghloyr hene : ta un er ta shirrey as briwnys.

English: 51 Verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall never see death.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, My ta dooinney freaylley my raa’s, cha vaik Eh yn baase dy bragh beayn.

English: 52 Then said the Jews unto him, Now we know that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets ; and thou sayest, If a man keep my saying, he shall never taste of death.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn rish, Nish ta fys ain dy vel drogh-spyrryd aynyd. Ta Abraham marroo as ny phadeyryn ; as tow uss gra, My ta dooinney freaylley my raa’s, cha jean Eh blashtyn er y baase dy bragh beayn.

English: 53 Art thou greater than our father Abraham, which is dead? and the prophets are dead : whom makest thou thyself?
Manx: Vel uss ny syrjey na nyn ayr Abraham, ta marroo? as ta ny phadeyryn marroo : quoi t’ow jannoo jeed hene?

English: 54 Jesus answered, If I honour myself, my honour is nothing : it is my Father that honoureth me ; of whom ye say, that he is your God :
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, My ta mee cur ooashley dou hene, cha vel my ooashley veg : she my Ayr ta cur ooashley dou, jehsyn ta shiuish loayrt, dy nee yn Jee eu Eh :

English: 55 Yet ye have not known him ; but I know him : and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a liar like unto you : but I know him, and keep his saying.
Manx: Ny-yeih cha nione diu Eh ; agh shione dooys Eh : as dy niarrin nagh boyn dou Eh, v’ein my vreagerey goll riuish : agh shione dooys Eh, as ta mee freaylley yn raa echey.

English: 56 Your father Abraham rejoiced to see my day : and he saw it, and was glad.
Manx: Ghow yn ayr eu Abraham foddiaght dy akin yn laa aym’s : as honnick Eh eh, as ghow Eh boggey.

English: 57 Then said the Jews unto him, Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn rish, Cha vel uss foast jeih bleeaney as da-eed dy eash, as vel oo er vakin Abraham?

English: 58 Jesus said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Roish my row Abraham, Ta mish.

English: 59 Then took they up stones to cast at him : but Jesus hid himself, and went out of the temple, going through the midst of them, and so passed by.
Manx: Eisht hrog ad claghyn dy hilgey er : agh cheill Yeesey Eh hene vow, as hie Eh magh ass y chiamble, goll trooid y cheed oc, as myr shen hie Eh shiaghey.
CAB. IX.

English: And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.
Manx: As myr va Yeesey goll shiaghey, honnick Eh dooinney va doal neayr as haink Eh er y theihll.

English: 2 And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
Manx: As dênee yn vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er jeh, gra, Vainshtyr, quoi ren peccah, Eh shoh ny e ayr as e voir, dy row Eh er ny ruggey doal?

English: 3 Jesus answered, Neither hath this man sinned, nor his parents : but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Cha nee son peccah dy ren Eh shoh, ny e ayr as e voir : agh dy voddagh obbraghyn Yee v’er nyn soilshaghey magh ayn.

English: 4 I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day : the night cometh, when no man can work.
Manx: Shegin dooys gobbraghey ny obbraghyn echyssyn t’er my choyrt, choud as ta’n laa ayn : ta’n oie cheet tra nagh vod dooinney erbee gobbraghey.

English: 5 As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.
Manx: Choud as ta mee ayns y theihll, mee soilshey yn theihll.

English: 6 When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
Manx: Tra v’eh erreish shoh y loayrt, hug Eh shelley er y thalloo, as ren Eh cray jeh’n shelley, as hug Eh yn chray rish sooyllyn y dooinney doal.

English: 7 And said unto him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh rish, Immee as oonlee oo hene ayns poyll Siloam (ta shen tra ta bun er ny chur er, Er ny choyrt.) Hie eh roish er-y-fa shen, as doonlee Eh Eh hene, as haink Eh as e hoilshey echey.

English: 8 ¶The neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
Manx: Dooyrt ny naboonyn er-y-fa shen, as adsyn va roie er vakin Eh dy row Eh doal, Nagh nee shoh Eh va cliaghtey ve ny hoie shirrey jeirk?

English: 9 Some said, This is he : others said, He is like him : but he said, I am he.
Manx: Dooyrt paart, She shoh Eh : dooyrt feallagh elley, T’eh goll-rish : agh dooyrt Eh hene, She mish Eh.

English: 10 Therefore said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?
Manx: Shen-y-fa dooyrt ad rish, Kys va dty hooyllyn er nyn vosley?

English: 11 He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash : and I went and washed, and I received sight.
Manx: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt Eh, Ren dooinney ta enmyssit Yeesey, cray, as hug Eh rish my hooyllyn eh, as dooyrt Eh rhym, Immee gys poyll Siloam, as oonlee oo hene : as hie mee, as doonlee mee mee hene, as hooar mee my hoilshey.

English: 12 Then said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish, Cre vel Eh? Dooyrt eshyn, Cha s’aym.

English: 13 ¶They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
Manx: Hug ad lhieu gys ny Phariseeyn eshyn va roish shen doal.

English: 14 And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
Manx: As she er y doonaght va Yeesey er n’yannoo yn chray, as er vosley ny sooyllyn echey.

English: 15 Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.
Manx: Eisht dênee ny Phariseeyn jeh reesht, kys v’eh er gheddyn e hoilshey. Dooyrt Eh roo, Hug Eh cray er my hooyllyn, as doonlee mee mee hene, as ta mee fakin.

English: 16 Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
Manx: Shen-y-fa dooyrt paart jeh ny Phariseeyn, Cha vel y dooinney shoh veih Jee, er-yn-oyr nagh vel Eh freaylley yn doonaght. Dooyrt feallagh elley, Kys oddys dooinney ta ny ghrogh-yantagh leid ny mirrillyn y yannoo? As va streeu nyn mast’ oc.

English: 17 They say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
Manx: Dooyrt ad rish y dooinney doal reesht, Cre tow uss dy ghra er e hon, dy doshil Eh dty hooyllyn? Dooyrt Eh, She phadeyr Eh.

English: 18 But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
Manx: Agh cha ren ny Hewnyn credjal mychione echey, dy row Eh er ve doal, as dy dooar Eh e hoilshey reesht, derrey deïe ad er yn ayr as y voir echyssyn v’er gheddyn e hoilshey.

English: 19 And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
Manx: As dênee ad jeu gra, Nee shoh yn mac eu, ta shiu gra va er ny ruggey doal? kys eisht t’eh nish fakin?

English: 20 His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind :
Manx: Dreggyr e ayr as e voir ad, gra, Ta fys ain dy nee shoh yn mac ain, as dy row Eh er ny ruggey doal :

English: 21 But by what means he now seeth, we know not ; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not : he is of age ; ask him : he shall speak for himself.
Manx: Agh kys t’eh nish fakin, cha s’ain ; ny quoi t’er vosley ny sooyllyn echey, cha vel fys ain : t’eh ec eash, fênee-jee jeh, nee Eh loayrt er e hon hene.

English: 22 These words spake his parents, because they feared the Jews : for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
Manx: Ny goan shoh loayr e ayr as e voir, er-y-fa dy row ad ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn : son va ny Hewnyn er chordail hannah, my ghoghe dooinney erbee rish dy nee Eh va’n Creest, dy beagh Eh er ny chur magh ass y cheeill.

English: 23 Therefore said his parents, He is of age ; ask him.
Manx: Shen-y-fa dooyrt yn ayr as y voir echey, T’eh ec eash, fênee-jee jeh.

English: 24 Then again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise : we know that this man is a sinner.
Manx: Eisht deïe ad reesht er y dooinney v’er ny ve doal, as dooyrt ad rish, Cur y moylley da Jee : ta fys ain dy nee drogh-yantagh Eh shoh.

English: 25 He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not : one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.
Manx: Dreggyr eshyn, as dooyrt Eh, Cha s’aym’s nee drogh-yantagh Eh : un red ta fys aym er, dy row mee doal, as nish dy vel my hoilshey aym.

English: 26 Then said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ad rish reesht, Cre ren Eh rhyt? kys doshil Eh dty hooyllyn?

English: 27 He answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear : wherefore would ye hear it again? will ye also be his disciples?
Manx: Dreggyr eshyn ad, Ta mee er n’insh diu hannah, as cha dug shiu geill : cre’n-fa bailliu y chlashtyn reesht eh? bailliu-ish myrgeddin ve jeusyn ta gynsaghey veih?

English: 28 Then they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple ; but we are Moses’ disciples.
Manx: Eisht doltooan ad Eh, as dooyrt ad, Tow uss gynsaghey veih ; agh ta shinyn gynsaghey veih Moses.

English: 29 We know that God spake unto Moses : as for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.
Manx: Ta fys ain dy loayr Jee rish Moses : agh Eh shoh, cha s’ain cre-woish t’eh.

English: 30 The man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
Manx: Dreggyr y dooinney as dooyrt Eh roo, Ta shen red yindyssagh, nagh s’eu cre-woish t’eh, as ny-yeih dy vel Eh er vosley my hooyllyn’s.

English: 31 Now we know that God heareth not sinners : but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
Manx: Nish ta fys ain nagh vel Jee cur clashtyn da peccee : agh my ta dooinney erbee cur ooashley da Jee, as jannoo e aigney, dasyn t’eh cur clashtyn.

English: 32 Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
Manx: Er dy hoshiaght y theihll cha row eh er ny chlashtyn dy doshil dooinney erbee sooyllyn fer va er ny ruggey doal.

English: 33 If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
Manx: Erbey dy vel y dooinney shoh veih Jee, cha voddagh Eh nhee erbee y yannoo.

English: 34 They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
Manx: Dreggyr ad as dooyrt ad rish, Haink uss er y theihll ooilley cooidjagh ayns peccaghyn, as vel oo gynsaghey shinyn? As hilg ad Eh magh.

English: 35 Jesus heard that they had cast him out ; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost thou believe on the Son of God?
Manx: Cheayll Yeesey dy hilg ad magh Eh ; as tra v’eh er gheddyn Eh, dooyrt Eh rish, Vel oo credjal ayns Mac Yee?

English: 36 He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
Manx: Dreggyr eshyn as dooyrt Eh, Quoi Eh, Hiarn, dy voddym credjal ayn?

English: 37 And Jesus said unto him, Thou hast both seen him, and it is he that talketh with thee.
Manx: As dooyrt Yeesey rish, T’ow chammah er vakin Eh, as she eshyn Eh ta taggloo rhyt.

English: 38 And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh, Hiarn, ta mee credjal. As hug Eh ooashley da.

English: 39 ¶And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see ; and that they which see might be made blind.
Manx: As dooyrt Yeesey, Son briwnys haink mish gys y theihll shoh : dy vod adsyn nagh vel fakin, fakin ; as adsyn ta fakin, dy vod ad v’er nyn yannoo doal.

English: 40 And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?
Manx: As cheayll paart jeh ny Phariseeyn va marish ny goan shoh, as dooyrt ad rish, Vel shinyn doal neesht?

English: 41 Jesus said unto them, If ye were blind, ye should have no sin : but now ye say, We see ; therefore your sin remaineth.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Dy beagh shiu doal, cha beagh peccah eu : agh nish ta shiu gra, Ta shin fakin ; shen-y-fa ta shiu tannaghtyn ayns peccah.
CAB. X.

English: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Eshyn nagh vel goll stiagh er y dorrys ayns bwoaillee-ny-geyrragh, agh ta drappal seose er aght ennagh elley, t’eh shen ny vaarlagh as ny roosteyr.

English: 2 But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
Manx: Agh eshyn ta goll stiagh er y dorrys, yn fer cheddin bochilley ny geyrragh.

English: 3 To him the porter openeth ; and the sheep hear his voice : and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.
Manx: Dasyn ta’n fer ta currym y dorrys er fosley ; as ta ny kirree clashtyn e choraa : as t’eh geamagh er e chirree hene lurg nyn en’myn, as dyn leeideil ad magh.

English: 4 And when he putteth forth his own sheep, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him : for they know his voice.
Manx: As tra t’eh cur magh e chirree hene, t’eh goll rhymboo, as ta ny kirree geiyrt er : son ta enney oc er e choraa.

English: 5 And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him : for they know not the voice of strangers.
Manx: As joarree cha neiyr ad er, agh roie-ee ad er-chea veih : son cha vel enney oc er coraa joarreeyn.

English: 6 This parable spake Jesus unto them : but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
Manx: Yn coraa-dorraghey shoh loayr Yeesey roo : agh cha hoig ad cre ny reddyn v’ad v’eh dy loayrt roo.

English: 7 Then said Jesus unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Mish dorrys ny geyrragh.

English: 8 All that ever came before me are thieves and robbers : but the sheep did not hear them.
Manx: Ta ooilley ny haink roym’s, nyn maarlee as nyn roosteyryn : agh cha dug ny kirree geill daue.

English: 9 I am the door : by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.
Manx: Mish y dorrys : lioryms my ta dooinney erbee goll stiagh, bee Eh er ny hauail, as hed Eh stiagh as magh, as yiow Eh pastyr.

English: 10 The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy : I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
Manx: Cha vel y maarlagh cheet agh dy gheid, as dy varroo, as dy stroie : haink mish dy voddagh bea y ve oc, as dy voddagh eh ve oc ny s’palchey.

English: 11 I am the good shepherd : the good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep.
Manx: Mish y bochilley mie : ta’n bochilley mie cur e vioys son ny kirree.

English: 12 But he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth : and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.
Manx: Agh eshyn ta faïlt, as nagh vel ny vochilley, as nagh vel ny kirree lesh hene, t’eh fakin yn moddey-oaldey cheet, as t’eh faagail ny kirree, as roih er-chea : as ta’n moddey-oaldey dyn dayrtyn ad, as skeayley ny kirree.

English: 13 The hireling fleeth, because he is an hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
Manx: Ta fer-ny-faïlley chea, er-y-fa dy nee fer-faïlt Eh, as nagh mooyr lesh son ny kirree.

English: 14 I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.
Manx: Mish y bochilley mie, as ta enney aym er my chirree, as ta enney ocsyn orryms.

English: 15 As the Father knoweth me, even so know I the Father : and I lay down my life for the sheep.
Manx: Myr ta enney ec yn Ayr orryms, shen myr ta enney aym’s er yn Ayr : as ta mee scarrey rish my vioys son ny kirree.

English: 16 And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold : them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice ; and there shall be one fold, and one shepherd.
Manx: As kirree elley t’aym, nagh vel jeh’n woaillee shoh : ad shen neesht shegin dou y chur lhiam, as clinnee ad my choraa ; as bee un woaillee ayn, as un vochilley.

English: 17 Therefore doth my Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I might take it again.
Manx: Shen-y-fa ta my Ayr graihagh orryms er-yn-oyr dy vel mee scarrey rish my vioys, dy voddym y ghoaill reesht eh.

English: 18 No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment have I received of my Father.
Manx: Cha vel dooinney erbee dy ghoaill voym eh, agh m’aigney hene eh dy scarrey rish : Ta pooar aym dy scarrey rish, as dy ghoaill reesht eh. Yn saarey shoh hooar mee veih my Ayr.

English: 19 ¶There was a division therefore again among the Jews for these sayings.
Manx: Va streeu er-y-fa shen reesht mastey ny Hewnyn son ny raaghyn shoh.

English: 20 And many of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad ; why hear ye him?
Manx: As dooyrt ymmodee jeu, Ta drogh-spyrryd ayn, as t’eh ass e cheeal ; cre’n-fa ta shiu geaishtagh rish?

English: 21 Others said, These are not the words of him that hath a devil. Can a devil open the eyes of the blind?
Manx: Dooyrt feallagh elley, Cha nee goan fer ta drogh-spyrryd ayn ad shoh : Vod drogh-spyrryd sooyllyn ny doail y osley?

English: 22 ¶And it was at Jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it was winter.
Manx: As haghyr shoh ec Jerusalem, ec feailley casherickey yn chiamble ; as va’n geurey ayn.

English: 23 And Jesus walked in the temple in Solomon’s porch.
Manx: As va Yeesey walkal ayns y chiamble ayns porch Solomon.

English: 24 Then came the Jews round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the Christ, tell us plainly.
Manx: Eisht haink ny Hewnyn mygeayrt y mysh, as dooyrt ad rish, Caid t’ow lhiggey dooin ve ayns imnea? My she oo yn Creest, insh dooin dy plain.

English: 25 Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believed not : the works that I do in my Father’s name, they bear witness of me.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Ta mee er n’insh diu, as cha ren shiu my chredjal : ta ny obbraghyn ta mee dy yannoo ayns ennym my Ayrey, gymmyrkey feanish jee’m.

English: 26 But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep, as I said unto you.
Manx: Agh cha vel shiuish credjal ; er-yn-oyr nagh vel shiu jeh my chirree, myr dooyrt mee riu.

English: 27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me :
Manx: Ta my chirree clashtyn my choraa, as ta enney aym orroo, as eiyree ad orrym.

English: 28 And I give unto them eternal life ; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
Manx: As ta mee cur daue yn vea veayn, as cha jean ad dy bragh cherraghtyn, as cha bee annane erbee abyl nyn ghoaill ad er niart ass my laue.

English: 29 My Father, which gave them me, is greater than all ; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father’s hand.
Manx: Ta my Ayr hug dou ad, pooaral er-skyn ooilley : as cha jiarg annane erbee y ghoaill ad ass laue my Ayrey.

English: 30 I and my Father are one.
Manx: Ta mish as my Ayr annane.

English: 31 Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.
Manx: Eisht hrog ny Hewnyn claghyn reesht dy chlaghey eh.

English: 32 Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewed you from my Father ; for which of those works do ye stone me?
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Ymmodee obbraghyn mie ta mee er hoilshaghey diu veih my Ayr ; cre’n obbyr jeu shen ta shiu dy my chlaghey er y hon?

English: 33 The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not ; but for blasphemy ; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
Manx: Dreggyr ny Hewnyn Eh, gra, Son obbyr vie cha vel shin dy dty chlaghey ; agh son goan-mollaghtagh, as er-yn-oyr dy vel uss, ta dty ghooinney, jannoo oo hene Jee.

English: 34 Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Nagh vel eh scruit ayns y leigh eu, Dooyrt mee, She Jeeaghyn shiu?

English: 35 If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came, and the scripture cannot be broken ;
Manx: My t’eh genmyss adsyn Jeeaghyn, my nyn gione va’n goo shen dy Yee, as nagh vod y scriptyr v’er ny vrishey :

English: 36 Say ye of him, whom the Father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest ; because I said, I am the Son of God?
Manx: Vel shiu gra mychione-syn ta’n Ayr er ny chasherickey, as er ny choyrt gys y theihll, T’ow loayrt goan-mollaghtagh ; er-y-fa dy dooyrt mee, She Mac Yee mee?

English: 37 If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
Manx: Mannagh vel mee jannoo obbraghyn my Ayrey, ny cred-jee mee.

English: 38 But if I do, though ye believe not me, believe the works : that ye may know, and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in him.
Manx: Agh my ta mee jannoo ad, ga nagh gred shiu mish, cred-jee ny obbraghyn : dy vod shiu toiggal as credjal, dy vel yn Ayr aynyms, as mish aynsyn.

English: 39 Therefore they sought again to take him : but he escaped out of their hand,
Manx: Shen-y-fa v’ad shirrey reesht y ghoaill Eh : agh chosne Eh veih’n laue oc,

English: 40 And went away again beyond Jordan into the place where John at first baptized ; and there he abode.
Manx: As hie Eh roish reesht er cheu elley dy Yordan, gys y boayl raad ren Ean hoshiaght bashtey ; as duirree Eh ayns shen.

English: 41 And many resorted unto him, and said, John did no miracle : but all things that John spake of this man were true.
Manx: As va ymmodee cheet huggey, as gra, Cha ren Ean mirril erbee : agh va dy chooilley nhee loayr Ean jeh’n dooinney shoh firrinagh.

English: 42 And many believed on him there.
Manx: As ren ymmodee credjal ayn ayns shen.
CAB. XI.

English: Now a certain man was sick, named Lazarus, of Bethany, the town of Mary and her sister Martha.
Manx: Nish va dooinney dy row ching, va enmyssit Lazarus dy Vethany, balley Moirrey as y chuyr eck Martha.

English: 2 (It was that Mary which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
Manx: (She Moirrey shen v’ayn ren y Chiarn y ooillaghey lesh ooill, as rub ny cassyn echey lesh e folt, yn braar eck Lazarus va ching.)

English: 3 Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.
Manx: Shen-y-fa hug ny shairaghyn echey fys huggey, gra, Hiarn, cur-my-ner, t’eshyn shynney lhiat ching.

English: 4 When Jesus heard that, he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God might be glorified thereby.
Manx: Tra cheayll Yeesey shoh, dooyrt Eh, Cha vel y chingys shoh gys baase, agh son gloyr Yee, dy vod Mac Yee v’er ny ghloyraghey liorish.

English: 5 Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
Manx: Nish va Yeesey graihagh er Martha, as y chuyr eck, as Lazarus.

English: 6 When he had heard therefore that he was sick, he abode two days still in the same place where he was.
Manx: Shen-y-fa tra v’eh er chlashtyn dy row Eh ching, duirree Eh daa laa ayns yn un voayl raad v’eh.

English: 7 Then after that saith he to his disciples, Let us go into Judaea again.
Manx: Eisht ny lurg shen dooyrt Eh rish y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er, Lig dooin goll gys Judea reesht.

English: 8 His disciples say unto him, Master, the Jews of late sought to stone thee ; and goest thou thither again?
Manx: Dooyrt y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er rish, Vainshtyr, cha vel foddey neayr as va ny Hewnyn shirrey oo y chlaghey ; as jeu ayns shen reesht?

English: 9 Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Nagh vel daa oor yeig ayns y laa? My ta dooinney erbee shooyll ayns y laa, cha vel Eh snapperal, er-y-fa dy vel Eh fakin soilshey yn theihll shoh.

English: 10 But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because there is no light in him.
Manx: Agh my ta dooinney shooyll ayns yn oie, t’eh snapperal, er-y-fa nagh vel soilshey ayn.

English: 11 These things said he : and after that he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarus sleepeth ; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh loayr Eh : as ny lurg shen dooyrt Eh roo, Ta nyn garrey Lazarus ny chadley ; agh ta mish goll dy voddym Eh y ghoostey ass e chadley.

English: 12 Then said his disciples, Lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt adsyn va sheer marish, Hiarn, my t’eh cadley, nee Eh cowral.

English: 13 Howbeit Jesus spake of his death : but they thought that he had spoken of taking of rest in sleep.
Manx: Ny-yeih loayr Yeesey jeh’n vaase echey : agh heill adsyn dy row Eh er loayrt jeh fea y ghoaill ayns cadley.

English: 14 Then said Jesus unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo dy plain, Ta Lazarus marroo.

English: 15 And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe ; nevertheless let us go unto him.
Manx: As ta mee booiagh er y choontey eauish, nagh row mee ayns shen (son dy vod shiu credjal) ny-yeih lig dooin goll huggey.

English: 16 Then said Thomas, which is called Didymus, unto his fellowdisciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Thomase ta enmyssit Didymus rish e heshey-ostyllyn, Lig dooinyn goll neesht, dy vod mad baase y gheddyn marish.

English: 17 Then when Jesus came, he found that he had lain in the grave four days already.
Manx: Eisht tra va Yeesey er jeet, hooar Eh Eh kiare laa oc hannah ayns yn oaie.

English: 18 Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off :
Manx: (Nish va Bethany er-gerrey da Jerusalem, mysh daa veeilley veih.)

English: 19 And many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, to comfort them concerning their brother.
Manx: As va ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn er jeet magh gys Martha as Moirrey, dy eddrymmaghey yn trimshey oc son nyn mraar.

English: 20 Then Martha, as soon as she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him : but Mary sat still in the house.
Manx: Eisht hie Martha, cha leah as cheayll ee dy row Yeesey cheet, magh ny whaill : agh hoie Moirrey ayns y thie.

English: 21 Then said Martha unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Martha rish Yeesey, Hiarn, dy beagh uss er ve ayns shoh, cha beagh my vraar er gheddyn baase.

English: 22 But I know, that even now, whatsoever thou wilt ask of God, God will give it thee.
Manx: Agh ta fys aym, ’sy traa t’ayn, cre-erbee nee oo y yeearree er Jee, dy der Jee dhyt eh.

English: 23 Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey ree, nee dty vraar girree reesht.

English: 24 Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.
Manx: Dooyrt Martha rish, Ta fys aym dy nirree Eh reesht ec yn irree-seose ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 25 Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life : he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live :
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey ree, Mish yn irree-seose-reesht as y vea : bee eshyn ta credjal aynyms, bio, ga dy vow Eh baase ;

English: 26 And whosoever liveth and believeth in me shall never die. Believest thou this?
Manx: As quoi-erbee ta bio, as credjal aynyms, cha vow Eh yn baase ta dy bragh beayn. Vel uss credjal shoh?

English: 27 She saith unto him, Yea, Lord : I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, which should come into the world.
Manx: Dooyrt ee rish, Ta, Hiarn : ta mee credjal dy nee uss yn Creest Mac Yee, va dy heet gys y theihll.

English: 28 And when she had so said, she went her way, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Master is come, and calleth for thee.
Manx: As tra v’ee er ghra shoh, hiee rhimbee, as deïe ee er e shuyr Moirrey er-lheh, as dooyrt ee, Ta’n Mainshtyr er jeet, as t’eh geamagh ort.

English: As soon as she heard that, she arose quickly, and came unto him.
Manx: 29. Cha leah as cheayll ee shen, dirree ee dy tappee, as haink ee huggey.

English: 30 Now Jesus was not yet come into the town, but was in that place where Martha met him.
Manx: Nish cha row Yeesey foast er jeet stiagh ayns y valley, agh v’eh ayns y voayl shen veet Martha Eh.

English: 31 The Jews then which were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up hastily and went out, followed her, saying, She goeth unto the grave to weep there.
Manx: Ny Hewnyn eisht va mâree ayns y thie dy eddrymmaghey yn trimshey eck, tra honnick ad dy dirree Moirrey dy tappee, as dy jagh ee magh, deiyr ad urree, gra, T’ee goll gys yn oaie dy cheayney ayns shen.

English: 32 Then when Mary was come where Jesus was, and saw him, she fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
Manx: Eisht tra va Moirrey er jeet raad va Yeesey, yeeagh ee er, as huit ee sheese ec e chassyn, gra rish, Hiarn, dy beagh uss er ve ayns shoh, cha beagh my vraar er gheddyn baase.
