English: 33 When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping which came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled.
Manx: Tra honnick Yeesey ee er-y-fa shen keayney, as ny Hewnyn myrgeddin keayney v’er jeet mâree, hayrn Eh osney hrome cheu-sthie jeh hene, as huit Eh ayns trimshey,

English: 34 And said, Where have ye laid him? They said unto him, Lord, come and see.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh, C’raad ta shiu er choyrt Eh? Dooyrt adsyn rish, Hiarn, tarr as hee oo.

English: 35 Jesus wept.
Manx: Cheayn Yeesey.

English: 36 Then said the Jews, Behold how he loved him.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ny Hewnyn, Jeeagh cre cha graihagh as v’eh er!

English: 37 And some of them said, Could not this man, which opened the eyes of the blind, have caused that even this man should not have died?
Manx: As dooyrt paart jeu, Nagh voddagh Eh shoh, va fosley sooyllyn  ny doail, v’er choyrt eh gy kione nagh beagh y dooinney shoh er gheddyn baase?

English: 38 Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the grave. It was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.
Manx: Hayrn Yeesey er-y-fa shen osney hrome reesht cheu sthie jeh hene, as haink Eh gys yn oaie. She ooig v’ayn, as va clagh er ny choyrt ny lhie er.

English: 39 Jesus said, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time he stinketh : for he hath been dead four days.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey, Gow-jee ersooyl y chlagh. Dooyrt Martha shuyr y Varroo rish, Hiarn, ta nish soar trome jeh : son t’eh er ve kiare laa marroo.

English: 40 Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God?
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey ree, Nagh dooyrt mee rhyt, my chredagh oo, dy vaikagh oo gloyr Yee.

English: 41 Then they took away the stone from the place where the dead was laid. And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.
Manx: Eisht ghow ad ersooyl y chlagh jeh’n boayl raad va’n Marroo ny lhie. As hrog Yeesey seose e hooyllyn, as dooyrt Eh, Ayr, ta mee cur booise dhyt dy vel oo er my chlashtyn.

English: 42 And I knew that thou hearest me always : but because of the people which stand by I said it, that they may believe that thou hast sent me.
Manx: As va fys aym dy row kinjagh dy my chlashtyn : agh kyndagh rish y pobble va mygeayrt y moo’m, loayr mee, dy vod ad credjal dy vel oo er my choyrt.

English: 43 And when he thus had spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.
Manx: As tra v’eh er ghra shoh, deïe Eh lesh ard choraa, Lazarus, tarr magh.

English: 44 And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes : and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.
Manx: As haink eshyn va marroo magh, kainlt cass as laue lesh aanrityn baaish : as va’n eddin echey foïlt lesh naptin. Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Feayshyl-jee Eh, as lig-jee yn raad da.

English: 45 Then many of the Jews which came to Mary, and had seen the things which Jesus did, believed on him.
Manx: Eisht ren ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn v’er jeet magh gys Moirrey, as v’er vakin ny reddyn ren Yeesey, credjal ayn.

English: But some of them went their ways to the Pharisees, and told them what things Jesus had done.
Manx: 46. Agh hie paart jeu rhymboo gys ny Phariseeyn, as dinsh ad daue cre ny reddyn va Yeesey er n’yannoo.

English: 47 ¶Then gathered the chief priests and the Pharisees a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many miracles.
Manx: Eisht deïe ny ard-saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn er y choonceïl cooidjagh, as dooyrt ad, Cre ta shinyn dy yannoo? son ta’n dooinney shoh jannoo ymmodee mirrillyn.

English: 48 If we let him thus alone, all men will believe on him : and the Romans shall come and take away both our place and nation.
Manx: My liggys mad da, nee dy chooilley ghooinney credjal ayn ; as hig ny Romanee as ver ad mow chammah yn ynnyd casherick as yn ashoon ain.

English: 49 And one of them, named Caiaphas, being the high priest that same year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,
Manx: As va fer jeu va enmyssit Caiaphas, ny ard-saggyrt yn vlein shen, as dooyrt Eh roo, Cha vel toiggal eu jeh nhee erbee,

English: 50 Nor consider that it is expedient for us, that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.
Manx: Cha-moo ta shiu goaill eu hene kys te ymmyrchagh er ny son ain, un dooinney dy gheddyn baase son y pobble, as gyn y slane ashoon dy hierraghtyn.

English: 51 And this spake he not of himself : but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation ;
Manx: As shoh loayr Eh, cha nee jeh hene : agh v’eh ny ard-saggyrt yn vlein shen, as ren Eh phadeyrys dy voghe Yeesey baase son yn ashoon shen :

English: 52 And not for that nation only, but that also he should gather together in one the children of God that were scattered abroad.
Manx: As cha nee ynrycan son yn ashoon shen, agh myrgeddin dy jinnagh Eh cloan Yee va skeaylt dy liane, y hayrn gys annanys ry cheïley.

English: 53 Then from that day forth they took counsel together for to put him to death.
Manx: Eisht veih’n laa shen magh v’ad cur nyn goyrle dy cheïley dy choyrt Eh gy baase.

English: 54 Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews ; but went thence unto a country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim, and there continued with his disciples.
Manx: Cha jimmee Yeesey er-y-fa shen ny smoo dy foshlit mastey ny Hewnyn ; agh hie Eh veih shen gys cheer v’er er-gerrey da’n aasagh, gys ard-valley enmyssit Ephraim, as duirree Eh ayns shen marish y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er.

English: 55 And the Jews’ passover was nigh at hand : and many went out of the country up to Jerusalem before the passover, to purify themselves.
Manx: As va Caisht ny Hewnyn tayrn er-gerrey : as va ymmodee ass y cheer goll seose gys Jerusalem roish y Chaisht, dy ghlenney ad hene.

English: 56 Then sought they for Jesus, and spake among themselves, as they stood in the temple, What think ye, that he will not come to the feast?
Manx: As v’ad briaght son Yeesey, as loayrt nyn mast’ oc hene, myr v’ad nyn shassoo ayns y chiamble, Cre ta shiu dy smooinaghtyn, nagh jig Eh seose gys yn eailley?

English: 57 Now both the chief priests and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that, if any man knew where he were, he should shew it, that they might take him.
Manx: Nish va chammah ny ard-saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn er chur saarey, my va fys ec dooinney erbee c’raad v’eh, dy row Eh dy hoilshaghey eh, dy voddagh ad Eh y ghoaill.
CAB. XII.

English: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.
Manx: Eisht shey laa roish y Chaisht, haink Yeesey gys Bethany, raad va Lazarus v’er ny ve marroo, Eh v’eshyn er hroggal veih ny merriu.

English: 2 There they made him a supper ; and Martha served : but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.
Manx: Ayns shen ren ad shibber er e hon, as va Martha shirveish orroo : agh va Lazarus fer jeusyn va nyn soie ec y voayrd mârish.

English: 3 Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair : and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
Manx: Eisht ghow Moirrey punt dy ooill dy spikenard feer deyr, as ren ee cassyn Yeesey y ooillaghey, as rub ee e chassyn lesh e folt : as va’n thie er ny lhieeney lesh soar yn ooill.

English: 4 Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, which should betray him,
Manx: Eisht dooyrt fer jeh ny ostyllyn echey, Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon, va kiarrail Eh y vrah,

English: 5 Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?
Manx: Cre’n-fa nagh row yn ooill shoh creckit son three cheead ping, as er ny choyrt da ny boghtyn?

English: 6 This he said, not that he cared for the poor ; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.
Manx: Shoh dooyrt Eh, cha nee son dy row kiarrail erbee er jeh ny boghtyn ; agh er-yn-oyr dy nee maarlagh v’eh, as dy nee echey va’n sporran, as ny v’ad dy choyrt ayn eshyn va dy chur lesh eh.

English: 7 Then said Jesus, Let her alone : against the day of my burying hath she kept this.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey, Faag-jee ee : noi laa my oanluckey t’ee er hashtey shoh.

English: 8 For the poor always ye have with you ; but me ye have not always.
Manx: Son ny boghtyn t’ad eu kinjagh mêriu ; agh mish cha vel eu kinjagh.

English: 9 Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there : and they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
Manx: Va fys er-y-fa shen ec ymmodee jeh pobble ny Hewnyn dy row Eh ayns shen : as haink ad, cha nee er coontey Yeesey ny lomarcan, agh dy voddagh ad Lazarus y akin myrgeddin, Eh v’eshyn er hroggal veih ny merriu.

English: 10 ¶But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death ;
Manx: Agh hug ny ard-saggyrtyn nyn goyrle dy cheïley, mychione Lazarus myrgeddin y choyrt gy-baase ;

English: 11 Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
Manx: Er-y-fa er y choontey echyssyn dy row ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn er gholl roue, as er chredjal ayns Yeesey.

English: 12 ¶On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
Manx: Er yn nah laa ren ymmodee jeh’n pobble v’er jeet gys yn eailley, tra cheayll ad dy row Yeesey cheet gys Jerusalem,

English: 13 Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna : Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.
Manx: Banglaneyn dy viljyn-palm y ghoaill, as hie ad magh ny whaill, as deïe ad, Hosanna ; bannit ta ree Israel ta cheet ayns ennym y Chiarn.

English: 14 And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon ; as it is written,
Manx: As tra va Yeesey er gheddyn assyl aeg, varkee Eh urree : myr te scruit,

English: 15 Fear not, daughter of Sion : behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.
Manx: Ny gow aggle, inneen Sion : cur-my-ner, ta dty Ree cheet, markiagh er lhie assyl.

English: 16 These things understood not his disciples at the first : but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh cha hoig y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er ec y toshiaght : agh tra va Yeesey er ny ghloyraghey, eisht chooinee ad dy row ny reddyn shoh scruit jeh, as dy row ad er n’yannoo ny reddyn shoh rish.

English: 17 The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.
Manx: Ren y pobble er-y-fa shen va marish, tra deïe Eh er Lazarus ass yn oaie, as tra hrog Eh Eh veih ny merriu feanish y ymmyrkey.

English: 18 For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.
Manx: Er-yn-oyr shoh va’n pobble myrgeddin er gholl magh ny whaill, son dy geayll ad dy row Eh er n’yannoo yn mirril shoh.

English: 19 The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.
Manx: Dooyrt ny Phariseeyn er-y-fa shen nyn mast’ oc hene, Nagh vaik shiu nagh vel shiu jannoo veg y vie? cur-my-ner, ta’n seihll er gholl geiyrt er.

English: 20 ¶And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast :
Manx: As va shiartance dy Ghreekyn nyn mast’ oc, v’er jeet seose dy chur ooashley ec yn eailley :

English: 21 The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
Manx: Haink ad shoh er-y-fa shen gys Philip, va veih Bethsaida ayns Galilee, as ren ad aghin huggey, gra, Vainshtyr, baillin Yeesey y akin.

English: 22 Philip cometh and telleth Andrew : and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
Manx: Haink Philip as dinsh Eh da Andreays, as reesht dinsh Andreays as Philip shoh da Yeesey.

English: 23 ¶And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.
Manx: As dreggyr Yeesey ad, gra, Ta’n oor er jeet, dy vel yn Mac dooinney dy ve er ny ghloyraghey.

English: 24 Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone : but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Mannagh vel y greine curnaght tuittym ayns y thalloo, as goll eag, te cummal ny un ghreine kinjagh : agh my te goll eag : te gymmyrkey magh lane mess.

English: 25 He that loveth his life shall lose it ; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
Manx: Eshyn ta graihagh er e vioys, caillee Eh eh : agh eshyn ta feoh echey er e vioys ’sy theihll shoh, freillee Eh eh gys y vea veayn.

English: 26 If any man serve me, let him follow me ; and where I am, there shall also my servant be : if any man serve me, him will my Father honour.
Manx: My nee dooinney erbee mish y hirveish, lig da geiyrt orrym ; as y raad ta mish, ayns shen myrgeddin vees my harvaant : my nee dooinney erbee mish y hirveish, dasyn ver my Ayr onnor.

English: 27 Now is my soul troubled ; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour : but for this cause came I unto this hour.
Manx: Nish ta m’annym seaghnit ; as cre jirrym? Ayr, saue mee veih’n oor shoh : agh er-yn-oyr shoh haink mee gys yn oor shoh.

English: 28 Father, glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.
Manx: Ayr, cur gloyr da dt’ennym hene. Eisht haink coraa veih niau, gra, Ta mee chammah er ghloyraghey eh, as nee’m eh y ghloyraghey reesht.

English: 29 The people therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it thundered : others said, An angel spake to him.
Manx: Dooyrt y pobble er-y-fa shen va nyn shassoo ayns shen, as cheayll eh, dy row taarnagh ayn : dooyrt feallagh elley, Dy nee ainle ren loayrt rish.

English: 30 Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad as dooyrt Eh, Cha daink y coraa shoh er y choontey aym’s, agh er y nyn son eauish.

English: 31 Now is the judgment of this world : now shall the prince of this world be cast out.
Manx: Nish ta briwnys y theihll shoh ayn : nish vees prince y theihll shoh er ny hilgey magh.

English: 32 And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto me.
Manx: As my veem’s er my hroggal seose jeh’n thalloo, tayrnym dy chooilley ghooinney hym.

English: 33 This he said, signifying what death he should die.
Manx: (Shoh loayr Eh, dy hoilshaghey cre’n baase v’eh dy hurranse.)

English: 34 The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever : and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?
Manx: Dreggyr y pobble Eh, Ta shin er chlashtyn ass y leigh, dy vel Creest tannaghtyn son dy bragh : as kys tow uss gra, Dy vel y Mac dooinney dy ve troggit seose? quoi yn Mac dooinney shoh?

English: 35 Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you : for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Foast tammylt beg ta’n soilshey mêriu : immee-jee choud as ta’n soilshey eu, er aggle dy jig y dorraghys erriu : son cha vel fys echyssyn ta shooyll ayns y dorraghys c’raad t’eh goll.

English: 36 While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.
Manx: Choud as ta soilshey eu, cred-jee ayns y toilshey, dy vod shiu ve nyn gloan jeh’n toilshey. Ny reddyn shoh loayr Yeesey, as jimmee Eh roish, as dollee Eh Eh hene voue.

English: 37 ¶But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him :
Manx: Agh ga dy ren Eh whilleen mirril kiongoyrt roo, foast cha chred ad ayn :

English: 38 That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?
Manx: Dy voddagh y raa loayr Esaias y phadeyr ve cooilleenit, Hiarn, quoi ta er chredjal yn goo ain? as quoi gys ta roih yn Chiarn er ve soilshit?

English: 39 Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,
Manx: Shen-y-fa cha voddagh ad credjal, er-y-fa dy row Esaias er ghra reesht,

English: 40 He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart ; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.
Manx: T’eh er gholley ny sooyllyn oc, as er chreoghey nyn gree ; son nagh vaikagh ad lesh nyn sooyllyn, as nagh doiggagh ad lesh nyn gree, as nagh beagh ad er nyn jyndaa, as dy jinnin ad y lheihys.

English: 41 These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh loayr Esaias, tra honnick Eh yn ghloyr echey, as tra loayr Eh jeh.

English: 42 ¶Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him ; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue :
Manx: Ny-yeih mastey ny ard fir-reïl myrgeddin ren ymmodee credjal ayn ; agh kyndagh rish ny Phariseeyn cha ghow ad rish, er aggle dy beagh ad er nyn goyrt magh ass y cheeill.

English: 43 For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
Manx: Son v’ad ny sondee er moylley gheiney, ny moylley Yee.

English: 44 ¶Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.
Manx: Deïe Yeesey as dooyrt Eh, Eshyn ta credjal aynyms, cha nee aynyms t’eh credjal, agh aynsyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 45 And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.
Manx: As eshyn ta dy my akin’s, t’eh fakin eshyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 46 I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.
Manx: Ta mish er jeet my hoilshey gys y theihll, son nagh jean quoi-erbee nee credjal aynym tannaghtyn ayns y dorraghys.

English: 47 And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not : for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
Manx: As my ta dooinney erbee ta clashtyn, as nagh vel credjal my ghoan, cha vel mish dy vriwnys Eh : son cha daink mee dy vriwnys y seihll, agh dy hauail y seihll.

English: 48 He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him : the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.
Manx: Eshyn ta soiaghey beg jeem’s, as nagh vel goaill huggey my ghoan, ta shen echey ta dy vriwnys Eh : yn goo ta mifh er loayrt, nee shen y vriwnys Eh ec y laa er-jerrey.

English: 49 For I have not spoken of myself ; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.
Manx: Son cha vel mish er loayrt jee’m pene ; agh yn Ayr t’er my choyrt, eshyn hug saarey dou, cre yiarrin, as cre loayrin.

English: 50 And I know that his commandment is life everlasting : whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.
Manx: As ta fys aym, yn saarey echyssyn dy nee yn vea veayn eh : cre-erbee er-y-fa shen ta mee dy loayrt, she myr ta’n Ayr er ghra rhym, myr shen ta mee loayrt.
CAB. XIII.

English: Now before the feast of the passover, when Jesus knew that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own which were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
Manx: Nish va fys ec Yeesey, roish feailley ny Caisht, dy darragh yn oor v’eh dy gholl ass y theihll shoh gys yn Ayr, myr v’eh graihagh er e vooinjer hene, va ayns y theihll, hug Eh graih daue gys y jerrey.

English: 2 And supper being ended, the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him ;
Manx: As myr v’ad gee nyn shibber, (va’n drogh-spyrryd nish er choyrt eh ayns cree Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon, dy vrah Eh.)

English: 3 Jesus knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he was come from God, and went to God ;
Manx: Va fys ec Yeesey dy row yn Ayr er chur dy chooilley nhee ayns ny laueyn echey, as dy nee veih Jee haink Eh, as dy nee gys Jee v’eh goll,

English: 4 He riseth from supper, and laid aside his garments ; and took a towel, and girded himself.
Manx: Dirree Eh veih shibber, as hug Eh jeh e gharmadyn, as ghow Eh aanrit, as chiangle Eh eh eh mysh.

English: 5 After that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.
Manx: As ny lurg shen, hug Eh ushtey ayns baishin, as ren Eh toshiaght dy niee cassyn e ostyllyn, as dy rubbey ad lesh yn aanrit va echey mysh.

English: 6 Then cometh he to Simon Peter : and Peter saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?
Manx: Eisht haink Eh gys Simon Peddyr : as dooyrt Peddyr rish, Hiarn, vel uss niee my chassyn’s?

English: 7 Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now ; but thou shalt know hereafter.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt Eh rish, Cha vel fys ayd nish cre ta mee dy yannoo ; agh bee fys ayd er ny yei shoh.

English: 8 Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.
Manx: Dooyrt Peddyr rish, Cha niee oo dy bragh my chassyn’s. Dreggyr Yeesey Eh, mannagh niee-yms oo, cha vod ayrn erbee ve ayd mârym.

English: 9 Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.
Manx: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr rish, Hiarn, cha nee ny lomarcan my chassyn, agh myrgeddin my laueyn, as my chione.

English: 10 Jesus saith to him, He that is washed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit : and ye are clean, but not all.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rish, Eshyn ta nieet, cha vel feme echey agh dy niee e chassyn, agh t’eh glen ooilley harrish : as ta shiuish glen, agh cha vel shiu ooilley myr shen.

English: 11 For he knew who should betray him ; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.
Manx: Son va fys echey quoi va ry hoi y vrah Eh ; shen-y-fa dooyrt Eh, Cha vel shiu ooilley glen.

English: 12 So after he had washed their feet, and had taken his garments, and was set down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?
Manx: Myr shen erreish da v’er niee ny cassyn oc, as tra v’eh er ghoaill e gharmadyn, as er hoie sheese reesht, dooyrt Eh roo, Vel fys eu cre ta mee er n’yannoo riu?

English: 13 Ye call me Master and Lord : and ye say well ; for so I am.
Manx: Ta shiu genmyss mish Mainshtyr, as Chiarn : as ta shiu gra dy mie ; son she shen mee.

English: 14 If I then, your Lord and Master, have washed your feet ; ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.
Manx: My ta mish eisht yn Chiarn as y Mainshtyr eu er niee nyn gassyn, lhisagh shiuish myrgeddin yn derrey yeh eu cassyn y jeh elley y niee.

English: 15 For I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have done to you.
Manx: Son ta mish er chur diu samplere, dy vod shiu jannoo myr ta mish er n’yannoo riu.

English: 16 Verily, verily, I say unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord ; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Cha vel y charvaant ny syrjey na e Hiarn, ny eshyn t’er ny choyrt, ny syrjey na eshyn ren y choyrt Eh.

English: 17 If ye know these things, happy are ye if ye do them.
Manx: My ta fys eu er ny reddyn shoh, bannit vees shiu ad y yannoo.

English: 18 ¶I speak not of you all : I know whom I have chosen : but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth bread with me hath lifted up his heel against me.
Manx: Cha vel mee loayrt jiu ooilley ; ta fys aym quoi ta mee er reih : agh dy vod y scriptyr ve cooilleenit, T’eshyn ta gee arran mârym, er hroggal e voyn m’oi.

English: 19 Now I tell you before it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am he.
Manx: Nish ta mee ginsh diu ro-laue, tra hig eh gy kione, dy vod shiu credjal dy nee mish Eh.

English: 20 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me ; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Eshyn ta jannoo soiagh jeh quoi-erbee ta mee dy choyrt, t’eh jannoo soiagh jeem’s : as eshyn ta soiaghey jeem’s, t’eh soiaghey jehsyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 21 When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
Manx: Tra va Yeesey er ghra shoh, v’eh seaghnit ayns e spyrryd, as dymmyrk Eh feanish, as dooyrt Eh, Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, dy jean annane eauish mish y vrah.

English: 22 Then the disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.
Manx: Eisht yeeagh ny ostyllyn er y chielley, dooteil quoi jeh v’eh loayrt.

English: 23 Now there was leaning on Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.
Manx: Nish va ny lhie er oghrish Yeesey, fer jeh ny ostyllyn echey v’eh graihagh er.

English: 24 Simon Peter therefore beckoned to him, that he should ask who it should be of whom he spake.
Manx: Chrie Simon Peddyr er-y-fa shen er, Eh dy ênaght quoi jeh v’eh loayrt.

English: 25 He then lying on Jesus’ breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?
Manx: Myr v’eh eisht ny lhie gys oghrish Yeesey, dooyrt eh rish, Hiarn, quoi Eh?

English: 26 Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when I have dipped it. And when he had dipped the sop, he gave it to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, She eshyn Eh da verrym greym dy arran, tra vee’m er hummey eh. As tra v’eh er hummey yn greym, hug Eh eh da Yuaase Iscariot mac Simon.

English: 27 And after the sop Satan entered into him. Then said Jesus unto him, That thou doest, do quickly.
Manx: As lurg y greym, hie yn drogh-spyrryd stiagh ayn. Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish, Shen t’ow dy yannoo, jean eh dy tappee.

English: 28 Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.
Manx: Nish cha row fys ec dooinney erbee ec y voayrd cre’n oyr v’echey dy loayrt shoh rish.

English: 29 For some of them thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus had said unto him, Buy those things that we have need of against the feast ; or, that he should give something to the poor.
Manx: Son heill paart, er-yn-oyr dy nee ec Yuaase va’n sporran, dy row Yeesey er ghra rish, Kionnee ny vees mad ny eme couyr yn eailley : ny Eh dy chur red ennagh da ny boghtyn.

English: 30 He then having received the sop went immediately out : and it was night.
Manx: Erreish da eisht v’er ghoaill yn greym dy arran, hie Eh chelleeragh magh : as va’n oie ayn.

English: 31 ¶Therefore, when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.
Manx: Shen-y-fa tra v’er gholl magh, dooyrt Yeesey, Nish ta’n Mac dooinney er ny ghloyraghey, as ta Jee er ny ghloyraghey ayn.

English: 32 If God be glorified in him, God shall also glorify him in himself, and shall straightway glorify him.
Manx: My ta Jee er ny ghloyraghey ayn, nee Jee myrgeddin eshyn y ghloyraghey ayn hene, as nee Eh dy tappee Eh y ghloyraghey.

English: 33 Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me : and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come ; so now I say to you.
Manx: Chloan veggey, foast tammylt beg ta mish mêriu. Nee shiu my hirrey : as myr dooyrt mee rish ny Hewnyn, Raad ta mish goll, cha vod shiuish cheet ; myr shen ta mee nish gra riuish.

English: 34 A new commandment I give unto you, That ye love one another ; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.
Manx: Saarey noa ta mee dy choyrt diu, Shiu dy ve graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley ; myr ta mish er ve graihagh erriuish, dy der shiuish myrgeddin graih yn derrey yeh da’n jeh elley.

English: 35 By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.
Manx: Liorish shoh vees fys ec dy chooilley ghooinney dy vel shiu gynsaghey voym’s, my vees shiu graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley.

English: 36 ¶Simon Peter said unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered him, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now ; but thou shalt follow me afterwards.
Manx: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr rish, Hiarn, c’raad t’ow goll? Dreggyr Yeesey Eh, Raad ta mee goll, cha vod oo geiyrt orrym nish ; agh eiyree oo orrym ny lurg shoh.

English: 37 Peter said unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thy sake.
Manx: Dooyrt Peddyr rish, Hiarn, cre’n-fa nagh voddym geiyrt ort nish? Scarrym rish my vioys er dty ghraih.

English: 38 Jesus answered him, Wilt thou lay down thy life for my sake? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey Eh, Jean oo scarrey rish dty vioys er my ghraih’s? Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt, Nagh gerr y kellagh derrey obbys oo mish three keayrtyn.
CAB. XIV.

English: Let not your heart be troubled : ye believe in God, believe also in me.
Manx: Ny lhig da’n cree eu ve seaghnit : ta shiu credjal ayns Jee, cred-jee myrgeddin aynyms.

English: 2 In my Father’s house are many mansions : if it were not so, I would have told you. I go to prepare a place for you.
Manx: Ayns thie my Ayrey ta ymmodee ynnydyn-vaghee ; dy beagh eh er aght elley, v’ein er n’insh diu : ta mee goll dy yannoo aarloo ynnyd er nyn son.

English: 3 And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and receive you unto myself ; that where I am, there ye may be also.
Manx: As my hem’s dy yannoo aarloo ynnyd er nyn son, higgym reesht, as goym shiu hym pene, raad ta mish dy vod shiuish ve myrgeddin.

English: 4 And whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.
Manx: As ta fys eu cre’n raad ta mee goll, as shione diu yn raad.

English: 5 Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest ; and how can we know the way?
Manx: Dooyrt Thomase rish, Hiarn, cha s’ain cre’n raad t’ow goll, as kys oddys enney y ve ain er y raad?

English: 6 Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life : no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rish, Mish y raad, yn irriney, as y vea : cha vel dooinney erbee cheet gys yn Ayr, agh lioryms.

English: 7 If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also : and from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.
Manx: Dy beagh enney er ve eu orryms, veagh enney eu er my Ayr myrgeddin : as nish ta enney eu er, as ta shiu er vakin Eh.

English: 8 Philip saith unto him, Lord, shew us the Father, and it sufficeth us.
Manx: Dooyrt Philip rish, Hiarn, Jeeagh dooin yn Ayr, as cha shir mad arragh.

English: 9 Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and yet hast thou not known me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father ; and how sayest thou then, Shew us the Father?
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rish, Vel mish er ve choud shen mêriu, as nagh nione dhyts mee foast, Philip? eshyn t’er my akin’s, t’eh er vakin yn Ayr ; as kys tow uss gra eisht, Jeeagh dooin yn Ayr.

English: 10 Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself : but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.
Manx: Nagh vel oo credjal dy vel mish ayns yn Ayr, as yn Ayr aynyms? ny goan ta mish dy loayrt riu, cha vel mee loayrt jee’m pene : agh yn Ayr ta vaghey aynym, eshyn ta jannoo ny obbraghyn.

English: 11 Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me : or else believe me for the very works’ sake.
Manx: Cred-jee mish, dy vel mee ayns yn Ayr, as yn Ayr aynyms : er-nonney cred-jee mee kyndagh rish ny eer obbraghyn.

English: 12 Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also ; and greater works than these shall he do ; because I go unto my Father.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Eshyn ta credjal aynyms, ny obbraghyn ta mish dy yannoo nee eshyn myrgeddin, as obbraghyn smoo na ad shoh nee Eh ; er-y-fa dy vel mish goll roym gys my Ayr.

English: 13 And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
Manx: As cre-erbee nee shiu y hirrey ayns yn ennym aym’s, shen neem’s y yannoo, dy vod yn Ayr v’er ny ghloyraghey ayns y Vac.

English: 14 If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
Manx: My hirrys shiu nhee erbee ayns yn ennym aym’s, nee’m eh y yannoo.

English: 15 ¶If ye love me, keep my commandments.
Manx: My ta shiu graihagh orryms, freïl-jee m’annaghyn.

English: 16 And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may abide with you for ever ;
Manx: As guee-yms gys yn Ayr, as ver Eh hiu Fer-gerjagh elley, dy vod Eh tannaghtyn mêriu son dy bragh ;

English: 17 Even the Spirit of truth ; whom the world cannot receive, because it seeth him not, neither knoweth him : but ye know him ; for he dwelleth with you, and shall be in you.
Manx: Spyrryd ny firriney, nagh vod y seihll y ghoaill, er-y-fa nagh vel ad dy akin Eh, as nagh nione daue Eh : agh shione diuish Eh, son t’eh tannaghtyn mêriu, as bee Eh ayndiu.

English: 18 I will not leave you comfortless : I will come to you.
Manx: Cha vaagym shiu fegooish gerjagh ; higgyms hiu.

English: 19 Yet a little while, and the world seeth me no more ; but ye see me : because I live, ye shall live also.
Manx: Foast tammylt beg, as cha vel y seihll dy my akin ny smoo ; agh ta shiuish dy my akin : er-yn-oyr dy vel mish bio, bee shiuish bio myrgeddin.

English: 20 At that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.
Manx: Ayns y laa shen vees fys eu dy vel mish ayns my Ayr, as shiuish aynyms, as mish ayndiuish.

English: 21 He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me : and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself to him.
Manx: Eshyn ta my annaghyn’s echey, as ta freaylley ad, eshyn Eh ta graihagh orrym : as eshyn ta graihagh orrym, ver my Ayr graih da, as verryms graih da, as soilshee-ym mee hene da.

English: 22 Judas saith unto him, not Iscariot, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?
Manx: Dooyrt Yuaase rish, cha nee Iscariot, Hiarn, kys oddys eh ve dy jean oo oo hene y hoilshaghey dooinyn, as cha nee da’n seihll?

English: 23 Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words : and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey as dooyrt Eh rish, My ta dooinney graihagh orrym, freillee Eh my ghoan : as ver my Ayr graih da, as hig mayd huggey, as nee mayd tannaghtyn mârish.

English: 24 He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings : and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s which sent me.
Manx: Eshyn nagh vel graihagh orryms, cha vel Eh freaylley my ghoan : as y goo ta shiu dy chlashtyn, cha nee lhiam’s eh, agh goo yn Ayr t’er my choyrt.

English: 25 These things have I spoken unto you, being yet present with you.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu, son dy vel mee foast mêriu.

English: 26 But the Comforter, which is the Holy Ghost, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things to your remembrance, whatsoever I have said unto you.
Manx: Agh nee Fer-ny-gherjagh, ta shen yn Spyrryd Noo, Eh nee yn Ayr y choyrt ayns yn ennym aym’s, gynsaghey diu dy chooilley nhee, as tayrn dy chooilley nhee gys nyn gooinaghtyn, cre-erbee ta mish er ghra riu.

English: 27 Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you : not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
Manx: Shee ta mee dy aagail mêriu, my hee ta mee dy choyrt diu : cha nee myr ta’n seihll coyrt, ta mish dy choyrt eh diu. Ny lig da’n cree eu ve seaghnit, ny agglagh.

English: 28 Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come again unto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father : for my Father is greater than I.
Manx: Ta shiu er chlashtyn kys dooyrt mee riu, Ta mee goll roym, as cheet reesht hiu. Dy beagh shiu graihagh orrym, ghoghe shiu boggey, er-y-fa dy dooyrt mee, Ta mee goll roym gys my Ayr : son ta my Ayr ny syrjey na mish.

English: 29 And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye might believe.
Manx: As nish ta mee er n’insh diu ro-laue, tra hig eh gy kione, dy vod shiu credjal

English: 30 Hereafter I will not talk much with you : for the prince of this world cometh, and hath nothing in me.
Manx: Veih shoh magh cha loayrym cooid-vooar riu : son ta prince y theihll shoh cheet, as cha vel nhee erbee echey aynyms.

English: 31 But that the world may know that I love the Father ; and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.
Manx: Agh dy vod fys ve ec y theihll dy vel mish graihagh er yn Ayr ; as myr hug yn Ayr saarey dou, myr shen ta mee jannoo. Irree-jee, lig dooin ass shoh.
CAB. XV.

English: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.
Manx: Mish y billey-feeney firrinagh, as my Ayr yn far-thie.

English: 2 Every branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away : and every branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit.
Manx: Dy chooilley vanglane aynyms nagh vel gymmyrkey mess, t’eh dy ghoaill ersooyl : as dy chooilley vanglane ta gymmyrkey mess, t’eh dy ghlenney eh, dy vod eh thooilloo mess y chur magh.

English: 3 Now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.
Manx: Nish ta shiuish glen trooid y goo ta mish er loayrt riu.

English: 4 Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine ; no more can ye, except ye abide in me.
Manx: Jean-jee tannaghtyn aynyms, as mish ayndiuish. Myr nagh vod y banglane mess y ymmyrkey jeh hene, mannagh bee eh soit ayns y villey-feeney : cha-moo oddys shiuish, mannagh jean shiu tannaghtyn aynyms.

English: 5 I am the vine, ye are the branches : He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit : for without me ye can do nothing.
Manx: Mish y billey-feeney, shiuish ny banglaneyn : Eshyn ta tannaghtyn aynyms, as mish aynsyn, t’eh shoh cur magh lane mess : son m’egooish’s cha vod shiu nhee erbee y yannoo.

English: 6 If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered ; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.
Manx: Mannagh vel dooinney tannaghtyn aynyms t’eh tilgit magh myr banglane, as t’eh fioghey ; as t’ad dyn deiy as dyn dilgey ad ayns yn aile, as t’ad er nyn lostey.

English: 7 If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
Manx: My nee shiu tannaghtyn aynyms, as my ghoan’s tannaghtyn ayndiuish, shirree shiu cre sailliu, as bee eh jeant er nyn son.

English: 8 Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit ; so shall ye be my disciples.
Manx: Liorish shoh ta my Ayr er ny ghloyraghey, shiu dy chur magh lane mess, as bee shoh adsyn ta gynsaghey voym’s.

English: 9 As the Father hath loved me, so have I loved you : continue ye in my love.
Manx: Myr ta’n Ayr er chur graih dooys, myr shen ta mish er chur graih diuish : jean-jee tannaghtyn ayns my ghraih.

English: 10 If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love ; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.
Manx: My nee shiu my annaghyn y reaylley, nee shiu tannaghtyn ayns my ghraih : myr ta mish er vreaylley annaghyn my Ayrey, as tannaghtyn ayns y ghraih echyssyn.

English: 11 These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu, dy vod y boggey aym’s ve er-mayrn ayndiu, as dy vod y boggey eauish v’er ny yannoo magh.

English: 12 This is my commandment, That ye love one another, as I have loved you.
Manx: Shoh my haarey, Shiu dy chur graih yn derrey yeh da’n jeh elley, myr ta mish er ve graihagh erriuish.

English: 13 Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
Manx: Graih smoo na shoh cha vel ec dooinney erbee, ny [sic] dooinney dy scarrey rish e vioys son e chaarjyn.

English: 14 Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.
Manx: She my chaarjyn shiuish, my nee shiu ny ta mish dy haarey diu.

English: 15 Henceforth I call you not servants ; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth : but I have called you friends ; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you.
Manx: Veih shoh magh cha vel mee dy enmyss shiu sharvaantyn ; son cha vel fys ec y charvaant, cre ta e hiarn dy yannoo : agh ta mee er n’enmyss shiu caarjyn ; son dy chooilley nhee ta mee er chlashtyn veih my Ayr, ta mee er hoilshaghey diu.

English: 16 Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain : that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.
Manx: Cha vel shiuish er my reih’s, agh ta mish er reih shiuish, as er chur shiu ayns pooar, dy vod shiu goll magh as mess y ymmyrkey, as dy vod y mess eu ve er-mayrn : cre-erbee nee shiu y hirrey er yn Ayr ayns yn ennym aym’s, dy vod Eh y chur diu eh.

English: 17 These things I command you, that ye love one another.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mish dy haarey diu, dy vod shiu ve graihagh yn derrey yeh er y jeh elley.

English: 18 If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you.
Manx: My ta feoh ec y seihll erriu, ta fys eu dy dug eh feoh dooys hoshiaght.

English: 19 If ye were of the world, the world would love his own : but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
Manx: Dy beagh shiuish jeh’n theihll, veagh y seihll graihagh er e vooinjer hene : agh er-y-fa nagh vel shiu jeh’n theihll, agh dy vel mish er reih shiu ass y theihll, shen-y-fa ta feoh ec y theihll erriu.

English: 20 Remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you ; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.
Manx: Cooinee-jee er y fockle loayr mish riu, Cha vel y charvaant ny syrjey na e hiarn. My t’ad er n’yannoo tranlaase orryms, nee ad myrgeddin tranlaase erriuish : my t’ad er reaylley my ghoan’s, freillee ad ny goan eauish.

English: 21 But all these things will they do unto you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.
Manx: Agh dy chooilley nhee jeu shoh nee ad riu kyndagh rish yn ennym aym’s, er-y-fa nagh vel enney oc ersyn t’er my choyrt.

English: 22 If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin : but now they have no cloak for their sin.
Manx: Mannagh bein’s er jeet as er loayrt roo, cha beagh peccah er ve oc : agh nish cha vel leshtal oc son nyn beccah.

English: 23 He that hateth me hateth my Father also.
Manx: Eshyn ta feoh echey orryms, ta feoh echey er my Ayr myrgeddin.

English: 24 If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin : but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.
Manx: Mannagh bein’s er n’yannoo nyn mast’ oc ny obbraghyn nagh ren dooinney erbee elley, cha beagh peccah er ve oc : agh nish t’ad chammah er vakin, as er chur feoh chammah dooys as da my Ayr.

English: 25 But this cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.
Manx: Agh ta shoh, dy vod y raa ve cooilleenit ta scruit ayns y leigh oc, Hug ad feoh dou fegooish oyr.

English: 26 But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall testify of me :
Manx: Agh tra vees Fer-ny-gherjagh er jeet, Eh verryms hiu veih’n Ayr, ta shen, Spyrryd ny firriney, ta cheet magh veih yn Ayr, nee Eh feanish y ymmyrkey jee’ms.

English: 27 And ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
Manx: As nee shiuish myrgeddin feanish y ymmyrkey, er-y-fa dy vel shiu er ve mârym er dyn toshiaght.
CAB. XVI.

English: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu, son nagh jean y credjue eu failleil..

English: 2 They shall put you out of the synagogues : yea, the time cometh, that whosoever killeth you will think that he doeth God service.
Manx: Ver ad shiu magh ass ny kialteenyn : as ta’n oor cheet, quoi-erbee varrys shiu, dy smooinee Eh dy bee Eh shirveish Jee.

English: 3 And these things will they do unto you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.
Manx: As ny reddyn shoh nee ad riu, er-yn-oyr nagh vel enney oc er yn Ayr, ny orryms.

English: 4 But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not unto you at the beginning, because I was with you.
Manx: Agh ny reddyn shoh ta mish er n’insh diu, tra hig yn earish, dy vod shiu cooinaghtyn dy dinsh mee diu jeu. As ny reddyn shoh cha loayr mee riu ec y toshiaght, er-y-fa dy row mee mêriu.

English: 5 But now I go my way to him that sent me ; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?
Manx: Agh nish ta mee goll roym huggeysyn t’er my choyrt, as cha vel annane eu fênaght jee’m C’raad t’ow goll?

English: 6 But because I have said these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.
Manx: Agh er-y-fa dy vel mee er ghra ny reddyn shoh riu, ta trimshey er lhieeney ny creeaghyn eu.

English: 7 Nevertheless I tell you the truth ; It is expedient for you that I go away : for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you ; but if I depart, I will send him unto you.
Manx: Ny-yeih, ta mish ginsh diu yn irriney ; Te ymmyrchagh er nyn son mish dy gholl roym : son mannagh jem roym, cha jig Fer-ny-gherjagh hiu ; agh my hem’s roym, verrym Eh hiu.

English: 8 And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment :
Manx: As tra vees Eh er jeet, ver Eh oghsan da’n seihll son peccah, as cairys, as briwnys :

English: 9 Of sin, because they believe not on me ;
Manx: Son peccah, er-y-fa nagh vel ad credjal aynyms ;

English: 10 Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more ;
Manx: Son cairys, er-y-fa dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr, as nagh vaik shiu mee ny smoo ;

English: 11 Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.
Manx: Son briwnys, er-yn-oyr dy vel prince y theihll shoh er ny vriwnys.

English: 12 I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.
Manx: Ta foast ymmodee reddyn aym’s dy ghra riu, agh cha vod shiu ad y ymmyrkey nish.

English: 13 Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth : for he shall not speak of himself ; but whatsoever he shall hear, that shall he speak : and he will shew you things to come.
Manx: Agh tra hig eshyn, Spyrryd ny firriney, leeidee Eh shiu gys dy chooilley irrinys : son cha loayr Eh jeh hene ; agh cre-erbee nee Eh y chlashtyn, shen loayrys Eh ; as soilshee Eh diu reddyn ta ry heet.

English: 14 He shall glorify me : for he shall receive of mine, and shall shew it unto you.
Manx: Nee Eh mish y ghloyraghey : son yiow Eh jeh ny ta lhiam’s as soilshee Eh eh diuish.

English: 15 All things that the Father hath are mine : therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall shew it unto you.
Manx: Ta dy chooilley nhee t’ec yn Ayr lhiam’s : shen-y-fa dooyrt mee, dy gow Eh jeh ny ta lhiam’s, as dy soilshee Eh eh diuish.

English: 16 A little while, and ye shall not see me : and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.
Manx: Tammylt beg, as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht, tammylt beg, as hee shiu mee, er-y-fa dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr.

English: 17 Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye shall not see me : and again, a little while, and ye shall see me : and, Because I go to the Father?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt paart jeh’n vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er nyn mast’ oc hene, Cre shoh t’eh dy ghra rooin, Tammylt beg, as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht, tammylt beg, as hee shiu mee : as, Er-yn-oyr dy vel mee goll roym gys yn Ayr?

English: 18 They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we cannot tell what he saith.
Manx: Dooyrt ad er-y-fa shen, Cre shoh t’eh dy ghra, Tammylt beg? cha s’ain cre t’eh dy ghra.

English: 19 Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said unto them, Do ye enquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me : and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?
Manx: Nish va fys ec Yeesey dy row ad aignagh dy ênaght jeh, as dooyrt Eh roo, Vel shiu briaght nyn mast’ eu hene, er-y-fa dy dooyrt mee, Tammylt beg, as cha vaik shiu mee : as reesht, tammylt beg, as hee shiu mee?

English: 20 Verily, verily, I say unto you, That ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice : and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Dy jean shiuish keayney as dobberan, agh nee yn seihll boggey y ghoaill : as bee shiuish trimshagh, agh bee yn trimshey eu er ny hyndaa gys boggey.

English: 21 A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come : but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.
Manx: Ta ben, tra t’ee er-troailt, as trimshey eck, er-yn-oyr dy vel yn oor eck er jeet : agh cha leah as t’ee er ny livrey jeh’n liannoo, cha vel ee ny sodjey cooinaghtyn er yn angaish, son boggey dy vel dooinney er ny ruggey gys y theihll.

English: 22 And ye now therefore have sorrow : but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.
Manx: As ta nish er-y-fa shen trimshey eauish : agh heeyms shiu reesht, as gowee yn cree eu boggey, as y boggey eu cha gow dooinney erbee veu.

English: 23 And in that day ye shall ask me nothing. Verily, verily, I say unto you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give it you.
Manx: As ayns y laa shen cha jean shiu nhee erbee y ênaght jee’ms : Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra riu, Cre-erbee hirrys shiu er yn Ayr ayns yn ennym aym’s, ver Eh diu eh.

English: 24 Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name : ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.
Manx: Cha vel shiu foast er hirrey nhee erbee ayns yn ennym aym’s : shir-jee as yiow shiu, dy vod y boggey eu v’er ny yannoo magh.

English: 25 These things have I spoken unto you in proverbs : but the time cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall shew you plainly of the Father.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu ayns coraaghyn-dorraghey : agh ta’n traa cheet tra nagh loayrym riu ny smoo ayns coraaghyn-dorraghey, agh soilshee-ym diu dy plain jeh’n Ayr.

English: 26 At that day ye shall ask in my name : and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you :
Manx: Ayns y laa shen nee shiu geearree ayns y ennym aym’s : as cha vel mee gra riu, dy guee-ym gys yn Ayr er nyn son :

English: 27 For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.
Manx: Son ta’n Ayr hene graihagh erriu, er-y-fa dy vel shiuish er ve graihagh orryms, as dy chred shiu dy daink mee magh veih Jee.

English: 28 I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world : again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.
Manx: Haink mee magh veih’n Ayr, as ta mee er jeet gys y theihll : reesht, ta mee faagail y seihll, as goll roym gys yn Ayr.

English: 29 His disciples said unto him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.
Manx: Dooyrt y vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er rish, Cur-my-ner, nish t’ow loayrt dy plain, as cha vel oo loayrt coraa-dorraghey erbee.

English: 30 Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee : by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.
Manx: Nish ta shin shickyr dy vel fys ayd er dy chooilley nhee, as nagh vel feme ayd dooinney erbee dy ênaght jeed : liorish shoh ta shin credjal dy daink oo magh veih Jee.

English: 31 Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey ad, Vel shiu nish credjal?

English: 32 Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone : and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
Manx: Cur-my-ner ta’n oor cheet, as nish er jeet, dy bee shiu er nyn skeayley dy chooilley ghooinney gys e ynnyd hene, as dy vaag shiu mish my lomarcan : as foast cha vel mee my lomarcan, er-y-fa dy vel yn Ayr mârym.

English: 33 These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation : but be of good cheer ; I have overcome the world.
Manx: Ny reddyn shoh ta mee er loayrt riu, aynyms dy vod shee y ve eu. Ayns y theihll vees seaghyn eu : agh bee-jee dy yien mie, ta mish er gheddyn barriaght er y theihll.
CAB. XVII.

English: These words spake Jesus, and lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, Father, the hour is come ; glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee :
Manx: Ny goan shoh loayr Yeesey ; as hrog Eh seose e hooyllyn gys niau, as dooyrt Eh, Ayr, ta’n oor er jeet ; jean dty Vac y ghloyraghey, dy vod dty Vac myrgeddin uss y ghloyraghey.

English: 2 As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that he should give eternal life to as many as thou hast given him.
Manx: Myr t’ow er chur da pooar harrish dy chooilley eill, dy vod Eh yn vea veayn y choyrt da whilleen as t’ow er chur da.

English: 3 And this is life eternal, that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.
Manx: As shoh yn vea veayn, tushtey y ve oc jeed’s yn ynrycan Jee firrinagh, as jeh Yeesey Creest t’ow er ny choyrt.

English: 4 I have glorified thee on the earth : I have finished the work which thou gavest me to do.
Manx: Ta mee er ghloyraghey oo er y thalloo : ta mee er chooilleeney yn obbyr hug oo dou dy yannoo.

English: 5 And now, O Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.
Manx: As nish, O Ayr, jean mish y ghloyraghey mârt hene, lesh y ghloyr v’aym mârt roish my row seihll ayn.

English: 6 I have manifested thy name unto the men which thou gavest me out of the world : thine they were, and thou gavest them me ; and they have kept thy word.
Manx: Ta mee er hoilshaghey dt’ennym gys ny deiney hug oo dou ass y theihll : lhiats v’ad, as hug oo ad dooys ; as t’ad er vreaylley dty ghoo.

English: 7 Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.
Manx: Nish t’ad er hoiggal dy nee voids ta dy chooilley nhee t’ow er choyrt dou.

English: 8 For I have given unto them the words which thou gavest me ; and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didst send me.
Manx: Son hug mish dauesyn ny goan hug uss dooys ; as t’ad er ghoaill huc hene ad, as er hoiggal ayns shickyrys dy daink mee magh voids, as t’ad er chredjal dy ren oo my choyrt.

English: 9 I pray for them : I pray not for the world, but for them which thou hast given me ; for they are thine.
Manx: Ta mee guee ort er nyn son : cha vel mee guee son y seihll, agh er ny son ocsyn t’ow er choyrt dou, son she lhiats ad.

English: 10 And all mine are thine, and thine are mine ; and I am glorified in them.
Manx: As ta ooilley ny ta lhiam’s lhiats, as ny ta lhiats lhiam’s, as ta mee er ny [sic: my] ghloyraghey ayndoo.

English: 11 And now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep through thine own name those whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we are.
Manx: As nish cha vel mish dy ve ny sodjey ayns y theihll, agh t’ad shoh ayns y theihll, as ta mish cheet hoods. Ayr chasherick, freill trooid dt’ennym hene adsyn t’ow er chur dou, dy vod ad ve annane, myr ta shinyn.

English: 12 While I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name : those that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but the son of perdition ; that the scripture might be fulfilled.
Manx: Choud as va mee mâroo ayns y theihll, dreill mee ad ayns dt’ennym’s : adsyn hug oo dou dreill mee, as cha vel annane oc caillit, mannagh vel mac y toyrt-mow : dy voddagh yn scriptyr ve cooilleenit.

English: 13 And now come I to thee ; and these things I speak in the world, that they might have my joy fulfilled in themselves.
Manx: As nish ta mee cheet hoods, as ny reddyn shoh ta mee dy loayrt ayns y theihll, dy vod y boggey aym’s y ve oc jeant magh ayndoo hene.

English: 14 I have given them thy word ; and the world hath hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
Manx: Ta mee er chur daue dty ghoo ; as ta’n seihll er chur feoh daue, er-y-fa nagh vel ad jeh’n theihll, myr nagh vel mish jeh’n theihll.

English: 15 I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.
Manx: Cha vel mee guee oo dy ghoaill ad ass y theihll, agh oo dy reaylley ad veih’n olk.

English: 16 They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
Manx: Cha vel adsyn jeh’n theihll, myr nagh vel mish jeh’n theihll.

English: 17 Sanctify them through thy truth : thy word is truth.
Manx: Casherick ad son dt’irriney : dty ghoo she firrinys eh.

English: 18 As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent them into the world.
Manx: Myr tow uss er my choyrt’s gys y theihll, myr shen ta mish myrgeddin er chur adsyn gys y theihll.

English: 19 And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they also might be sanctified through the truth.
Manx: As er ny son ocsyn ta mish dy my chasherickey hene, dy vod adsyn myrgeddin v’er nyn gasherickey son yn irriney.

English: 20 Neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall believe on me through their word ;
Manx: Cha-moo ta mee guee er ny son oc shoh nyn lomarcan, agh myrgeddin er ny son ocsyn nee credjal aynyms trooid y goo oc :

English: 21 That they all may be one ; as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us : that the world may believe that thou hast sent me.
Manx: Dy vod ad ooilley ve annane, myr tow uss Ayr aynyms, as mish aynyds ; dy vod adsyn myrgeddin ve annane ayninyn : dy vod y seihll credjal dy ren oo my choyrt.

English: 22 And the glory which thou gavest me I have given them ; that they may be one, even as we are one :
Manx: As y ghloyr hug uss dooys, ta mish er chur dauesyn : dy vod ad ve annane, myr ta shinyn annane.

English: 23 I in them, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one ; and that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved me.
Manx: Mish ayndoosyn, as uss aynyms, dy vod ad cheet dy ve dy firrinagh ayns annane, as dy vod fys ve ec y seihll dy vel oo er my choyrt, as dy vel oo er ve graihagh orroosyn, myr t’ow er ve graihagh orryms.

English: 24 Father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with me where I am ; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me : for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.
Manx: Ayr, Saïllym adsyn t’ow er chur dou, dy ve mârym raad ta mee ; dy vod ad my ghloyr t’ow er chur dou y akin : son t’ow er ve graihagh orryms roish my row yn seihll er ny chroo.

English: 25 O righteous Father, the world hath not known thee : but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.
Manx: Ayr chairagh, cha ghow yn seihll tushtey jeed ; agh ta tushtey er ve aym’s jeed, as t’ad shoh er hoiggal dy vel oo er my choyrt.

English: 26 And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare it : that the love wherewith thou hast loved me may be in them, and I in them.
Manx: As ta mee er hoilshaghey daue dt’ennym’s, as nee’m y hoilshaghey eh : dy vod y graih, liorish t’ow er ve graihagh orryms, ve ayndoosyn, as mish ayndoo.
CAB. XVIII.

English: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.
Manx: Tra va Yeesey er loayrt ny goan shoh, hie Eh magh marish e ostyllyn harrish y strooan Cedron, raad va garey, as hie eshyn as e ostyllyn stiagh ayn.

English: 2 And Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place : for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.
Manx: As boyn da Yuaase neesht va dy vrah Eh, yn ynnyd : son va Yeesey cliaghtey ve dy mennick ayns shen marish e ostyllyn.

English: 3 Judas then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
Manx: Hooar Yuaase eisht sheshaght dy gheiney, as fir-oik veih ny ard-saggyrtyn as ny Phariseeyn, as haink Eh ayns shen lesh lonteyryn, as torchyn as armyn.

English: 4 Jesus therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom seek ye?
Manx: Va fys ec Yeesey er-y-fa shen er dy chooilley nhee harragh er, as hie Eh magh as dooyrt Eh roo, Quoi ta shiu dy hirrey?

English: 5 They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am he. And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.
Manx: Dreggyr ad Eh, Yeesey dy Nazareth. Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Mish Eh. As va Yuaase myrgeddin ren y vrah Eh, ny hassoo mâroo.

English: 6 As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground.
Manx: Cha leah eisht as v’eh er ghra roo, Mish Eh, hie ad back, as huit ad gys y thalloo.

English: 7 Then asked he them again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.
Manx: Eisht dênee Eh jeu reesht, Quoi ta shiu dy hirrey? As dooyrt adsyn, Yeesey dy Nazareth.

English: 8 Jesus answered, I have told you that I am he : if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way :
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Ta mee er n’insh diu dy nee mish Eh. My ta shiu er-y-fa shen dy my hirrey, lig-jee daue shoh goll roue :

English: 9 That the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, Of them which thou gavest me have I lost none.
Manx: Dy voddagh y raa loayr Eh cooilleenit, Jeusyn hug oo dou, cha vel mee er choall annane.

English: 10 Then Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
Manx: Eisht va cliwe ec Simon Peddyr, as hayrn Eh eh, as woaill Eh fer-mooinjerey yn ard-saggyrt, as yiare Eh yn chleash yesh jeh. Va ennym y fer-mooinjerey shen Malchus.

English: 11 Then said Jesus unto Peter, Put up thy sword into the sheath : the cup which my Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey rish Peddyr, Cur seose dty chliwe ayns y scabbard : yn cappan ta my Ayr er chur dou, nagh niuym eh?

English: 12 Then the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,
Manx: Eisht ghow yn cheshaght, as y captan, as fir-oik ny Hewnyn Yeesey, as chiangle ad Eh,

English: 13 And led him away to Annas first ; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.
Manx: As leeid ad Eh ersooyl gys Annas hoshiaght (son v’eh shen ny ayr ’sy leigh da Caiaphas, va ny ard-saggyrt yn vlein shen.)

English: 14 Now Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
Manx: Nish she Caiaphas v’er chur choyrle da ny Hewnyn, dy row eh ymmyrchagh un dooinney dy ve er ny choyrt gy baase son y pobble.

English: 15 ¶And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple : that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.
Manx: As deiyr Simon Peddyr as ostyl elley er Yeesey. Yn ostyl shen va enney ec yn ard-saggyrt er, as hie Eh stiagh marish Yeesey gys thie yn ard-saggyrt.

English: 16 But Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.
Manx: Agh hass Peddyr ec y dorrys er cheu-mooie. Eisht hie magh yn ostyl elley shen va enney ec yn ard-saggyrt er, as loayr Eh ree-ish va currym y dorrys urree, as hug Eh lesh stiagh Peddyr.

English: 17 Then saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also one of this man’s disciples? He saith, I am not.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt y ven-aeg va currym y dorrys urreee [sic] rish Peddyr, Nagh nee fer jeh’n vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er y dooinney shoh uss neesht? Dooyrt eshyn, Cha nee.

English: 18 And the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals ; for it was cold : and they warmed themselves : and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.
Manx: As va ny sharvaantyn as ny fir-oik nyn shassoo ayns shen, ec aile geayill v’ad er n’yannoo (son ve feayr) as v’ad dyn jiow ad-hene : as hass Peddyr mâroo, as hiow Eh Eh hene.

English: 19 ¶The high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.
Manx: Dênee yn ard-saggyrt eisht jeh Yeesey mychione yn vooinjer va sheer geiyrt er, as mychione yn ynsagh echey.

English: 20 Jesus answered him, I spake openly to the world ; I ever taught in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the Jews always resort ; and in secret have I said nothing.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey Eh, Loayr mee dy foshlit rish y theihll : Dynsee mee kinjagh ayns y cheeill, as ayns y chiamble, raad ta ny Hewnyn kinjagh thaaghey, as dy follit cha vel mee er ghra nhee erbee.

English: Why askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said unto them : behold, they know what I said.
Manx: 21. Cre’n-fa t’ow fênaght jee’ms? fênee jeusyn t’er my chlashtyn, cre ta mee er ghra roo : cur-my-ner, ta fys oc cre ta mee er ghra.

English: 22 And when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?
Manx: As tra v’eh erreish ny goan shoh y loayrt, woaill fer jeh ny fir-oik va ny hassoo ayns shen Yeesey lesh bass e laue, gra, Nee shen myr t’ow freggyrt yn ard-saggyrt?

English: 23 Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil : but if well, why smitest thou me?
Manx: Dansoor Yeesey Eh, My ta mee er loayrt dy olk, ymmyrk feanish jeh’n olk : agh my loayr mee dy mie, cre’n-fa woaill uss mee?

English: 24 Now Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.
Manx: (Nish va Annas er choyrt Eh kainlt gys Caiaphas yn ard-saggyrt.)

English: 25 And Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it, and said, I am not.
Manx: As va Simon Peddyr ny hassoo as dy hiow Eh hene : Dooyrt ad er-y-fa shen rish, Nagh nee fer jeh’n vooinjer va sheer geaiyrt er uss neesht? Dob Eh, as dooyrt eh, Cha nee.

English: 26 One of the servants of the high priest, being his kinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?
Manx: Dooyrt fer jeh sharvaantyn yn ard-saggyrt (va moonjerys dasyn va Peddyr er yiarey yn chleash jeh) Nagh vaik mish oo marish ayns y gharey?

English: 27 Peter then denied again : and immediately the cock crew.
Manx: Eisht dob Peddyr reesht, as chelleeragh gherr y kellagh.

English: 28 ¶Then led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment : and it was early ; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled ; but that they might eat the passover.
Manx: Eisht leeid ad Yeesey veih Caiaphas gys hall y vriwnys : as ve moghey, as cha jagh ad hene stiagh ayns hall ny briwnys, er aggle dy beagh ad neu-ghlen ; as nagh voddagh ad yn Eayn-caisht y ee.

English: 29 Pilate then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?
Manx: Hie Pilate eisht magh huc, as dooyrt Eh, Cre ta shiu dy chur gys lieh yn dooinney shoh?

English: 30 They answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.
Manx: Dreggyr adsyn as dooyrt ad, Erbey dy nee drogh-yantagh Eh, cha beagh shin er livrey Eh hoods.

English: 31 Then said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death :
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Pilate roo, Gow-jee shiuish Eh, as briwnys-jee Eh cordail rish y leigh eu. Dooyrt ny Hewnyn er-y-fa shen rish, Cha vel eh lowit dooinyn dooinney erbee y chur gy baase :

English: 32 That the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.
Manx: Dy voddagh y raa loayr Yeesey ve cooilleenit, soilshaghey cre’n baase v’eh dy hurranse.

English: 33 Then Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
Manx: Eisht hie Pilate stiagh reesht ayns hall ny briwnys, as deïe Eh er Yeesey, as dooyrt Eh rish, Nee ree ny Hewnyn oo?

English: 34 Jesus answered him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or did others tell it thee of me?
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey Eh, Vel uss dy ghra shoh jeed hene, ny nee feallagh elley dooyrt rhyt
eh my mychione’s ?

English: 35 Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me : what hast thou done?
Manx: Dreggyr Pilate, Vel mish my Hew? She dty ashoon hene as ny ard-saggyrtyn livrey oo seose hym’s : Cre t’ow er n’yannoo?

English: 36 Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world : if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews : but now is my kingdom not from hence.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Cha vel my reeriaght’s jeh’n theihll shoh : dy beagh my reeriaght jeh’n theihll shoh, eisht veagh my harvaantyn er chaggey, nagh b’eïn er my livrey gys ny Hewnyn, agh nish cha nee veih shoh ta my reeriaght.

English: 37 Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end was I born, and for this cause came I into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.
Manx: Dooyrt Pilate er-y-fa shen rish, Vel oo dty ree eisht? Dreggyr Yeesey, Tow uss dy ghra dy vel mee my ree. Er son shoh ruggyr mee, as er-yn-oyr shoh haink mee gys y theihll, dy ymmyrkey feanish gys yn irriney. Ta dy chooilley annane ta jeh’n irriney clashtyn my choraa.

English: 38 Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault at all.
Manx: Dooyrt Pilate rish, Cre ta’n irriney shen? as tra v’eh er ghra shoh, hie Eh magh reesht gys ny Hewnyn, as dooyrt Eh roo, Cha vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayn.

English: 39 But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover : will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
Manx: Agh ta cliaghtey eu mee dy eaysley fer diu ec y Chaisht : nailliu er-y-fa shen mee dy eaysley diu ree ny Hewnyn?

English: 40 Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
Manx: Eisht deïe ad ooilley reesht, gra, Cha nee Eh shoh, agh Barabbas. Nish va Barabbas ny roosteyr.
CAB. XIX.

English: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged him.
Manx: Eisht ghow Pilate er-y-fa shen Yeesey, as chust Eh Eh.

English: 2 And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and they put on him a purple robe,
Manx: As fee ny sidooryn attey dy ghrineyn, as hug ad eh er y chione echey, as hug ad er coamrey gorrym-jiarg.

English: 3 And said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they smote him with their hands.
Manx: As dooyrt ad, Dy vannee, Ree ny Hewnyn : as woaill ad Eh lesh nyn laueyn.

English: 4 Pilate therefore went forth again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.
Manx: Haink Pilate er-y-fa shen magh reesht, as dooyrt Eh roo, Cur-my-ner, ta mish dy choyrt lhiam magh hiu Eh, dy vod fys y ve eu nagh vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayn.

English: 5 Then came Jesus forth, wearing the crown of thorns, and the purple robe. And Pilate saith unto them, Behold the man
Manx: Eisht haink Yeesey magh, ceau yn attey dy ghrineyn as y coamrey gorrym-jiarg. As dooyrt Pilate roo, Cur-jee my-ner yn dooinney.

English: 6 When the chief priests therefore and officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Take ye him, and crucify him : for I find no fault in him.
Manx: Shen-y-fa tra honnick ny ard-saggyrtyn as ny fir-oik Eh, deïe ad, gra, Jean y chrossey Eh, jean y chrossey Eh. Dooyrt Pilate roo, Gow-jee shiuish Eh, as jean-jee Eh y chrossey ; son cha vel mish er gheddyn foill erbee ayn.

English: 7 The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.
Manx: Dreggyr ny Hewnyn Eh, Ta leigh ainyn, as liorish y leigh ain lhisagh Eh baase y hurranse, er-y-fa dy ghow Eh er dy nee Mac Yee v’eh.

English: 8 ¶When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he was the more afraid ;
Manx: Tra cheayll Pilate er-y-fa shen yn raa shoh, v’eh ny s’agglee ;

English: 9 And went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.
Manx: As hie Pilate reesht gys hall ny briwnys, as dooyrt Eh rish Yeesey, Cre-woish t’ow? Agh cha dug Yeesey ansoor da.

English: 10 Then saith Pilate unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to crucify thee, and have power to release thee?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Pilate rish, Nagh loayr oo rhym’s? nagh vel fys ayd dy vel pooar aym’s dy dty chrossey, as pooar dy dty eaysley?

English: 11 Jesus answered, Thou couldest have no power at all against me, except it were given thee from above : therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath the greater sin.
Manx: Dreggyr Yeesey, Cha voddagh pooar erbee y ve ayd m’oi’s, mannagh beagh eh er ny choyrt dhyt veih’n yrjid ; shen-y-fa ta peccah smoo echyssyn ren my livrey hood.

English: 12 And from thenceforth Pilate sought to release him : but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou let this man go, thou art not Caesar’s friend : whosoever maketh himself a king speaketh against Caesar.
Manx: As veih shen magh va Pilate shirrey y eaysley Eh : agh deïe ny Hewnyn, gra, My lhiggys oo yn raad da’n dooinney shoh, cha nee carrey da Cesar oo : quoi-erbee ta jannoo Eh hene ny ree, t’eh loayrt noi Cesar.

English: 13 ¶When Pilate therefore heard that saying, he brought Jesus forth, and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is called the Pavement, but in the Hebrew, Gabbatha.
Manx: Tra cheayll Pilate er-y-fa shen yn raa shoh, hug Eh lesh Yeesey magh, as hoie Eh sheese er stoyl y vriwnys, ayns ynnyd ta enmyssit yn Pavement, agh ayns Hebrew, Gabbatha.

English: 14 And it was the preparation of the passover, and about the sixth hour : and he saith unto the Jews, Behold your King
Manx: As she er laa aarlaghey ny Caisht ve, as mysh y cheyoo oor : as dooyrt Eh rish ny Hewnyn, Cur-jee my-ner yn ree eu.

English: 15 But they cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar.
Manx: Agh deïe ad, Ersooyl lesh, ersooyl lesh, jean y chrossey Eh. Dooyrt Pilate roo, Jeanym yn ree eauish y chrossey? Dreggyr ny ard-saggyrtyn, Cha vel ree ainyn agh Cesar.

English: 16 Then delivered he him therefore unto them to be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led him away.
Manx: Eisht livrey Eh Eh er -y-fa shen huc dy ve er ny chrossey. As ghow ad Yeesey as leeid ad Eh ersooyl.

English: 17 And he bearing his cross went forth into a place called the place of a skull, which is called in the Hebrew Golgotha :
Manx: As dymmyrk Eh e chrosh, as hie Eh magh gys ynnyd yiarragh ad ynnyd bollagh rish, ta enmyssit ayns Hebrew, Golgotha.

English: 18 Where they crucified him, and two other with him, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.
Manx: Raad ren ad eshyn y chrossey, as jees elley mârish, fer er dagh cheu, as Yeesey ayns y vain.

English: 19 ¶And Pilate wrote a title, and put it on the cross. And the writing was JESUS OF NAZARETH THE KING OF THE JEWS.
Manx: As scrieu Pilate screeuyn, as hug Eh eh er y chrosh. As va’n screeu, YEESEY DY NAZARETH REE NY HEWNYN.

English: 20 This title then read many of the Jews : for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city : and it was written in Hebrew, and Greek, and Latin.
Manx: Yn screeu shoh eisht ren ymmodee jeh ny Hewnyn y lhaih, son va[’]n boayl raad v’eh er ny chrossey er-gerrey da’n ard-valley : as ve scruit ayns Hebrew, as Greek, as Latin.

English: 21 Then said the chief priests of the Jews to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews ; but that he said, I am King of the Jews.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt ard-saggyrtyn ny Hewnyn rish Pilate, Ny scrieu, Ree ny Hewnyn ; agh dy dooyrt Eh, She ree ny Hewnyn mee.

English: 22 Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
Manx: Dreggyr Pilate, Ny ta scruit aym, te scruit.

English: 23 ¶Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, to every soldier a part ; and also his coat : now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
Manx: Eisht ghow ny sidooryn, tra v’ad er chrossey Yeesey, e gharmadyn (as ren ad kiare ayrnyn jeu, ayrn da dy chooilley hidoor) as myrgeddin e chooat : nish va’n cooat ooilley feeit, veih heose dy heese, fegooish seam.

English: 24 They said therefore among themselves, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be : that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my raiment among them, and for my vesture they did cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.
Manx: Dooyrt ad er-y-fa shen nyn mast’ oc hene, Ny lig dooin y rapey eh, agh lottyn y hilgey er, quoi echey vees eh : dy voddagh y scriptyr ve cooilleenit, ta gra, Reynn ad my gharmad nyn mast’ oc, as er my chooat ren ad lottyn y hilgey. Shoh er-y-fa shen ren ny sidooryn.

English: 25 ¶Now there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.
Manx: Nish va nyn shassoo liorish crosh Yeesey, e voir, as shuyr e vayrey, Moirrey ben Cleophas, as Moirrey Malaine.

English: 26 When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold thy son
Manx: Tra honnick Yeesey er-y-fa shen e voir, as yn ostyl bynney lesh ny hassoo lioree, dooyrt Eh rish e voir, Ven, cur-my-ner dty vac.

English: 27 Then saith he to the disciple, Behold thy mother! And from that hour that disciple took her unto his own home.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Eh rish yn ostyl, Cur-my-ner dty voir. As veih’n oor shen ghow yn ostyl ee gys e hie hene.

English: 28 ¶After this, Jesus knowing that all things were now accomplished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.
Manx: Ny lurg shoh, son dy row fys ec Yeesey dy row dy chooilley nhee nish cooilleenit, dy voddagh y scriptyr ve jeant mie, dooyrt Eh, Ta mee paagh.

English: 29 Now there was set a vessel full of vinegar : and they filled a spunge with vinegar, and put it upon hyssop, and put it to his mouth.
Manx: Nish va saagh er ny hoiaghey laane vinegar : as lhieen ad spunge lesh vinegar, as hug ad eh er hyssop, as heeyn ad eh seose gys y veeal echey.

English: 30 When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished : and he bowed his head, and gave up the ghost.
Manx: Tra va Yeesey er-y-fa shen er ghoaill y vinegar, dooyrt Eh, Te cooilleenit : as chroym Eh e chione, as phaart Eh.

English: 31 The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
