Manx: Shen-y-fa ren ny Hewnyn, er-yn-oyr dy nee laa’n aarlaghey ve, son nagh beagh ny kirp er y chrosh er laa’n doonaght (son va’n doonaght shen ny ard laa) guee er Pilate, ny lurgaghyn oc dy ve brisht, as ad dy ve goit ersooyl.

English: 32 Then came the soldiers, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other which was crucified with him.
Manx: Eisht haink ny sidooryn as vrish ad lurgaghyn y chied er, as y jeh elley v’er ny chrossey mârish.

English: 33 But when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs :
Manx: Agh tra haink ad gys Yeesey, as dy vaik ad dy row Eh hannah marroo, cha vrish ad ny lurgaghyn echey.

English: 34 But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.
Manx: Agh ren fer jeh ny sidooryn lesh shleiy yn lhiattee echey y hoylley, as chelleeragh haink magh ass ushtey as fuill.

English: 35 And he that saw it bare record, and his record is true : and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.
Manx: As dymmyrk eshyn honnick eh feanish, as ta’n eanish echey firrinagh : as ta fys echey dy vel Eh gra yn irriney, dy vod shiuish credjal.

English: 36 For these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.
Manx: Son va ny reddyn shoh jeant, dy voddagh y scriptyr ve cooilleenit, Cha bee craue jeh er ny vrishey.

English: 37 And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.
Manx: As reesht ta scriptyr elley gra, Jeeaghee ad ersyn t’ad er hoylley.

English: 38 ¶And after this Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus : and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore, and took the body of Jesus.
Manx: As ny lurg shoh ren Joseph dy Arimathea (va ny schoyllar dy Yeesey, agh dy follit ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn) guee er Pilate, Eh dy lhiggey da corp Yeesey y ghoaill ersooyl ; as hug Pilate kied da : Haink Eh er-y-fa shen, as hug Eh lesh corp Yeesey.

English: 39 And there came also Nicodemus, which at the first came to Jesus by night, and brought a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred pound weight.
Manx: As haink myrgeddin Nicodemus (va roie er jeet gys Yeesey ayns yn oie) as hug Eh lesh mysh keead punt dy myrrh as dy aloes kione y chielley.

English: 40 Then took they the body of Jesus, and wound it in linen clothes with the spices, as the manner of the Jews is to bury.
Manx: Eisht ghow ad corp Yeesey, as hoïll ad eh ayns aanrityn, lesh spisyn, myr va cliaghtey ny Hewnyn dy oanluckey.

English: 41 Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden ; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.
Manx: Nish ayns yn ynnyd raad v’eh er ny chrossey, va garey ; as ayns y gharey oaie noa, ayn nagh jagh rieau dooinney er coyrt.

English: 42 There laid they Jesus therefore because of the Jews’ preparation day ; for the sepulchre was nigh at hand.
Manx: Ayns shen ren ad Yeesey er-y-fa shen y oanluckey, son dy nee laa-aarlaghey ny Hewnyn ve, son va’n oaie er-gerrey daue.
CAB. XX.

English: The first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, when it was yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from the sepulchre.
Manx: Er y chied laa jeh’n chiaghtin, haink Moirrey Malaine dy moghey, tra ve foast dorraghey, gys yn oaie, as honnick ee yn chlagh goit ersooyl jeh’n oaie.

English: 2 Then she runneth, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid him.
Manx: Eisht roih ee, as haink ee gys Simon Peddyr, as gys yn ostyl elley bynney lesh Yeesey, as dooyrt ee roo, T’ad er ghoaill ersooyl y Chiarn ass yn oaie, as cha s’ain c’raad t’ad er choyrt Eh.

English: 3 Peter therefore went forth, and that other disciple, and came to the sepulchre.
Manx: Hie Peddyr er-y-fa shen magh, as yn ostyl elley shen, as haink ad gys yn oaie.

English: 4 So they ran both together : and the other disciple did outrun Peter, and came first to the sepulchre.
Manx: Son v’ad ny neesht er roih cooidjagh : agh va’n ostyl elley er roie ny sleaie na Peddyr, as er jeet hoshiaght gys yn oaie.

English: 5 And he stooping down, and looking in, saw the linen clothes lying ; yet went he not in.
Manx: As chroym Eh sheese, as honnick Eh ny haanrityn nyn lhie, ny-yeih cha jagh Eh stiagh.

English: 6 Then cometh Simon Peter following him, and went into the sepulchre, and seeth the linen clothes lie,
Manx: Eisht haink Simon Peddyr geiyrt er, as hie Eh stiagh ayns yn oaie, as honnick Eh ny haanrityn nyn lhie ;

English: 7 And the napkin, that was about his head, not lying with the linen clothes, but wrapped together in a place by itself.
Manx: As y naptin va mysh y chione echey, cha nee ny lhie marish ny haanrityn, agh fillit er y chielley ayns ynnyd er-lheh.

English: 8 Then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.
Manx: Eisht hie stiagh myrgeddin yn ostyl elley shen haink hoshiaght gys yn oaie, as ren Eh fakin as credjal.

English: 9 For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.
Manx: Son cha row foast toiggal oc jeh’n scriptyr, dy beign da girree veih ny merriu.

English: 10 Then the disciples went away again unto their own home.
Manx: Eisht hie ny ostyllyn rhymboo reesht gys nyn dhie hene.

English: 11 ¶But Mary stood without at the sepulchre weeping : and as she wept, she stooped down, and looked into the sepulchre,
Manx: Agh va Moirrey ny shassoo cheu-mooie jeh’n oaie keayney : as myr v’ee keayney, chroym ee sheese as yeeagh ee stiagh ayns yn oaie.

English: 12 And seeth two angels in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
Manx: As honnick ee daa ainle nyn soie ayns coamraghyn gial, yn derrey yeh ec y chione, as y jeh elley ec ny cassyn raad va corp Yeesey ny lhie :

English: 13 And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.
Manx: As dooyrt ad ree, Ven, cre’n-fa t’ow keayney? Dooyrt ish roo, Er-y-fa dy vel ad er ghoaill ersooyl my Hiarn, as nagh s’aym c’raad t’ad er choyrt Eh.

English: 14 And when she had thus said, she turned herself back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.
Manx: As tra v’ee er ghra shoh, hyndaa ee ee hene back, as honnick ee Yeesey ny hassoo, as cha row fys eck dy nee Yeesey v’ayn.

English: 15 Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey ree, Ven, cre’n-fa t’ow keayney? quoi t’ow dy hirrey? Heill ish dy nee yn dooinney va currym y gharey er v’ayn, as dooyrt ee rish, Vainshtyr, my t’ow er chur lhiat ass shoh Eh, insh dou c’raad t’ow er choyrt Eh, as verrym lhiam Eh.

English: 16 Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turned herself, and saith unto him, Rabboni ; which is to say, Master.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey, Voirrey. Hyndaa ee ee hene, as dooyrt ee rish, Rabboni, ta shen dy ghra, Vainshtyr.

English: 17 Jesus saith unto her, Touch me not ; for I am not yet ascended to my Father : but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your Father ; and to my God, and your God.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey ree, Ny benn rhym ; son cha vel mee foast er gholl seose gys my Ayr : agh gow gys my vraaraghyn, as abbyr roo, Ta mee goll seose gys my Ayr’s as yn Ayr eauish, as gys my Yee’s as y Jee eauish.

English: 18 Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken these things unto her.
Manx: Haink Moirrey Malaine as dinsh ee da ny ostyllyn, dy row ee er vakin y Chiarn, as dy row Eh er loayrt ny goan shoh ree.

English: 19 ¶Then the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
Manx: Eisht er y laa cheddin, yn chied laa jeh’n chiaghtin, ayns yn astyr, tra va ny dorryssyn jeight, raad va ny ostyllyn er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ayns aggle roish ny Hewnyn, haink Yeesey as hass Eh kiongoyrt roo, as dooyrt Eh roo, Shee dy row hiu.

English: 20 And when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.
Manx: As tra v’eh er ghra shoh, yeeagh Eh daue e laueyn as e lhiattee. Eisht gow ny ostyllyn boggey tra honnick ad y Chiarn.

English: 21 Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you : as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo reesht, Shee dy row hiu : myr ta my Ayr er my choyrt’s, myr shen ta mish coyrt shiuish.

English: 22 And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost :
Manx: As tra v’eh er ghra shoh, heid Eh orroo, as dooyrt Eh roo, Gow-jee yn Spyrryd Noo.

English: 23 Whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them ; and whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.
Manx: Da quoi-erbee ta shiuish leih peccaghyn, t’ad er nyn leih daue ; as da quoi-erbee nagh vel shiu cur feaysley, cha vel ad feayslit.

English: 24 ¶But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
Manx: Agh cha row Thomase, fer jeh’n daa ostyl yeig va enmyssit Didymus, mâroo tra haink Yeesey.

English: 25 The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.
Manx: Dooyrt ny ostyllyn elley er-y-fa shen rish, Ta shin er vakin y Chiarn. Agh dooyrt eshyn roo, Mannagh vaikym ayns ny laueyn echey ynnyd ny treinaghyn, as mannagh derrym my vair ayns ynnyd ny treinaghyn, as my laue y choyrt stiagh ayns e lhiattee, cha greidym.

English: 26 ¶And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them : then came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.
Manx: As lurg hoght laa reesht va ny ostyllyn echey sthie, as Thomase mâroo : as haink Yeesey, choud as va ny dorryssyn jeight, as hass Eh kiongoyrt roo, as dooyrt Eh, Shee dy row hiu.

English: 27 Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands ; and reach hither thy hand, and thrust it into my side : and be not faithless, but believing.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Eh rish Thomase, Sheeyn ayns shoh dty vair, as jeeagh er my laueyn ; as sheeyn dty laue, as cur ee stiagh ayns my lhiattee ee : as ny bee mee-chredjuagh, agh jean credjal.

English: 28 And Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
Manx: As dreggyr Thomase as dooyrt Eh rish, My Hiarn, as my Yee.

English: 29 Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed : blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rishyn, Homase, Er-y-fa dy vel oo er my akin, t’ow er chredjal : bannit t’adsyn nagh vel er vakin, as foast ta er chredjal.

English: 30 And many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book :
Manx: As ymmodee cowraghyn elley dy jarroo ren Yeesey ayns feanish ny ostyllyn echey, nagh vel scruit ayns y lioar shoh.

English: 31 But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God ; and that believing ye might have life through his name.
Manx: Agh t’ad shoh scruit, dy voddagh shiuish credjal dy nee Yeesey yn Creest Mac Yee, as erreish diu v’er chredjal dy voddagh bea y ve eu trooid ennym echey.
CAB. XXI.

English: After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias ; and on this wise shewed he himself.
Manx: Ny yei shoh hoilshee Yeesey Eh hene reesht da ny ostyllyn, ec faarkey Tiberias ; as er yn aght shoh hoilshee Eh Eh hene.

English: 2 There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.
Manx: Va cooidjagh Simon Peddyr, as Thomase va enmyssit Didymus, as Nathanael dy Chana ayns Galilee ; as meck Zebedee, as jees elley jeh ny ostyllyn.

English: 3 Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately ; and that night they caught nothing.
Manx: Dooyrt Simon Peddyr roo, Ta mish son goll dy eeastagh. Dooyrt adsyn rish, Hem mainyn myrgeddin mârt. Hie ad magh, as hie ad ayns lhong chelleeragh ; as yn oie shen cha haare ad nhee erbee.

English: 4 But when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore : but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
Manx: Agh yn moghrey er-giyn, va Yeesey ny hassoo er y traie : agh cha row fys ec ny ostyllyn dy nee Yeesey v’ayn.

English: 15 Then Jesus saith unto them, Children, have ye any meat? They answered him, No.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Yeesey roo, Chloan, vel red erbee eu dy ee? Dooyrt adsyn rish, Cha vel.

English: 6 And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh roo, Tilg-jee magh yn lieen er y cheu yesh jeh’n lhong, as nee shiu feddyn. Chuir ad er-y-fa shen : as nish cha row ad abyl yn lieen y ghoaill stiagh va lied y thummyd eeast ayn.

English: 7 Therefore that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher’s coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.
Manx: Shen-y-fa dooyrt yn ostyl shen bynney lesh Yeesey rish Peddyr, She yn Chiarn t’ayn. Nish tra cheayll Simon Peddyr dy nee yn Chiarn v’ayn, hug Eh e chooat mysh (son v’eh rooisht) as hilg Eh Eh hene ayns y cheayn.

English: 8 And the other disciples came in a little ship ; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
Manx: As haink ny ostyllyn elley ayns lhong veg (son cha row ad foddey veih’n thalloo, agh mysh daa cheead chraue-roih) sleydey lhieu yn lieen as yn eeast ayn.

English: 19 As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
Manx: Cha leah eisht as v’ad er jeet gys thalloo, honnick ad aile geayill ayns shen, as eeast er ny chur er, as arran.

English: 10 Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now caught.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Cur-jee lhieu jeh’n eeast ta shiu nish er ghoaill.

English: 11 Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three : and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.
Manx: Hie Simon Peddyr seose, as hayrn Eh yn lieen gys thalloo laane dy eeastyn mooarey, keead as three jeig as da-eed : as son ooilley dy row whilleen, ny-yeih cha vrish y lieen.

English: 12 Jesus saith unto them, Come and dine. And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey roo, Tar-jee, as gow-jee nyn yinnair. As cha by loys da annane jeh ny ostyl fênaght jeh, Quoi oo? cur enney er dy nee Eh va’n Chiarn.

English: 13 Jesus then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.
Manx: Eisht haink Yeesey, as ghow Eh arran, as hug Eh daue eh, as eeast myrgeddin.

English: 14 This is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.
Manx: Shoh nish yn tress cheayrt hoilshee Yeesey Eh hene da e ostyllyn, erreish da v’er n’irree veih ny merriu.

English: 15 ¶So when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.
Manx: Myr shen tra v’ad n’ee nyn yinnair, dooyrt Yeesey rish Simon Peddyr, Simon Yonas, vel oo ny s’graihee orryms na orroo shoh? Dooyrt Eh rish, Ta mee, Hiarn ; ta fys ayd dy vel mee graihagh ort. Dooyrt Eh rish, Jeeagh dy mie da my eayin.

English: 16 He saith to him again the second time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord ; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my sheep.
Manx: Dooyrt Eh rish reesht yn nah cheayrt, Simon Yonas, vel oo graihagh orrym? Dooyrt Eh rish, Ta mee, Hiarn ; ta fys ayd hene dy vel mee graihagh ort. Dooyrt Eh rish, Jean my chirree y vochillaght dy mie.

English: 17 He saith unto him the third time, Simon, son of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things ; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.
Manx: Dooyrt Eh rish yn tress cheayrt, Simon Yonas, vel oo graihagh orrym? Va Peddyr neu-aashagh ayns e aigney er y fa dy dooyrt Eh rish yn tress cheayrt, Vel oo graihagh orrym? As dooyrt Eh rish, Hiarn, ta fys ayd er dy chooilley nhee ; ta fys ayd dy vel mee graihagh ort. Dooyrt Yeesey rish, Jeeagh dy mie da my chirree.

English: 18 Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdest thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest : but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.
Manx: Dy firrinagh firrinagh ta mee gra rhyt, Tra vow aeg chiangle oo dt’eaddagh mood, as jimmee oo raad erbee dy bailt : agh tra vees oo shen, sheeynee oo magh dty laueyn, as nee fer elley oo y chiangley, as y chur lesh raad nagh bee oo aignagh dy gholl.

English: 19 This spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.
Manx: Shoh loayr Eh dy hoilshaghey yn sorch dy vaase liorish v’eh dy chur gloyr da Jee. As tra v’eh er ghra shoh, dooyrt Eh rish, Eiyr orrym.

English: 20 Then Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following ; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?
Manx: Eisht hyndaa Peddyr mygeayrt, as honnick Eh cheet geiyrt orroo yn ostyl bynney lesh Yeesey ; eshyn lhie gys e oghrish ec shibber, as dooyrt, Hiarn, Quoi Eh ta dy dty vrah?

English: 21 Peter seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
Manx: Honnick Peddyr Eh shoh, as dooyrt Eh rish Yeesey, Hiarn, as cre’n erree hig er y dooinney shoh?

English: 22 Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.
Manx: Dooyrt Yeesey rish, My saïllyms Eh dy uirriaght derrey’n cheet aym, cre ta shen dhyts? Eiyr uss orryms.

English: 23 Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die : yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die ; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?
Manx: Eisht hie yn raa shen magh mastey ny braaraghyn, nagh voghe yn ostyl shen baase : agh cha dooyrt Yeesey rish, Cha vow Eh baase : agh, My saïllyms Eh dy uirriaght derrey’n cheet aym, cre ta shen dhyts?

English: 24 This is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things : and we know that his testimony is true.
Manx: Shoh’n ostyl dymmyrk feanish jeh ny reddyn shoh, as ren ny reddyn shoh y scrieu : as ta fys ain dy vel yn eanish echey firrinagh.

English: 25 And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
Manx: As ta myrgeddin ymmodee dy reddyn elley ren Yeesey, dy beagh ad ooilley scruit, ta mee dy heiltyn nagh gummagh y seihll hene ny lioaryn veagh scruit. Amen.
JANNOO NY OSTYLLYN.
CAB. I.

English: The former treatise have I made, O Theophilus, of all that Jesus began both to do and teach,
Manx: Ta’n chied lioar ren mee, O Theophilus, mychione ooilley ny ren Yeesey toshiaght chammah dy yannoo as dy ynsaghey,

English: 2 Until the day in which he was taken up, after that he through the Holy Ghost had given commandments unto the apostles whom he had chosen :
Manx: Derrey’n laa v’eh er ny ghoaill seose, erreish da, trooid y Spyrryd Noo, v’er chur dagh nhee ayns currym da ny ostyllyn v’eh er ny reih.

English: 3 To whom also he shewed himself alive after his passion by many infallible proofs, being seen of them forty days, and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God :
Manx: Dauesyn myrgeddin hoilshee Eh Eh hene bio lurg e vaase, liorish ymmodee cowraghyn firrinagh, ayns dy row Eh er ny akin lioroo daa-eed laa, as dy loayr Eh jeh reddyn va bentyn rish reeriaght Yee.

English: 4 And, being assembled together with them, commanded them that they should not depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which, saith he, ye have heard of me.
Manx: As choud as v’ad ooilley cooidjagh mârish, doardee Eh daue gyn ad dy gholl veih Jerusalem, agh ad dy arkiagh son gialdyn yn Ayr, yn gialdyn cheddin (as eshyn) ta shiu er chlashtyn voym’s.

English: 5 For John truly baptized with water ; but ye shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many days hence.
Manx: Son ren Ean dy firrinagh bashtey lesh ushtey ; agh bee shiuish er nyn mashtey lesh y Spyrryd Noo, as cha nimmey laa gys y traa.

English: 6 When they therefore were come together, they asked of him, saying, Lord, wilt thou at this time restore again the kingdom to Israel?
Manx: Choud as v’ad er-y-fa shen cooidjagh, dênee ad jeh, gra, Hiarn, jean oo ec y traa shoh reeriaght Israel y hoiaghey seose reesht?

English: 7 And he said unto them, It is not for you to know the times or the seasons, which the Father hath put in his own power.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh roo, Cha vel eh bentyn riuish dy hoiggal ny hearishyn, ny ny himbaghyn, ta’n Ayr er chur ayns e phooar hene.

English: 8 But ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you : and ye shall be witnesses unto me both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.
Manx: Agh yiow shiu pooar veih’n Spyrryd Noo hig erriu : as bee shiu nyn veanishyn dooys, chammah ayns Jerusalem, as ayns ooilley Judea, as ayns Samaria, as gys ny ardjyn sodjey magh jeh’n theihll.

English: 9 And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up ; and a cloud received him out of their sight.
Manx: As tra v’eh er loayrt ny goan shoh, v’eh er ny hroggal seose vowsyn va jeeaghyn er, as ghow bodjal Eh ass nyn shilley.

English: 10 And while they looked stedfastly toward heaven as he went up, behold, two men stood by them in white apparel ;
Manx: As choud as v’ad jeeaghyn dy gyere seose ’syn aer, myr v’eh goll seose ; cur-my-ner, hass daa ghooinney lioroo ayns coamraghyn gial ;

English: 11 Which also said, Ye men of Galilee, why stand ye gazing up into heaven? this same Jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like manner as ye have seen him go into heaven.
Manx: Dooyrt myrgeddin, Gheiney Ghalilee cre’n-fa ta shiu nyn shassoo jeeaghyn seose ’syn aer? nee Yeesey shoh t’er ny ghoaill vew gys niau, cheet er yn aght ta shiu er ny akin Eh goll seose gys niau.

English: 12 Then returned they unto Jerusalem from the mount called Olivet, which is from Jerusalem a sabbath day’s journey.
Manx: Eisht haink ad reesht gys Jerusalem, veih’n chronck va enmyssit Olivet, va veih Jerusalem jurnah laa doonee.

English: 13 And when they were come in, they went up into an upper room, where abode both Peter, and James, and John, and Andrew, Philip, and Thomas, Bartholomew, and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon Zelotes, and Judas the brother of James.
Manx: As tra v’ad er jeet stiagh, hie ad seose er lout, raad duirree Peddyr as Jamys, as Ean as Andreays, Philip as Thomase, Parlane as Mian, Jamys mac Alpheus, as Simon Zelotes, as Judas braar Yamys.

English: 14 These all continued with one accord in prayer and supplication, with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
Manx: Chum ad shoh ooilley cooidjagh lesh un aigney ayns padjer as aghin, marish ny mraane, as Moirrey moir Yeesey, as marish e vraaraghyn.

English: 15 ¶And in those days Peter stood up in the midst of the disciples, and said, (the number of names together were about an hundred and twenty,)
Manx: As ayns ny laghyn shen hass Peddyr seose ayns y vain ocsyn v’er ve sheer geiyrt er Yeesey, as dooyrt Eh, (va earroo ny en’myn cooidjagh mysh shey feed)

English: 16 Men and brethren, this scripture must needs have been fulfilled, which the Holy Ghost by the mouth of David spake before concerning Judas, which was guide to them that took Jesus.
Manx: Gheiney as vraaraghyn, beign da’n scriptyr shoh ve cooilleenit, ren y Spyrryd Noo y loayrt ro-laue liorish beeal Ghavid mychione Yuaase, va ny leeideilagh dauesyn ghow Yeesey.

English: 17 For he was numbered with us, and had obtained part of this ministry.
Manx: Son v’eh er ny earroo mârin, as eit dy ghoaill er ayrn jeh’n chirveish shoh.

English: 18 Now this man purchased a field with the reward of iniquity ; and falling headlong, he burst asunder in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out.
Manx: Nish ren y dooinney shoh magher y chionnaghey lesh leagh e vee-chairys ; as lesh tuittym gouyr y vullee, skeilt Eh veih my chielley ayns y vain, as roih ooilley e vynnagh ass.

English: 19 And it was known unto all the dwellers at Jerusalem ; insomuch as that field is called in their proper tongue, Aceldama, that is to say, The field of blood.
Manx: As hooar ooilley ny va vaghey ec Jerusalem fys er shoh ; ayns wheesh as dy vel y magher shen enmyssit ayns y ghlare ocsyn, Aceldama, ta shen dy ghra, Magher foalley.

English: 20 For it is written in the book of Psalms, Let his habitation be desolate, and let no man dwell therein : and his bishoprick let another take.
Manx: Son te scruit ayns lioar ny psalmyn, Lig da’n ynnyd-vaghee echey ve treigit, as ny lig da dooinney erbee vaghey ayn : as, Yn oik-aspick echey lig da fer elley y ghoaill.

English: 21 Wherefore of these men which have companied with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us,
Manx: Shen-y-fa jeh ny deiney shoh t’er ve ayns y cheshaght ain, ooilley’n traa va’n Chiarn Yeesey goll stiagh as magh nyn mast’ ain,

English: 22 Beginning from the baptism of John, unto that same day that he was taken up from us, must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.
Manx: Goaill toshiaght veih bashtey Ean derrey’n laa v’eh er ny ghoaill seose voïn, shegin da annane ve ny eanish mârin jeh’n irree-seose-reesht echey.

English: 23 And they appointed two, Joseph called Barsabas, who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
Manx: As ren ad jees y phointeil, Joseph va enmyssit Barsabas, va slennooit Justus, as Matthias.

English: 24 And they prayed, and said, Thou, Lord, which knowest the hearts of all men, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen,
Manx: As ghow ad padjer, as dooyrt ad, Uss, Hiarn, ayd ta fys cre t’ayns cree dy chooilley ghooinney, soilshee quoi jeh’n jees shoh t’ow er ny reih,

English: 25 That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship, from which Judas by transgression fell, that he might go to his own place.
Manx: Dy ghoaill ayrn jeh’n chirveish as yn oik-ostyl shoh, veih ta Yuaase er gholl er-shaghryn, dy voddagh Eh goll gys e ynnyd hene.

English: 26 And they gave forth their lots ; and the lot fell upon Matthias ; and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
Manx: As hug ad magh nyn lottyn ; as huitt y lot er Matthias, as v’eh er ny earroo marish yn un ostyl yeig.
CAB. II.

English: And when the day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord in one place.
Manx: As tra va laa ny Kingeesh er jeet, v’ad ooilley lesh un aigney ayns yn un ynnyd.

English: 2 And suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
Manx: As haink doaltattym veih niau feiyr myr dy gheay heidjee lajer, as lhieen eh ooilley yn thie raad v’ad nyn soie.

English: 3 And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.
Manx: As honnick ad chengaghyn skeilt, myr dy beagh ad dy aile, as hoie eh er dagh annane oc.

English: 4 And they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and began to speak with other tongues, as the Spirit gave them utterance.
Manx: As v’ad ooilley lhieent lesh y Spyrryd Noo, as ren ad toshiaght dy loayrt lesh chengaghyn elley, myr va’n Spyrryd cur roue.

English: 5 And there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, devout men, out of every nation under heaven.
Manx: As va cummal ec Jerusalem, Hewnyn, deiney crauee, ass dy chooilley ashoon ’sy theihll.

English: 6 Now when this was noised abroad, the multitude came together, and were confounded, because that every man heard them speak in his own language.
Manx: Nish tra va taggloo jeant jeh shoh, haink y pobble cooidjagh, as v’ad atchimagh, er-yn-oyr dy row dy chooilley ghooinney clashtyn ad loayrt ayns e ghlare hene.

English: 7 And they were all amazed and marvelled, saying one to another, Behold, are not all these which speak Galilaeans?
Manx: As v’ad ooilley as nyn dappey vow, ooilley, goaill yindyss, as gra yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley, Cur-my-ner, nagh vel ad shoh ooilley ta loayrt nyn Ghalileanee?

English: 8 And how hear we every man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?
Manx: As kys dy vel shin clashtyn dy chooilley ghooinney loayrt glare nyn jeer hene?

English: 9 Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and the dwellers in Mesopotamia, and in Judaea, and Cappadocia, in Pontus, and Asia,
Manx: Parthianee, as Medyn, as Elamiteyn, as fir-vaghee Mesopotamia, as Judea, as Cappadocia, Pontus as Asia,

English: 10 Phrygia, and Pamphylia, in Egypt, and in the parts of Libya about Cyrene, and strangers of Rome, Jews and proselytes,
Manx: Phrygia as Pamphilia, Egypt as ardjyn Libya mygeayrt Cyrene, as joarreeyn veih yn Raue, Hewnyn as Proselyteyn,

English: 11 Cretes and Arabians, we do hear them speak in our tongues the wonderful works of God.
Manx: Cretyn as Arabianee, ta shin clashtyn ad loayrt ayns ny chengaghyn ainyn obbraghyn yindyssagh Yee.

English: 12 And they were all amazed, and were in doubt, saying one to another, What meaneth this?
Manx: As v’ad ooilley atchimagh as ayns imnea, gra yn derrey yeh rish y jeh elley, Cre s’erree da shoh?

English: 13 Others mocking said, These men are full of new wine.
Manx: Agh va feallagh elley craidey, as gra, Ta ny deiney shoh laane dy feeyn noa.

English: 14 ¶But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice, and said unto them, Ye men of Judaea, and all ye that dwell at Jerusalem, be this known unto you, and hearken to my words :
Manx: Agh hass Peddyr seose marish yn un ostyl yeig, as troggal seose e choraa dooyrt Eh roo, Gheiney Yudea, as ooilley shiuish ta vaghey ec Jerusalem, gow-jee toiggal jeh shoh, as cur-jee geill da my ghoan’s :

English: 15 For these are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of the day.
Manx: Son cha vel ad shoh er-meshtey, myr ta shiuish dy heiltyn, fakin nagh vel eh agh yn tress oor jeh’n laa.

English: 16 But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel ;
Manx: Agh shoh eh va loayrit jeh liorish y phadeyr Joel,

English: 17 And it shall come to pass in the last days, saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh : and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall dream dreams :
Manx: As hig eh gy kione ayns ny laghyn s’jerree (ta Jee gra) dy deayrtyms magh jeh my Spyrryd er dy chooilley eill : as nee ny meck ny inneenyn eu phadeyrys, as nee dy [sic: ny] deiney aegey eu ashlishyn y akin, as ny shen gheiney eu dreamallyn y ghreamal :

English: 18 And on my servants and on my handmaidens I will pour out in those days of my Spirit ; and they shall prophesy :
Manx: As er my harvaantyn, as er my inneenyn-veyl deayrtym magh ayns ny laghyn shen jeh my Spyrryd, as nee ad phadeyrys :

English: 19 And I will shew wonders in heaven above, and signs in the earth beneath ; blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke :
Manx: As soilsheeym yindyssyn ayns yn aer heose, as cowraghyn er y thalloo wass ; fuill, as aile, as diuit dy yaagh.

English: 20 The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and notable day of the Lord come :
Manx: Bee yn ghrian er ny hyndaa gys dorraghys, as yn aist gys fuill, roish my jig laa mooar agglagh y Chiarn.

English: 21 And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
Manx: As hig eh gy kione, quoi-erbee eïeys er ennym y Chiarn, dy bee Eh er ny hauail.

English: 22 Ye men of Israel, hear these words ; Jesus of Nazareth, a man approved of God among you by miracles and wonders and signs, which God did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselves also know :
Manx: Gheiney Israel, eaisht-jee rish ny goan shoh ; Yeesey dy Nazareth, dooinney ren Jee soiagh jeh nyn mast’ eu, liorish mirrillyn, as yindyssyn as cowraghyn, dobbree Jee liorishyn ayns yn enish eu, myr ta fys myrgeddin eu hene :

English: 23 Him, being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye have taken, and by wicked hands have crucified and slain :
Manx: Eshyn, va livreit seose liorish oardagh as coyrle as fyssyree ro-laue Yee, ta shiuish er ghoaill, as lesh laueyn mee-chrauee er chrossey as er varroo :

English: 24 Whom God hath raised up, having loosed the pains of death : because it was not possible that he should be holden of it.
Manx: She eshyn ta Jee er hroggal seose reesht, tra v’eh er veaysley pianyn y vaaish : er-y-fa nagh row eh possible Eh dy ve cummit fo liorish.

English: 25 For David speaketh concerning him, I foresaw the Lord always before my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be moved :
Manx: Son ta David loayrt jeh, Honnick mee ro-laue yn Chiarn kinjagh kiongoyrt rhym ; son t’eh er my laue yesh, dy my reaylley veih skirraghtyn.

English: 26 Therefore did my heart rejoice, and my tongue was glad ; moreover also my flesh shall rest in hope :
Manx: Shen-y-fa ghow my chree boggey, as va my hengey gerjoilagh : as ny sodjey foast, nee my eill fea y ghoaill ayns treishteil.

English: 27 Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
Manx: Er-y-fa nagh vaag oo my annym ayns niurin, as nagh lig oo da dty Er-casherick loauys y akin.

English: 28 Thou hast made known to me the ways of life ; thou shalt make me full of joy with thy countenance.
Manx: T’ow er chur toiggal dooys jeh raaidyn y vea ; ta dt’eddin er my lhieeney lesh gerjagh.

English: 29 Men and brethren, let me freely speak unto you of the patriarch David, that he is both dead and buried, and his sepulchre is with us unto this day.
Manx: Gheiney as vraaraghyn, cur-jee kied dou loayrt dy arryltagh riu mychione yn Patriarch David, dy vel Eh marroo as oanluckit neesht, as dy vel yn oaie echey ry akin ’sy laa t’ayn jiu :

English: 30 Therefore being a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn with an oath to him, that of the fruit of his loins, according to the flesh, he would raise up Christ to sit on his throne ;
Manx: Shen-y-fa liorish dy row Eh ny adeyr, as dy row fys echey dy row Jee er yialdyn lesh breearrey da, jeh mess ny meeghyn echey, cordail rish yn eill, dy droggagh Eh seose Creest dy hoie er y stoyl-reeoil echey :

English: 31 He seeing this before spake of the resurrection of Christ, that his soul was not left in hell, neither his flesh did see corruption.
Manx: Honnick eshyn shoh ro-laue, as loayr Eh jeh irree-seose-reesht Chreest, nagh row e annym faagit ayns niurin, as nagh row e eill dy akin loauys.

English: 32 This Jesus hath God raised up, whereof we all are witnesses.
Manx: Shoh Yeesey ta Jee er hroggal seose, myr ta shinyn ooilley nyn veanishyn.

English: 33 Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost, he hath shed forth this, which ye now see and hear.
Manx: Shen-y-fa fakin dy vel Eh er ny ghoaill seose liorish gys laue yesh Yee, as dy vel Eh er gheddyn veih yn Ayr yn Spyrryd Noo ren Eh y yialdyn, t’eh er gheayrtey magh shoh ta shiuish nish dy akin as dy chlashtyn.

English: 34 For David is not ascended into the heavens : but he saith himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand,
Manx: Son cha vel David er gholl seose gys ny niaughyn : agh t’eh hene gra, Dooyrt y Chiarn rish my Hiarn’s, Soie uss er my laue yesh.

English: 35 Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
Manx: Derrey verrym dty noidyn son stoyl fo dty chassyn.

English: 36 Therefore let all the house of Israel know assuredly, that God hath made the same Jesus, whom ye have crucified, both Lord and Christ.
Manx: Shen-y-fa lig da ooilley thie Israel fys y ve oc ayns shickyrys, dy vel Jee er n’yannoo Yeesey shen ta shiuish er ny chrossey, chammah Chiarn as Creest.

English: 37 ¶Now when they heard this, they were pricked in their heart, and said unto Peter and to the rest of the apostles, Men and brethren, what shall we do?
Manx: Nish tra cheayll ad shoh, v’ad guint ayns nyn gree, as dooyrt ad rish Peddyr, as rish ny ostyllyn elley, Gheiney as vraaraghyn, cre bailliu shin dy yannoo?

English: 38 Then Peter said unto them, Repent, and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins, and ye shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Peddyr roo, Gow-jee arrys, as bee-jee er nyn mashtey dy chooilley annane eu ayns ennym Yeesey Creest, son leih peccaghyn, as yiow shiu gioot y Spyrryd Noo.

English: 39 For the promise is unto you, and to your children, and to all that are afar off, even as many as the Lord our God shall call.
Manx: Son ta’n gialdyn diuish as da nyn gloan, as da ooilley ny ta foddey ass y raad, dy jarroo da whilleen as vees er nyn eam liorish nyn Chiarn Jee.

English: 40 And with many other words did he testify and exhort, saying, Save yourselves from this untoward generation.
Manx: As lesh ymmodee goan elley dymmyrk Eh feanish as choyrlee Eh, gra, Saue-jee shiu hene veih’n drogh heeloghe shoh.

English: 41 ¶Then they that gladly received his word were baptized : and the same day there were added unto them about three thousand souls.
Manx: Eisht v’adsyn va dy arryltagh er ghoaill e ghoo, er nyn mashtey : as y laa cheddin va’n earroo oc er ny vishaghey gys mysh three thousaneyn.

English: 42 And they continued stedfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, and in breaking of bread, and in prayers.
Manx: As ren ad tannaghtyn ayns ynsagh as sheshaght ny ostyllyn, as ayns brishey arran, as ayns padjeryn.

English: 43 And fear came upon every soul : and many wonders and signs were done by the apostles.
Manx: As haink aggle er dy chooilley annym : as va ymmodee yindyssyn as cowraghyn jeant liorish ny ostyllyn.

English: 44 And all that believed were together, and had all things common ;
Manx: As va ooilley ny v’er jyndaa gys y chredjue thaaghey cooidjagh, as v’ad ayns annaneys ry cheïley, as cha row ad freaylley ny v’oc nyn gouyr hene,

English: 45 And sold their possessions and goods, and parted them to all men, as every man had need.
Manx: Agh creck ad nyn gummallyn as nyn gooid, as reynn ad er dy chooilley ghooinney, cordail rish e eme.

English: 46 And they, continuing daily with one accord in the temple, and breaking bread from house to house, did eat their meat with gladness and singleness of heart,
Manx: As v’ad goll gagh laa lesh un aigney gys y chiamble, as brishey arran ec y thie, as goaill nyn meaghey lesh gennalys as oynit cree,

English: 47 Praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.
Manx: Cur moylley da Jee, as toilchin aigney-mie veih ooilley’n pobble. As va’n Chiarn cur gys yn agglish gagh laa leid as va dy v’er nyn sauail.
CAB. III.

English: Now Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, being the ninth hour.
Manx: Nish hie Peddyr as Ean seose cooidjagh gys y chiamble, ec oor y phadjer, yn nuyoo oor.

English: 2 And a certain man lame from his mother’s womb was carried, whom they laid daily at the gate of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask alms of them that entered into the temple ;
Manx: As va dooinney dy row va croobagh veih breïn e vayrey, er ny hroggal, as er ny chur ny lhie gagh laa ec giat y chiamble, ta enmyssit y giat Aalin, dy hirrey jeirk orroosyn va goll stiagh ayns y chiamble.

English: 3 Who seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple asked an alms.
Manx: Honnick Eh shoh Peddyr as Ean mysh goll stiagh ’sy chiamble, as ren Eh jeirk y hirrey.

English: 4 And Peter, fastening his eyes upon him with John, said, Look on us.
Manx: As yeeagh Peddyr dy gyere er, myr ren Ean, as dooyrt Eh, Jeeagh orrin.

English: 5 And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something of them.
Manx: As ghow Eh tastey jeu, jerkal rish red ennagh y gheddyn vow.

English: 6 Then Peter said, Silver and gold have I none ; but such as I have give I thee : In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth rise up and walk.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Peddyr, Argid as airh cha vel aym ; agh leid as t’aym ta mee dy chur dhyt : Ayns ennym Yeesey Creest dy Nazareth, irree seose as shooil.

English: 7 And he took him by the right hand, and lifted him up : and immediately his feet and ankle bones received strength.
Manx: As ghow Eh Eh er y laue yesh, as hrog Eh Eh seose ; as chelleeragh ghow ny cassyn as craueyn ny habbaneyn echey niart.

English: 8 And he leaping up stood, and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God.
Manx: As leïme Eh seose, as hass Eh, as huïll Eh, as hie Eh stiagh ayns y chiamble mâroo, shooyl, as leïme, as cur moylley da Jee.

English: 9 And all the people saw him walking and praising God :
Manx: As honnick ooilley’n pobble Eh shooyl, as cur moylley da Jee.

English: 10 And they knew that it was he which sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple : and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that which had happened unto him.
Manx: As hug ad enney er dy nee eshyn veagh ny hoie shirrey jeirk ec giat Aalin y chiamble v’ayn : as v’ad lhieent lesh yindys as atchim mychione ny v’er daghyrt da.

English: 11 And as the lame man which was healed held Peter and John, all the people ran together unto them in the porch that is called Solomon’s, greatly wondering.
Manx: Agh ren y dooinney croobagh v’er ny laanaghey Peddyr as Ean y chumrail, derrey va ooilley yn pobble er roih cooidjagh gys y porch ta enmyssit porch Solomon, goaill ymmodee yindyss.

English: 12 And when Peter saw it, he answered unto the people, Ye men of Israel, why marvel ye at this? or why look ye so earnestly on us, as though by our own power or holiness we had made this man to walk?
Manx: As tra honnick Peddyr shoh, dansoor Eh yn pobble, Gheiney Israel, cre’n-fa ta shiu gindyss er shoh? ny jeeaghyn cha gyere orrinyn, myr dy beagh shin liorish y phooar ny’n chraueeaght ain hene er chur er y dooinney shoh shooyl.

English: 13 The God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob, the God of our fathers, hath glorified his Son Jesus ; whom ye delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when he was determined to let him go.
Manx: She Jee Abraham, as Isaac, as Jacob, Jee ny ayraghyn ain t’er ghloyraghey e Vac Yeesey ; ren shiuish y livrey seose as y obbal ayns fenish Pilate, tra v’eh kiarit y raad y lhiggey da.

English: 14 But ye denied the Holy One and the Just, and desired a murderer to be granted unto you ;
Manx: Agh hreig shiuish yn Fer-casherick as cairagh, as hir shiu dunver dy v’er ny ghiootal erriu,

English: 15 And killed the Prince of life, whom God hath raised from the dead ; whereof we are witnesses.
Manx: As ta shiu er varroo prince y vea, ren Jee y hroggal veih ny merriu ; myr ta shinyn nyn veanishyn.

English: 16 And his name through faith in his name hath made this man strong, whom ye see and know : yea, the faith which is by him hath given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.
Manx: As she yn ennym echey trooid credjue ayns e ennym t’er chur niart da’n dooinney shoh, ta shiu dy akin as er ta enney eu : dy jarroo, she credjue aynsyn t’er chur er ve dy mie ayns e laynt ayns yn enish eu ooilley.

English: 17 And now, brethren, I wot that through ignorance ye did it, as did also your rulers.
Manx: As nish, vraaraghyn, ta fys aym dy nee trooid mee-hushtey ren shiu eh, myr ren myrgeddin ny fir-reïl eu.

English: 18 But those things, which God before had shewed by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.
Manx: Agh ny reddyn va Jee ro-laue er hoilshaghey liorish beeal ooilley e adeyryn, dy row Creest dy hurranse, t’eh er yn aght shen er chooilleeney.

English: 19 ¶Repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sins may be blotted out, when the times of refreshing shall come from the presence of the Lord.
Manx: Gow-jee arrys er-y-fa shen, as bee[-] jee er nyn jyndaa, dy vod shiu v’er nyn ghlenney veih nyn beccaghyn, tra hig earishyn yn ooraghey magh veih fenish y Chiarn.

English: 20 And he shall send Jesus Christ, which before was preached unto you :
Manx: As nee Eh Yeesey Creest y choyrt, va roie er ny phreacheil diu :

English: 21 Whom the heaven must receive until the times of restitution of all things, which God hath spoken by the mouth of all his holy prophets since the world began.
Manx: Eshyn ta dy ve ayns niau, derrey earishyn lhiassaghey dy chooiiley [sic] nhee, ta Jee er ny loayrt liorish beeal ooilley e adeyryn crauee, er dy hoshiaght y theihll.

English: 22 For Moses truly said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the Lord your God raise up unto you of your brethren, like unto me ; him shall ye hear in all things whatsoever he shall say unto you.
Manx: Son dooyrt Moses dy firrinagh rish ny ayraghyn, Phadeyr, myr ta mish, nee yn Chiarn yn Jee eu y hroggal seose diu, jeh nyn mraaraghyn ; rishyn nee shiu geaishtagh ayns dy chooilley nhee cre-erbee nee Eh y ghra riu.

English: 23 And it shall come to pass, that every soul, which will not hear that prophet, shall be destroyed from among the people.
Manx: As hig eh gy kione, dy bee dy chooilley annym nagh der geill da’n phadeyr shen, er ny stroie veih mastey’n pobble.

English: 24 Yea, and all the prophets from Samuel and those that follow after, as many as have spoken, have likewise foretold of these days.
Manx: As ta myrgeddin ooilley ny phadeyryn veih Samuel, dy jarroo whilleen as haink ny yei, as ren loayrt, er n’insh ro-laue jeh ny laghyn shoh.

English: 25 Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the covenant which God made with our fathers, saying unto Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the kindreds of the earth be blessed.
Manx: Shiuish cloan ny phadeyryn as y conaant ren Jee rish nyn ayraghyn, gra rish Abraham, As ayns dty luight’s vees ooilley kynnaghyn y theihll er nyn mannaghey.

English: 26 Unto you first God, having raised up his Son Jesus, sent him to bless you, in turning away every one of you from his iniquities.
Manx: Er ny son eauish hoshiaght, ta Jee er hroggal seose e Vac Yeesey, as er choyrt Eh dy vannaghey shiu, ayns dy chooilley annane eu y hyndaa ersooyl veih e vee-chraueeaght.
CAB. IV.

English: And as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of the temple, and the Sadducees, came upon them,
Manx: As myr v’ad loayrt rish y pobble, haink ny saggyrtyn, as captan y chiamble, as ny Saduceeyn orroo,

English: 2 Being grieved that they taught the people, and preached through Jesus the resurrection from the dead.
Manx: As v’ad neu-wooiagh dy row ad gynsaghey yn pobble, as preacheil trooid Yeesey yn irree-seose-reesht veih ny merriu.

English: 3 And they laid hands on them, and put them in hold unto the next day : for it was now eventide.
Manx: As hug ad laueyn orroo, as hug ad ad ayns pryssoon derrey yn nah laa : son va’n fastyr nish ayn.

English: 4 Howbeit many of them which heard the word believed ; and the number of the men was about five thousand.
Manx: Ny-yeih ren ymmodee jeusyn v’er chlashtyn yn goo, credjal ; as va earroo ny deiney mysh queig thousaneyn.

English: 5 ¶And it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders, and scribes,
Manx: As haink eh gy kione laa ny vairagh, dy row ny fir-reïl oc, as y chanstyr, as ny screeuderyn,

English: 6 And Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of the kindred of the high priest, were gathered together at Jerusalem.
Manx: As Annas yn ard-saggyrt, as Caiaphas, as Ean, as Alexander, as whilleen as va jeh kynney yn ard-saggyrt, er nyn jaglym cooid[j]agh ec Jerusalem.

English: 7 And when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what power, or by what name, have ye done this?
Manx: As tra v’ad er hoiaghey ad kiongoyrt roo, dênee ad jeu, Quoi hug pooar ny saarey diu dy yannoo shoh?

English: 8 Then Peter, filled with the Holy Ghost, said unto them, Ye rulers of the people, and elders of Israel,
Manx: Eisht va Peddyr lhieent lesh y Spyrryd Noo, as dooyrt Eh roo, Fir-reïl yn pobble, as shanstyr Israel,

English: 9 If we this day be examined of the good deed done to the impotent man, by what means he is made whole ;
Manx: My ta shinyn jiu er nyn veaysht mychione y thurn mie va jeant son y dooinney croobagh, as cre’n aght v’eh er ny laanaghey ;

English: 10 Be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead, even by him doth this man stand here before you whole.
Manx: Lig da fys y ve eauish ooilley, as ec ooilley pobble Israel, dy nee liorish ennym Yeesey Creest dy Nazareth, ren shiuish y chrossey, Eh ren Jee y hroggal veih ny merriu, dy jarroo liorishyn ta’n dooinney shoh ny hassoo ayns shoh ayns slaynt kiongoyrt riu.

English: 11 This is the stone which was set at nought of you builders, which is become the head of the corner.
Manx: Shoh yn chlagh ren adsyn va troggal y thie y vee-lowal, t’er jeet dy ve yn ard chlagh chorneilagh.

English: 12 Neither is there salvation in any other : for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.
Manx: Cha-moo ta saualtys ayns annane erbee elley : son cha vel ennym erbee elley fo niau er ny choyrt mastey deiney liorish oddys mad v’er nyn sauail.

English: 13 ¶Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men, they marvelled ; and they took knowledge of them, that they had been with Jesus.
Manx: Nish tra hug ad tastey da dunnalys Peddyr as Ean, as dy dennee ad dy nee deiney neu-ynsit as mee-hushtagh v’ad, ghow ad yindyss, as hoig ad dy row ad er ve marish Yeesey.

English: 14 And beholding the man which was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.
Manx: As jeeaghyn er y dooinney v’er ny laanaghey ny hassoo mâroo, cha row fockle oc dy ghra n’oi.

English: 15 But when they had commanded them to go aside out of the council, they conferred among themselves,
Manx: Agh tra v’ad er haarey ad dy gholl magh ass y choonceïl, dimrah ad nyn mast’ oc hene,

English: 16 Saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them is manifest to all them that dwell in Jerusalem ; and we cannot deny it.
Manx: Gra, Cre nee mad rish ny deiney shoh? son dy vel dy jarroo mirril yindyssagh er ve jeant lioroo, ta fys ec ooilley fir-vaghee Yerusalem, as cha vod mainyn goll noi.

English: 17 But that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in this name.
Manx: Agh son nagh skeayl eh magh veg sodjey mastey’n pobble, lig dooin baggyrt dy gyere orroo, nagh loayr ad veih shoh magh rish dooinney erbee ayns yn ennym shoh.

English: 18 And they called them, and commanded them not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus.
Manx: As deïe ad orroo, as doardee ad daue gyn ad dy loayrt eddyr, ny dy ynsaghey ayns ennym Yeesey.

English: 19 But Peter and John answered and said unto them, Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God, judge ye.
Manx: Agh dreggyr Peddyr as Ean as dooyrt ad roo, My te cairagh ayns shilley Yee dy chur geill smoo diuish na da Jee, foddee shiu hene briwnys.

English: 20 For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.
Manx: Son cha vod mainyn agh loayrt ny reddyn ta shin er vakin as er chlashtyn.

English: 21 So when they had further threatened them, they let them go, finding nothing how they might punish them, because of the people : for all men glorified God for that which was done.
Manx: Myr shen erreish daue v’er vaggyrt orroo reesht, lig ad y raad daue, tra nagh daink lhieu nyn gerraghey ad, kyndagh rish y pobble : son va dy chooilley ghooinney cur gloyr da Jee son ny v’ad er n’yannoo.

English: 22 For the man was above forty years old, on whom this miracle of healing was shewed.
Manx: Son va’n dooinney erskyn da-eed blein dy eash, er va’n mirril shoh dy laanaghey er ny obbraghey.

English: 23 ¶And being let go, they went to their own company, and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said unto them.
Manx: As haink ad, erreish daue v’er lhiggey’n raad daue, gys nyn sheshaght hene, as hug ad coontey daue jeh ooilley ny va ny ard-saggyrtyn as y chanstyr er ghra.

English: 24 And when they heard that, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, thou art God, which hast made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and all that in them is :
Manx: As tra cheayll ad shen, hrog ad seose nyn goraa gys Jee lesh un aigney, as dooyrt ad, Hiarn, uss yn Jee t’er chroo niau as thalloo, as y faarkey, as ooilley ny t’ayndoo :

English: 25 Who by the mouth of thy servant David hast said, Why did the heathen rage, and the people imagine vain things?
Manx: Ta liorish beeal dty harvaant David er ghra, Cre’n-fa va ny ashoonyn-quaagh sonnaasagh, as y pobble smooinaghtyn er reddyn fardalagh?

English: 26 The kings of the earth stood up, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord, and against his Christ.
Manx: Ren reeaghyn y thallooin shassoo seose, as va ny fir-reïl er nyn jaglym cooidjagh noi yn Chiarn, as noi e Chreest.

English: 27 For of a truth against thy holy child Jesus, whom thou hast anointed, both Herod, and Pontius Pilate, with the Gentiles, and the people of Israel, were gathered together,
Manx: Son ayns firrinys noi dty liannoo casherick Yeesey, t’ow er ny ooillaghey, va chammah Herod as Pontius Pilate, maroosyn jeh ny Ashoonyn-quaagh as pobble Israel er nyn jaglym cooidjagh,

English: 28 For to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be done.
Manx: Dy yannoo cre-erbee va dty laue as dty choyrle kiarit ro-laue dy yannoo.

English: 29 And now, Lord, behold their threatenings : and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,
Manx: As nish, Hiarn, cur tastey da ny baggyrtyn oc : as giall da dty harvaantyn, lesh dy chooilley ghunnalys dy vod ad dty ghoo y loayrt magh,

English: 30 By stretching forth thine hand to heal ; and that signs and wonders may be done by the name of thy holy child Jesus.
Manx: Liorish sheeyney magh dty laue dy lheihys : as dy vod cowraghyn as yindyssyn v’er nyn yannoo liorish ennym dty liannoo casherick Yeesey.

English: 31 ¶And when they had prayed, the place was shaken where they were assembled together ; and they were all filled with the Holy Ghost, and they spake the word of God with boldness.
Manx: As erreish daue v’er ghoaill padjer, chrie yn boayl raad v’ad er nyn jaglym cooidjagh ; as v’ad ooilley lhieent lesh y Spyrryd Noo, as loayr ad goo Yee lesh dunnalys.

English: 32 And the multitude of them that believed were of one heart and of one soul : neither said any of them that ought of the things which he possessed was his own ; but they had all things common.
Manx: As va un chree, as yn un annym ec yn ymmodee v’er chredjal ; as cha row annane oc gra, dy row red erbee dy row echey, lesh hene, agh jeh ooilley ny v’oc va dy chooilley annane goaill ayrn.

English: 33 And with great power gave the apostles witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus : and great grace was upon them all.
Manx: As lesh pooar vooar dymmyrk ny ostyllyn feanish jeh irree-seose-reesht y Chiarn Yeesey : as va grayse mooar orroo ooilley.

English: 34 Neither was there any among them that lacked : for as many as were possessors of lands or houses sold them, and brought the prices of the things that were sold,
Manx: Cha-moo va annane erbee nyn mast’ oc va laccal : son whilleen as va thieyn, ny thalloo oc, v’ad dyn greck ad, as cur lhieu priceyn ny reddyn va creckit,

English: 35 And laid them down at the apostles’ feet : and distribution was made unto every man according as he had need.
Manx: As dyn goyrt ad sheese ec cassyn ny ostyllyn : as va reynn er ny yannoo er dy chooilley ghooinney cordail rish e eme.

English: 36 And Joses, who by the apostles was surnamed Barnabas, (which is, being interpreted, The son of consolation,) a Levite, and of the country of Cyprus,
Manx: As ren Joses, va liorish ny ostyllyn slennooit Barnabas (ta shen, tra ta bun er ny chur er, Mac yn gherjagh) Levite, as jeh cheer Cyprus,

English: 37 Having land, sold it, and brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
Manx: Yn thalloo v’echey y chreck, as yn argid y chur lesh, as y choyrt eh ec cassyn ny ostyllyn.
CAB. V.

English: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession,
Manx: Agh va dooinney dy row va enmyssit Ananias, as y ven echey Sapphira, ren thalloo v’oc y chreck,

English: 2 And kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
Manx: As chiell Eh hene as e ven ayrn jeh’n phrice, as hug Eh lesh leid yn ayrn shen jeh, as hug Eh sheese ec cassyn ny ostyllyn eh.

English: 3 But Peter said, Ananias, why hath Satan filled thine heart to lie to the Holy Ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
Manx: Agh dooyrt Peddyr, Ananias, cre’n-fa ta Noid-ny-hanmey er lhieeney dty chree dy chur ort ve breagagh gys y Spyrryd Noo, as dy chieltyn ayrn jeh price y thallooin?

English: 4 Whiles it remained, was it not thine own? and after it was sold, was it not in thine own power? why hast thou conceived this thing in thine heart? thou hast not lied unto men, but unto God.
Manx: Choud as ve dyn chreck, nagh row eh lhiat hene? as erreish da ve creckit, nagh row eh ayns dty phooar hene? cre’n-fa t’ow er smooinaghtyn er leid y red ayns dty chree? cha vel oo er ny ve breagagh gys deiney, agh gys Jee.

English: 5 And Ananias hearing these words fell down, and gave up the ghost : and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
Manx: Tra cheayll Ananias ny goan shoh, huit Eh sheese, as hooar Eh baase : as haink aggle mooar orroosyn ooilley cheayll ny goan shoh.

English: 6 And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried him out, and buried him.
Manx: As dirree ny deiney aegey seose, as hoïl ad, as hrog ad lhieu magh, as doanluc ad Eh.

English: 7 And it was about the space of three hours after, when his wife, not knowing what was done, came in.
Manx: As ve mysh three ooryn ny lurg shen, tra haink e ven stiagh, as ve gyn yss jee cre v’er daghyrt.

English: 8 And Peter answered unto her, Tell me whether ye sold the land for so much? And she said, Yea, for so much.
Manx: As dooyrt Peddyr ree, Insh dou, ren shiu yn thalloo y chreck er y phrice shen? As dooyrt ish, She shen va’n phrice.

English: 9 Then Peter said unto her, How is it that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of the Lord? behold, the feet of them which have buried thy husband are at the door, and shall carry thee out.
Manx: Eisht dooyrt Peddyr ree, Kys dy choard shiu eddyr shiu hene dy hrial Spyrryd y Chiarn? cur-my-ner, ta ny cassyn ocsyn t’er n’oanluckey dty heshey ec y dorrys, as troggee ad uss magh.

English: 10 Then fell she down straightway at his feet, and yielded up the ghost : and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying her forth, buried her by her husband.
Manx: Eisht huit ee sheese chelleeragh ec e chassy, as hooar ee baase : as haink ny deiney aegey stiagh, as hooar ad ee marroo, as hrog ad lhieu magh ee, as doanluc ad ee liorish e sheshey.

English: 11 And great fear came upon all the church, and upon as many as heard these things.
Manx: As haink aggle mooar er ooilley’n agglish, as er whilleen as cheayll ny reddyn shoh.

English: 12 ¶And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders wrought among the people ; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon’s porch.
Manx: As liorish laueyn ny ostyllyn va ymmodee cowraghyn as yindyssyn er nyn obbraghey mastey’n pobble ; (as v’ad ooilley lesh un aigney ayns porch Solomon.

English: 13 And of the rest durst no man join himself to them : but the people magnified them.
Manx: As cha by loys da annane jeh’n vooinjer elley cheet ayns y cheshaght oc : agh va soiagh mooar jeant jeu liorish y pobble.

English: 14 And believers were the more added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women.)
Manx: As ren earrooyn mooarey chyndaa gys y Chiarn, chammah dy gheiney as dy vraane.)

English: 15 Insomuch that they brought forth the sick into the streets, and laid them on beds and couches, that at the least the shadow of Peter passing by might overshadow some of them.
Manx: Ayns wheesh as dy dug ad lhieu magh ayns ny straadjyn sleih chingey nyn lhie er lhiabbaghyn as couchyn, dy voddagh eer scadoo Pheddyr tra v’eh goll shiaghey, cheet er paart jeu.

English: 16 There came also a multitude out of the cities round about unto Jerusalem, bringing sick folks, and them which were vexed with unclean spirits : and they were healed every one.
Manx: Haink ymmodee myrgeddin ass ny ard-valjyn mygeayrt gys Jerusalem, cur lhieu sleih chingey, as leid as va spyrrydyn neu-ghlen ayndoo : as v’ad ooilley er nyn lheihys.

English: 17 ¶Then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him, (which is the sect of the Sadducees,) and were filled with indignation,
Manx: Eisht dirree yn ard-saggyrt seose as ooilley ny va mârish (v’ad jeh credjue ny Saduceeyn) as v’ad laane dy yymmoose,

English: 18 And laid their hands on the apostles, and put them in the common prison.
Manx: As hug ad nyn laueyn er ny ostyllyn, as hilg ad ad ayns y phryssoon chadjin.

English: 19 But the angel of the Lord by night opened the prison doors, and brought them forth, and said,
Manx: Agh doshil ainle y Chiarn dorryssyn y phryssoon ayns yn oie, as hug Eh lesh ad magh, as dooyrt Eh,

English: 20 Go, stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.
Manx: Immee-jee, as shass-jee, as loayr-jee ayns y chiamble rish y pobble ooilley goan y vea ad shoh.

English: 21 And when they heard that, they entered into the temple early in the morning, and taught. But the high priest came, and they that were with him, and called the council together, and all the senate of the children of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.
Manx: As tra cheayll ad shen, hie ad stiagh dy moghey ayns y chiamble, as dynsee ad. Agh haink yn ard-saggyrt as adsyn va mârish, as deïe ad er y choonceïl cooidjagh, as ooilley shanstyr cloan Israel, as hug ad fys gys y phryssoon dy chur ad stiagh kionfenish.

English: 22 But when the officers came, and found them not in the prison, they returned and told,
Manx: Agh tra haink ny fir-oik, as nagh dooar ad ad ayns y phryssoon, hyndaa ad back, as dinsh ad,

English: 23 Saying, The prison truly found we shut with all safety, and the keepers standing without before the doors : but when we had opened, we found no man within.
Manx: Gra, Yn pryssoon dy jarroo hooar shin jeight lesh dy chooilley sauchys, as y vooinjer va watchal nyn shassoo cheu-mooie jeh’n dorrys : agh tra va shin er vosley, cha dooar shin dooinney erbee sthie.

English: 24 Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.
Manx: Nish tra cheayll yn ard saggyrt as captan y chiamble as ny ard-saggyrtyn elley ny goan shoh, ghow ad yindyss mooar ayndoo hene, cre harragh jeh shoh ec y jerrey.

English: 25 Then came one and told them, saying, Behold, the men whom ye put in prison are standing in the temple, and teaching the people.
Manx: Eisht haink fer as dinsh Eh daue, Cur my-ner, ta ny deiney hug shiuish ayns pryssoon nyn shassoo ayns y chiamble, gynsaghey’n pobble.

English: 26 Then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without violence : for they feared the people, lest they should have been stoned.
Manx: Eisht hie yn captan, as ny fir-oik as hug ad lhieu ad, cha nee er niart : (son va aggle orroo dy jinnagh y pobble nyn glaghey ad)

English: 27 And when they had brought them, they set them before the council : and the high priest asked them,
Manx: As tra v’ad oc kionfenish, hoie ad ad kiongoyrt rish y choonceïl : as dênee yn ard-saggyrt jeu,

English: 28 Saying, Did not we straitly command you that ye should not teach in this name? and, behold, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this man’s blood upon us.
Manx: Gra, Nagh dug shinyn saarey gyere diu, gyn shiu dy ynsaghey ayns yn ennym shoh? as cur-my-ner, ta shiu er lhieeney Jerusalem lesh yn ynsagh eu, as kiarrail fuill y dooinney shoh y cherraghey orrin.

English: 29 ¶Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said, We ought to obey God rather than men.
Manx: Eisht dansoor Peddyr as ny ostyllyn elley, gra, Te kainlt dooin ve ny s’biallee da Jee na da deiney.

English: 30 The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom ye slew and hanged on a tree.
Manx: Ta Jee ny hayraghyn ain er hroggal seose Yeesey, ren shiuish y varroo as y chroghey er billey.

English: 31 Him hath God exalted with his right hand to be a Prince and a Saviour, for to give repentance to Israel, and forgiveness of sins.
Manx: Eshyn ta Jee er hoiaghey seose liorish e laue yesh, dy ve ny Phrince as ny Haualtagh, dy chur arrys da Israel as leih peccaghyn.

English: 32 And we are his witnesses of these things ; and so is also the Holy Ghost, whom God hath given to them that obey him.
Manx: As ta shinyn ny feanishyn echey jeh ny ta shin dy insh diu, as myr shen myrgeddin ta’n Spyrryd Noo, ta Jee er ny choyrt dauesyn ta cur biallys da.

English: 33 When they heard that, they were cut to the heart, and took counsel to slay them.
Manx: Tra cheayll ad shen, ghow ad dy feer olk rish, as hug ad nyn goyrle dy cheïley dy varroo ad.

English: 34 Then stood there up one in the council, a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reputation among all the people, and commanded to put the apostles forth a little space ;
Manx: Eisht hass seose ayns y choonceïl Pharisee dy row, va enmyssit Gamaliel, fer-ynsee jeh’n leigh, jeh va ooilley’n pobble jannoo soiagh mooar, as doardee Eh ny ostyllyn y chur magh tammylt beg,

English: 35 And said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh roo, Gheiney Israel, cur-jee tastey mie diu hene, cre ta shiu kiarrail y yannoo rish ny deiney shoh.

English: 36 For before these days rose up Theudas, boasting himself to be somebody ; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined themselves : who was slain ; and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered, and brought to nought.
Manx: Son roish ny laghyn shoh dirree Theudas seose, as hug Eh leid yn ennym mooar da hene, dy deiyr earroo dy gheiney mysh kiare cheead er : agh v’eshyn er ny varroo, as whilleen as hast da, haink skeayley as toyrt-mow nyn vud.

English: 37 After this man rose up Judas of Galilee in the days of the taxing, and drew away much people after him : he also perished ; and all, even as many as obeyed him, were dispersed.
Manx: Lurg y dooinney shoh dirree Judas dy Ghalilee seose, ayns laghyn y cheesh, as violee Eh ymmodee dy leih huggey : as v’eshyn myrgeddin er ny stroie, as dy chooilley annane deiyr er v’ad er nyn skeayley.

English: 38 And now I say unto you, Refrain from these men, and let them alone : for if this counsel or this work be of men, it will come to nought :
Manx: As nish ta mish gra riuish, Lig-jee fea da ny deiney shoh, as cur-jee eïe orroo : son my ta’n choyrle shoh, ny’n obbyr shoh jeh deiney, hed eh naardey :

English: 39 But if it be of God, ye cannot overthrow it ; lest haply ye be found even to fight against God.
Manx: Agh my she veih Jee te, cha vod shiuish y chur mow eh ; son cre veagh shen agh dy chaggey noi Jee hene?

English: 40 And to him they agreed : and when they had called the apostles, and beaten them, they commanded that they should not speak in the name of Jesus, and let them go.
Manx: As dasyn hug ad geill : as tra v’ad er n’eamagh er ny ostyllyn as er nyn mwoalley ad, hug ad saarey gyn ad dy loayrt ayns ennym Yeesey, as lig ad y raad daue.

English: 41 ¶And they departed from the presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name.
Manx: As hie ad magh veih fenish y choonceïl, goaill boggey dy row ad coontit feeu dy hurranse nearey son yn ennym echey.

English: 42 And daily in the temple, and in every house, they ceased not to teach and preach Jesus Christ.
Manx: As gagh laa ayns y chiamble, as veih thie dy thie, cha scuirr ad dy ynsaghey as dy phreacheil Yeesey Creest.
CAB. VI.

English: And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
Manx: As ayns ny laghyn shen tra va’n earroo ocsyn v’er jyndaa gys y chredjue er nyn mishaghey, daase ny Grecianee neu-wooiagh jeh ny Hebrewyn, son nagh row ayrn er ny chur da ny mraane-treoghe oc jeh ny va shirveishit gagh laa.

English: 2 Then the twelve called the multitude of the disciples unto them, and said, It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables.
Manx: Eisht deïe yn daa ostyl yeig er y cheshaght jeusyn v’er jyndaa gys y chredjue huc, as dooyrt ad, Cha vel eh resoonagh shinyn dy aagail goo Yee, dy hirveish buird.

English: 3 Wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.
Manx: Shen y fa, vraaraghyn, jeeagh-jee magh nyn mast’ eu son shiaght deiney dy ghoo mie, laane jeh’n Spyrryd Noo as jeh creenaght, dy vod mad nyn soiaghey ad gys yn obbyr shoh.

English: 4 But we will give ourselves continually to prayer, and to the ministry of the word.
Manx: Agh nee mainyn nyn draa y vaarail ayns padjer as shirveish yn goo.

English: 5 ¶And the saying pleased the whole multitude : and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Ghost, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas a proselyte of Antioch :
Manx: As va’n raa booisal da’n slane sheshaght : as reih ad Steaon, dooinney va laane dy chredjue as jeh’n Spyrryd Noo, as Philip, as Prochorus, as Nicanor, as Timon, as Parmenas, as Nicolas va ny phroselyte dy Antioch.

English: 6 Whom they set before the apostles : and when they had prayed, they laid their hands on them.
Manx: Ad shoh hoie ad kiongoyrt rish ny ostyllyn : as tra v’ad er ghoaill padjer, hug ad nyn laueyn orroo.

English: 7 And the word of God increased ; and the number of the disciples multiplied in Jerusalem greatly ; and a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith.
Manx: As ren goo Yee bishaghey ; as daase yn ocsyn v’er jyndaa gys y chredjue ny smoo as ny smoo ayns Jerusalem ; as haink sheshaght vooar jeh ny saggyrtyn dy ve biallagh gys y chredjue.

English: 8 And Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.
Manx: As va Steaon laane dy ghrayse as dy phooar, as ren Eh yindyssyn mooarey as mirrilyn mastey’n pobble.

English: 9 ¶Then there arose certain of the synagogue, which is called the synagogue of the Libertines, and Cyrenians, and Alexandrians, and of them of Cilicia and of Asia, disputing with Stephen.
Manx: Eisht dirree seose shiartance jeh’n cheeill ta enmyssit keeill ny Libertinee, as jeh ny Cyrenianee, as Alexandrianee, as jeusyn jeh Cilicia, as Asia, as loayr adsyn as Steaon noi ry hoi.

English: 10 And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the spirit by which he spake.
Manx: As cha row ad abyl shassoo magh noi’n chreenaght as y spyrryd v’eshyn loayrt lesh.

English: 11 Then they suborned men, which said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against Moses, and against God.
Manx: Eisht daill ad deiney dy ghra, Ta shin er chlashtyn Eh loayrt goan mollaghtagh noi Moses as noi Jee.

English: 12 And they stirred up the people, and the elders, and the scribes, and came upon him, and caught him, and brought him to the council,
Manx: As ghrennee ad yn pobble, as y chanstyr, as ny scruderyn, as haink ad as haare ad Eh, as hug ad lhieu Eh fenish y choonceïl,

English: 13 And set up false witnesses, which said, This man ceaseth not to speak blasphemous words against this holy place, and the law :
Manx: As hoie ad seose feanishyn foalsey, ren gra, Ta’n dooinney shoh kinjagh loayrt goan mollaghtagh noi yn ynnyd casherick shoh as y leigh.

English: 14 For we have heard him say, that this Jesus of Nazareth shall destroy this place, and shall change the customs which Moses delivered us.
Manx: Son ta shin er chlashtyn Eh gra, dy jean Yeesey shoh dy Nazareth yn ynnyd shoh y stroie, as ny oardaghyn y chaghlaa ren Moses y livrey dooin.

English: 15 And all that sat in the council, looking stedfastly on him, saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.
Manx: As yeeagh ooilley ny va ayns y choonceïl dy gyere er, as honnick ad yn eddin echey myr dy beagh eh eddin ainle.
CAB. VII.

English: Then said the high priest, Are these things so?
Manx: Eisht dooyrt yn ard-saggyrt, Nee shoh myr te?

English: 2 And he said, Men, brethren, and fathers, hearken ; The God of glory appeared unto our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran,
Manx: As dooyrt eshyn, Gheiney, vraaraghyn, as ayraghyn, eaisht-jee, Ren Jee ny ghloyr Eh hene y hoilshaghey da nyn ayr Abraham, tra v’eh ayns Mesopotamia, roish my row Eh cummal ayns Charran.

English: 3 And said unto him, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.
Manx: As dooyrt Eh rish, Gow magh veih dty cheer hene, as dty chynney hene, as tarr gys y cheer neem’s y yeeaghyn dhyt.

English: 4 Then came he out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and dwelt in Charran : and from thence, when his father was dead, he removed him into this land, wherein ye now dwell.
Manx: Eisht haink Eh magh ass cheer ny Caldeanee, as ren Eh vaghey ayns Charran : as veih shen, lurg baase e ayr, scugh Eh Eh gys y cheer shoh raad ta shiuish nish vaghey.

English: 5 And he gave him none inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on : yet he promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when as yet he had no child.
Manx: As cha dug Eh eiraght erbee da ayn, wheesh as liead trie : foast yiall Eh dy jinnagh Eh da eh dy ve leshyn, as lesh e heeloghe ny yei, tra v’eh foast fegooish sluight.

English: 6 And God spake on this wise, That his seed should sojourn in a strange land ; and that they should bring them into bondage, and entreat them evil four hundred years.
Manx: As loayr Jee er yn aght shoh, Dy row yn sluight echey dy vaghey ayns cheer joarree, (as dy vreillagh ad ad fo bondiaght, as dy dellagh ad dy holk roo) kiare cheead bleïn.

English: 7 And the nation to whom they shall be in bondage will I judge, said God : and after that shall they come forth, and serve me in this place.
Manx: As yn ashoon shen daue vees ad ayns bondiaght nee’ms y vriwnys dooyrt Jee : as ny lurg shen hig ad magh, as shirveishee ad mee ayns shoh.

English: 8 And he gave him the covenant of circumcision : and so Abraham begat Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day ; and Isaac begat Jacob ; and Jacob begat the twelve patriarchs.
Manx: As hug Eh da conaant y yiarey-chymmylt : as myr shen hooar Abraham Isaac, as ren Eh Eh y yiarey[-]chymmylt er y hoghtoo laa, as hooar Isaac Jacob, as Jacob yn daa phatriarch jeig.

English: 9 And the patriarchs, moved with envy, sold Joseph into Egypt : but God was with him,
Manx: Agh ny patriarchyn troo mysh Joseph, as chreck ad Eh gys Egypt : agh va Jee mârish.

English: And delivered him out of all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt ; and he made him governor over Egypt and all his house.
Manx: 10. As livrey Eh Eh veih ooilley e heaghyn, as hug Eh da foayr as creenaght ayns shilley Pharaoh ree Egypt ; as ren Eh Eh ny chiannoort er Egypt, as ooilley e hie.

English: 11 Now there came a dearth over all the land of Egypt and Chanaan, and great affliction : and our fathers found no sustenance.
Manx: Nish haink genney harrish ooilley cheer Egypt as Chanaan, as seaghyn mooar ; as cha dod ny ayraghyn ain beaghey y gheddyn.

English: 12 But when Jacob heard that there was corn in Egypt, he sent out our fathers first.
Manx: Agh tra cheayll Jacob dy row arroo ayns Egypt, hug eh magh ny ayraghyn ain hoshiaght.

English: 13 And at the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren ; and Joseph’s kindred was made known unto Pharaoh.
Manx: As yn nah cheayrt hooar braaraghyn Joseph fys dy nee Eh v’ayn ; as va soilshaghey jeant da Pharaoh jeh kynney Yoseph.

English: 14 Then sent Joseph, and called his father Jacob to him, and all his kindred, threescore and fifteen souls.
Manx: Eisht hug Joseph fys, as deïe Eh er yn ayr echey Jacob huggey, as ooilley e chynney, three feed as queig anmeenyn jeig.

English: 15 So Jacob went down into Egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,
Manx: As hie Jacob sheese gys Egypt, as hooar Eh baase, Eh hene as ny ayraghyn ain,

English: 16 And were carried over into Sychem, and laid in the sepulchre that Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the father of Sychem.
Manx: As v’ad er nyn goyrt lhieu gys Sichem, as er nyn oanluckey ayns yn oaie va Abraham er chionnaghey son sim dy argid, veih meck Emmor ayr Sichem.

English: 17 But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,
Manx: Agh tra va earish yn yialdyn, va Jee er vreearrey da Abraham, tayrn er-gerrey, daase yn pobble, as vishee ad ayns Egypt,

English: 18 Till another king arose, which knew not Joseph.
Manx: Derrey dirree ree elley, echey nagh row bione da Joseph.

English: 19 The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.
Manx: Ghell Eh shoh dy foalsey rish y chynney ain, as hug Eh drogh chorrym da nyn ayraghyn, myr shen dy dug Eh orroo nyn gloan veggey y hilgey magh, son nagh beagh ad bio.

English: 20 In which time Moses was born, and was exceeding fair, and nourished up in his father’s house three months :
Manx: Ayns y traa shoh rugg Moses, as va taitnys ec Jee ayn, as va kiarrail goit jeh three meeghyn ayns thie e ayrey :

English: 21 And when he was cast out, Pharaoh’s daughter took him up, and nourished him for her own son.
Manx: As tra v’eh er ny chur magh, ghow inneen Pharaoh Eh, as hrog ee Eh son e mac hene.

English: 22 And Moses was learned in all the wisdom of the Egyptians, and was mighty in words and in deeds.
Manx: As hie Moses er ynsaghey ayns ooilley creenaght ny Egyptianee, as v’eh pooaral ayns goo as Jannoo.

English: 23 And when he was full forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brethren the children of Israel.
